description.hltext_display: Radar scam case ruling draws mixed reaction
description.content:
Picketers outside the London Court yesterday.
There has been mixed reaction â but mainly negative â to yesterdayâs decision by a British court to fine a British defence contractor linked to the sale of a radar system to Tanzania.
A number of senior public officials were implicated in the controversial deal which has been at the centre of raging public debate for years now.
Most people interviewed by this paper yesterday expressed dismay, anger and frustration over the ruling, saying what Tanzanians had expected was to see people associated with the shady deal appearing before courts of law to answer charges against them.
Some said the ruling was clear proof of double standards by foreign international organisations which keep lecturing African countries on the virtues of good governance, transparency and accountability for African nations while acting to the contrary. However, a few voices were of the view that the UK court had played its part and it was upon those aggrieved by the ruling to seek justice elsewhere.
In the ruling, BAE Systems has been fined Â£500,000 for failing to keep proper records of payments it made to an adviser in Tanzania - in a radar purchase scandal that involved high-profile government figures in Tanzaniaâs third-phase (Benjamin Mkapa) government.
The UK defence contracting company paid Â£7.7m to two firms controlled by businessman Shailesh Vithlani ahead of winning a Â£28m Tanzanian military radar contract.
The ruling by a judge at Southwark Crown Court came after BAE had already agreed a deal with the UK governmentâs Serious Fraud Office (SFO).
Under the agreement struck between the SFO and BAE, the company would deduct the fine from the Â£30m it had offered to the people of Tanzania to settle the case.
Presiding Judge David Bean said he was under pressure to keep the court fine to a minimum, elaborating: âThe structure of this settlement agreement places moral pressure on the court to keep the fine to a minimum so that the reparation is kept at a maximum.â
He criticised another part of the deal which he said gave any member of BAE Systems group âblanket immunity for all offences committed in the past, whether disclosed or notâ.
He said the agreement was loosely and hastily drafted, adding: âTodayâs judgment concludes and draws a line under this historical matter. The company accepts the decision of the court and will abide by it,â BAE said in a statement.
Contacted for comment, fiery Simanjiro legislator Christopher ole Sendeka said it was sad that the ruling by the UK court âhas fallen awfully short of exposing high-profile government personalities involved in the controversial radar dealâ.
He said Tanzanians were dying to know the people involved in the deal and thereafter see âappropriateâ legal measures being taken against them.
âInstead of exposing the persons involved, the court merely fined the UK army company. In my opinion, the ruling was aimed at safeguarding the status of the few untouchable people in the government and leadership circles,â said the MP.
He recommended that African leaders learn from the radar case ruling and refrain from entering into agreements with âcorrupt and non-transparentâ international companies.
He blamed foreign and international organisations for practising double standards, saying they preach transparency and accountability to African nations while at the same time supporting corrupt deals.
âWe have seen some of these organisations championing corrupt dealings and readily shouldering the burden of paying fines in order to hide evils committed by high-ranking government personalities,â Sendeka pointed out.
All that Prevention and Combating of Corruption Bureau Director General Dr Edward Hoseah would say when contacted for comment yesterday was: âI am in a situation where I cannot talk with anybody, please.â
Former Attorney General Andrew Chenge, one of the people suspected to be behind the controversial radar purchase deal, said: âI am now in Bariadi (his Shinyanga Region constituency) discussing issues with my electorate.â
âI cannot say anything on the ruling for now because I have neither seen nor read itâ¦I must understand the context of the ruling before making any comments,â he added, promising to give his stand after going through the ruling.
The probeâs conclusion leaves BAE free to focus on dealing with an age of austerity in defence spending at home and abroad, according to Reuters.
The fine follows an enquiry into a 28 million pound deal to sell radar systems to Tanzania for use at Dar es Salaam airport, the biggest and busiest in the country.
âThe residue of the agreed 30 million pounds will be paid by BAE to the people of Tanzania by a mechanism yet to be agreed,â an SFO spokesman told Reuters.
The court had been expected to sentence BAE on Monday but Justice Bean said he could not sentence the company without hearing more evidence.
Bean wanted to know what payments of around 8 million pounds â made to companies controlled by Tanzanian businessman Shailesh Vithlani between January 2000 and December 2005 â were used for before deciding on the fine.
âThe victims of this way of obtaining business, if I have correctly analysed it, are not the people of the UK, but the people of Tanzania,â said the judge in his sentencing notes.
âThe airport at Dar es Salaam could no doubt have had a new radar system for a good deal less than $40million if $12million had not been paid to Vithlani,â he added.
The judge explained that BAE now had higher ethical standards than in the past after criticisms made by Lord Woolf, the former Lord Chief Justice, in a 2008 review of its business ethics. âIn the decade since the conduct referred to in this settlement occurred, the company has systematically enhanced its compliance policies,â BAE said.
Justice Bean said BAEâs plea deal with the SFO had been hastily drafted and he could not âsentence (BAE) for an offence which the prosecution failed to chargeâ, such as false accounting or conspiracy to corrupt.

description.hltext_display: Cash loan today: Easy funds to disperse off temporary cash crisis
description.content:
If suppose you are employed with a fixed and regular income source, it does not necessarily mean that all your financial problems will be over in a moment. There are certain expenses, which are always unaccounted for and have a tendency to come up, at a time, when you are in the midst of a crisis. Naturally, it is not possible to avoid these expenses and it is you who will have to take measures, so as to overcome the same. For the same reason, you can certainly opt for the provision of cash loan today.
This financial option does offer you payday loans today, which then can be used to sort out any impending crisis. In fact, the loan amount sourced can be used to deal with expenses related to paying credit card dues, emergency medical bills, house hold expenses, car accidental repair and so forth. Moreover, the loan being released for a short term period do offer you the chance to attain the same, without involving any collateral. Apart from these, the no credit check approval of the funds makes it possible for the applicants with multiple credit default to attain the funds.
If you are employed with a minimum monthly income of Â£1000 and have access to a valid checking account, then you can certainly avail the services of this loan. Apart from these, you must be a resident of UK and that your age should be more than 18 years.
It is on meeting these key requirements that you will be considered eligible for the loan. Under the aegis of this loan, you are free to borrow any amount in the range of Â£100-Â£1500. The repayment tenure is short and generally spans over a period of 14- 30 days. Although the interest rate levied is marginally high, viable rates can be sourced by undertaking a detailed research.Â You can also compare the quotes, using the online mode, so as to get access to the best possible terms.
Ultimately, it is only with the assistance of cash loan today, that you get to avail quick and instant monetary relief.

description.hltext_display: Murphy Oil Set to Possibly Pullback after Yesterday's Rally of 0.95% (MUR)
description.content:
Murphy Oil (NYSE:MUR) traded in a range yesterday that spanned from a low of $72.77 to a high of $73.62. Yesterday, the shares gained 0.95%, which took the trading range above the 3-day high of $73.10 on volume of 980,000 shares. Often times after large one-day gains, short term traders will seek to take profits and, as such, investors should be cautious.
Shares of Murphy Oil are currently trading above their 50-day moving average (MA) of $67.38 and above their 200-day MA of $58.71. Look for the MA to provide support for a short-term pullback in the shares.
SmarTrend currently has shares of Murphy Oil in an Uptrend and issued the Uptrend alert on July 23, 2010 at $53.72. The stock has risen 35.5% since the Uptrend alert was issued.
SmarTrend expects the share price to pullback toward the $73.10 support level. Afterwards, we expect it to move upward with its peers in the SmarTrend Major Integrated Oil & Gas industry.
Keywords: murphy oil trading range stock news

description.hltext_display: Petition to release Asia Bibi started by Warren Throckmorton attracting Americans
description.content:
(PCP) An American Evangelist Warren Throckmorton joined campaign to release a week ago but his petition on www.change.org have attracted more than five hundred Americans who have signed petition subject to âTell Pakistan Not to Execute Asia Noreen Bibiâ
The www.asianews.it is also campaigning for release of Asia Bibi and have received more than 8,000 signatures while Spanish Christians have signed more than 60,000 appeals for Asia Bibi. There is signature campaign in Pakistan and United Kingdom also.
The petition started by Mr. Warren Throckmorton is also addressed to President Asif Zardari (President, Pakistan), Syed Mumtaz Alam Gillani (Minister of Human Rights, Pakistan), and Husain Haqqani (Pakistani Ambassador to the United States)
Mr. Warren Throckmorton says âWriting in 1954, psychologist Gordon Allport said, âThe role of religion is paradoxical. It makes prejudice and it unmakes prejudice.â In no case is Allportâs observation better illustrated than in the tragic situation of Asia Noreen Bibi. On Monday, NPRâs Julie McCarthy chronicled the story of Bibi, a 45 year-old, Christian mother of five who is now in a Pakistani jail with a death sentence over her head. Her crime? She was convicted last month of blaspheming the prophet Muhammad, which under Pakistanâs draconian blasphemy laws, allowed the court to sentence her to death. Although no person has yet been executed under these laws, local Muslim extremists, including those representing the Taliban, have threatened violence if she is not executed. Bibi has been in prison for over a year, awaiting the resolution of her fate, after being arrested following a verbal altercation with Muslim co-workers. According to reports, the Muslim women refused to accept water from her, calling her âuncleanâ due to her faith. She reportedly defended herself and then later was detained by the women, who tried to convert her. When this failed, Bibi was arrested and held in isolation until recently when the sentence of death was handed down. Last week, Imam Maulana Yousuf Qureshi, who once gained international notoriety by calling for the murder of Danish cartoonists who drew caricatures of Muhammad, issued a $5800 reward for the murder of Bibi. Qureshi said that Muslim extremists will kill Bibi if she is freed. Asia Bibiâs case requires an international outcry from people of all religious views. The bullying and murder of minority religious adherents in Pakistan must stop. Call upon the Pakistani government to free Asia Bibi and to guarantee safety for her and her familyâ
Pakistan Christian Post appeals to every one to join signature campaign for release of Asia Bibi.
Find petition on this link: If link not active, please, copy/paste in your browser to view it:

Muslim extremists will kill Bibi if she is freed.

description.hltext_display: Very Bad Credit Personal Loans â Accomplish your Individual Desires
description.content:
As our wants are limitless whatever we earn does not accomplish all our needs. But if you are a bad creditor and have bad credit rating then you find it difficult to apply for a credit so at such times you can take the help of very bad credit personal loans. As it can solve all your personal needs.
The amount that is given to the applicant can range from Â£1000 to Â£25000 and so the time period that is offered can be for 1- 10 years. These finances can in the appearance of unsecured and secured form. In unsecured credit the borrower does not have to lay any collateral and so the interest that is charged is also high. However in secured form the candidate does to place his property as security and so a lower rate of interest is charged. If in case the applicant fails to make the repayment ion time then he will be charged with a penalty fee.
The applicant can make use of very bad credit personal loans as and when needed. You can also use them for paying off your other bills like electrical energy bills, telephone charges, library fees, and all the expenses which are yet pending. All can avail this credit there is no need to set back because of bad credit.
To be eligible the borrower should properly follow the eligibility criteria that involves the borrower should be above 18 years of age, he should have a valid bank account, and he should have a citizenship of UK.
As the online mode is easy and opportune any one can apply for this credit. There the most benefit of this advance is that the applicant can chose the lender of his choice. After satisfying all the facts the lender verifies them and then offers the finance to the candidate.
Â

description.hltext_display: Credit unions busy helping community
description.content:
Courtesy photo Employees of Granite State CU, Guardian Angel CU, NH Federal CU, Service CU and NH Credit Union League assisted at the Make-A-Wish Foundation of NH Holiday Reunion Party this season.
PORTSMOUTH â The New Hampshire Credit Union League, which represents New Hampshire's 26 consumer-owned credit unions, is pleased to announce that credit unions throughout the Greater-Seacoast area are generously supporting local charities, along with U.S. Military Service members this holiday season.
Service Credit Union, Northeast Credit Union, NH Federal Credit Union, Granite State Credit Union, Holy Rosary Credit Union and Seacoast Credit Union have been active this holiday supporting needs ranging from winter clothing drives for children to providing gift cards for members of the U.S. military serving overseas.
"While credit unions in New Hampshire come in different sizes and serve different fields of membership, credit unions share a common commitment to improve the quality of life in NH. The NHCUL actively supports and encourages credit unions in their community outreach efforts," said Michael L'Ecuyer, NHCUL Chairman of the Board.
For more information, visit www.gocuorg.

Vatican urges prudence in reading leaked embassy cables
description.content:
Papal News,Vatican News, Editorial,
Related Stories
Holy See Press Office director, Fr Federico Lombardi, has asked for careful evaluation and âgreat prudenceâ in the examination of confidential files leaked by WikiLeaks to media outlets. The content of sensitive internal US State Department cables concerning the Vatican, written by representatives from the US Embassy to the Holy See, was made public Dec 11.
In a statement that day, Fr Lombardi stressed that the reports âreflect the perceptions and opinions of the people who wrote them.â He emphasized that the cables âcannot be considered as expressions of the Holy See itself, nor as exact quotations of the words of its officials. Their reliability must, then, be evaluated carefully and with great prudence, bearing this circumstance in mind.â Only one of the Vatican-related cables had been released prior to Dec 10.
However, over the course of the day, a barrage of articles on additional cables surfaced. Five newspapers, the New York Times, Britainâs The Guardian, Franceâs Le Monde, Germanyâs Der Spiegel and Spainâs El Pais, reported on documents concerning the Vatican. These five media outlets are thought to be in exclusive possession of the âCablegateâ briefs. They span the last decade uncovering the US Embassyâs perceptions of Vatican positions on a variety of themes.
In a file from February 2009 labelled âconfidential,â Julieta Valls Noyes, the second-in-command at the US Embassy to the Holy See wrote down her vision of communications within the Vatican. The cable came shortly after Pope Benedict XVI lifted the excommunication of a bishop without knowing that he denied the extent of the Holocaust. Valls pointed to a âcommunication gapâ that marked âthe challenge of governing a hierarchical yet decentralized organization,â as well as âleadership weaknesses at the top, and an undervaluing of (and ignorance about) 21st century communications.â
She added that these problems have resulted in âmuddled, reactive messaging that reduces the volume of the moral megaphone the Vatican uses to advance its objectives.â In a separate cable from just weeks earlier, Valls commented that the Pope âsometimes bewilders politicians and journalists by pursuing what he believes is in the best interest of the Church.â
She added that âVatican outsiders lament decisions or policies that they perceive as being out-of-step with the new millennium, and call for the Church to be more modern and accommodating. âWhat these observers fail to recognize is the consistency of the Holy Seeâs decisions and behaviour on key issues like the reunification of the Church or the dignity of all human beings â and the value of that consistency. âRegardless of whether outsiders agree or disagree with the Holy See, itâs hard to dispute its moral influence, geographic reach, and ability to grab headlines,â she wrote.
âThese qualities can make the Vatican a formidable partner for the US and other nations in the pursuit of common objectives.â In a cable from July 2001, the embassy spoke of the Vatican as a âsupra-national power,â with limited territory but extensive influence in the world. The Vatican-related cables numbering over 800 form just a small part of the more than alleged 250,000 secret and confidential documents due for release by WikiLeaks.

Cash Loans to Your Door: Cash Right at Your Door
description.content:
Do you get scared to apply for loans just because of the queries and delay involved in the loan process? Do you require fast and easy cash?Â It can be achievable only if you make an appeal for cash loans to your door. These finances are made available to the borrower at his door step. These funds have exclusive features such as they are made available at viable rates which make refunding less troublesome. If you are suffering with poor financial standing still you can avail funds without any difficulty. Moreover the borrower need not face the prolonged loan process and credit checks.
The lenders agent comes to your place to offer you the amount and in the same approach the same agent who offers you money at your door comes to collect the reimbursement. You can repay the money as per your budget and comfort, but within the given duration of time. Borrowers can avail the amount ranging from Â£ 50 - Â£ 500. These funds are offered for duration of 30 days. If the borrower has any problem in refunding the amount on the due date, then the borrower has the option to extend the repayment period but by informing the lender about it. In such a situation the applicant will have to pay some penalty fee.
The application process is very quick and simple. What the borrower needs to do is fill the online loan application form with his essential details. Once the lender verifies the given information an agent appointed by the lender delivers the requested loan amount at your door. Or if you need cash right in your bank account then you need tell the borrower to do so and within few hours your cash gets delivered in your bank account.
The applicant can borrow even with his bad credit history.

description.hltext_display: AFC East: From frying pan to fire for Dolphins' Sparano
description.content: (Sports Network) - April showers bring May flowers. And playoff elimination yields coaching pontification. That's the environment in which Miami Dolphins head coach Tony Sparano finds himself as the season winds down for two now-meaningless games after the Dolphins were mathematically KO'd from playoff consideration by a 17-14 home loss to Buffalo on Sunday. Surprise champions of the AFC East two seasons ago and a formidable late-summer entity this year after acquiring prolific wide receiver Brandon Marshall, the Dolphins have instead floundered in key spots throughout while tumbling to third in the division behind 12-win New England and the 10-win New York Jets. The loss to the Bills puts Miami at 7-7 overall, just 1-6 at home and 6-1 on the road. And it puts Sparano and his staff on the hot seat heading into a potentially turbulent offseason. "It's easy to point blame, fellas," Sparano said at a Monday media gathering. "I get it. It comes with the territory. That's just the way it goes." Sparano provided a public endorsement of embattled offensive coordinator Dan Henning, just a day after the Dolphins scored less than 20 points for the eighth time in 14 games -- including three straight in December. Henning came out of retirement in 2008 to join Sparano's staff and was widely lauded for his use of then-starting quarterback Chad Pennington along with unveiling the Wildcat offensive package with running back Ronnie Brown. This season, he's been vilified in South Florida for the Dolphins' offensive inconsistency. Henning is widely expected to re-retire after the Jan. 2 finale against the Patriots, which will come after Miami hosts 4-10 Detroit this weekend. "I think that Dan Henning for Tony Sparano has been tremendous, and I think that the guy has done a wonderful job here in my time here," Sparano said. "I look at the entire body of work. "He's the same guy that we were all talking about, [saying] 'Man, oh man, he finds ways to use the personnel to the best of their ability.' That was you people saying that. Not me. I would tell you that for Tony Sparano, Dan Henning has been tremendous." Sparano's own job security has been the stuff of whispers as well, particularly after Miami was reportedly among the destinations on Bill Cowher's wish list should the former Pittsburgh coach come back to the NFL sidelines next season. The return of ESPN analyst Jon Gruden has also been discussed in the Sunshine State, largely because of his Super Bowl success with Tampa Bay in 2002. Cowher's career record is 149-90-1 in the regular season and 12-9 in the playoffs, and his Steelers won a Super Bowl title after the 2005 season. Gruden is 95-81 in regular-season play and 5-4 in the postseason. Sparano's regular-season and postseason records are 25-21 and 0-1, respectively. "I just need to get my team ready to play this week," Sparano said in reference to his status. "That's all I need to do. That's my concern. Get the team ready to play the Detroit Lions this week. Everything else is out of my control. Let somebody else deal with it." BILLS: Don't look now...but here come the Buffalo Bills. Okay, sure, head coach Chan Gailey & Co. have long been eliminated from playoff contention after an ugly 0-8 start, but four wins in six games since has got the lone NFL team based in New York state harkening back to its home city's old 1980's marketing tagline -- "Talkin' Proud." "It's always good to win a game, and I tell you what, what is hard for me to figure out is how we can win these games when we started out with no players," owner Ralph C. Wilson said on Sunday after an impromptu visit to the locker room following a 17-14 defeat of the Miami Dolphins at Sun Life Stadium. "Our drafts in the last 10 years have been terrible. So I mean, these guys, before each play you read the scorecard to see who's in there. That's what amazes me. We pick up a guy in the middle of the week and he starts on Sunday." The Bills ended the season-starting losing skid with a 14-12 win over visiting Detroit on Nov. 14 and made it two straight with a road victory at Cincinnati seven days later. Consecutive losses to Pittsburgh and Minnesota followed to drop the team's record to 2-10, but good feeling has since returned with a 13-6 win over Cleveland and the successful trip to South Florida. "Chan has done a great job and the players have played hard," Wilson said. "It's amazing. This team amazes me. I guess it's because they play hard. A lot of [the players] were overlooked in the draft. A lot of them were cut by other teams that didn't have enough patience with them. All of those things play into it. So we should be much, much better next year." On Sunday, Buffalo was outgained by 44 yards and had seven fewer first downs than the Dolphins, but nonetheless scored the game's first 10 points and never trailed, limiting Miami to just one scoring drive in each half. On the other side, Dolphins linebacker and NFL sack leader Cameron Wake was held to just one quarterback pressure and two tackles, allowing Bills quarterback Ryan Fitzpatrick to complete 16-of-26 passes for 223 yards and touchdowns to wide receivers David Nelson and Steve Johnson. "We had a tough time running the ball [Sunday], but up front the protection was good," Fitzpatrick said. "[The linemen] did a great job all day keeping me clean. You can't say enough about those guys up front just in terms of the patchwork and guys getting plugged into spots." JETS: One day after the New York Jets' highest-quality win of the season's second half, the team held its collective breath on the results of an MRI on the right shoulder of quarterback Mark Sanchez. But the University of Southern California product, who completed 19-of-29 passes for 170 yards, ran for a touchdown and most importantly, didn't turn the ball over in a 22-17 road defeat of the Pittsburgh Steelers, was pronounced fit to start this weekend's game against the Chicago Bears at Soldier Field. "Precautionary," Jets head coach Rex Ryan said of the MRI. "Anytime it's your quarterback, you're going to make sure he's okay. Like I said, the MRI was a positive thing for us." According to Ryan, Sanchez was hurt on New York's second drive of Sunday's game. On third-and-18 from the Pittsburgh 34-yard line, he scrambled and was sacked by ex-Jets linebacker James Farrior. The injury is being called a sore throwing shoulder and Ryan said Sanchez may be slightly limited in this week's practices in preparation for the Bears. The young signal-caller's backup is 40-year-old Mark Brunell, who threw exactly 30 passes last season while backing up Drew Brees in New Orleans. "[Sanchez's] arm was in an awkward position," Ryan said of the injury. "It never affected him. He played the whole game. He played great. He really did. As somebody said, 'Maybe this should happen to you in all these games', because he played great." Sanchez scored the Jets' first offensive touchdown since Nov. 25 on a fourth- and-goal play-action bootleg in the third quarter. He was not sacked against the Steelers after being hit four times in a Dec. 6 loss to the New England Patriots and sacked six times by the Miami Dolphins in Week 14. Offensive tackle Damien Woody was lost for the season with a knee injury in the 10-6 loss to Miami, but Pittsburgh's duo of James Harrison and LaMarr Woodley was kept away from Sanchez largely through the efforts of Wayne Hunter, who took over Woody's starting spot on the right side. "Wayne stepped in, did a great job," said Ryan. Reserve lineman Rob Turner was used in many packages as a tight end as well, a strategy that may be repeated against Chicago's Julius Peppers and Israel Idonije. The win largely solidified New York's position as a playoff team, maintaining its two-game lead over San Diego and Jacksonville in the chase for the AFC's final Wild Card position. The Jets can guarantee a spot with a win in either of their final two games, either at Chicago this week or at home with Buffalo on Jan. 2. If the postseason began today, the Jets would earn the conference's No. 6 seed and visit Kansas City in the opening round of the AFC Playoffs on the weekend of Jan. 8-9. PATRIOTS: Okay, so perhaps arguably the NFL's best team isn't quite unbeatable. In spite of a 31-27 win over Green Bay on Sunday that pushed their record to a league-best 12-2 and all but clinched home-field advantage throughout the imminent AFC playoffs, the New England Patriots weren't pulling muscles patting themselves on the back in the aftermath. The AFC East leaders faced a first-time starting quarterback in the Packers' Matt Flynn, but nonetheless fell behind by 10 points early and had to rally again late to secure the four-point win. New England was also dominated in time of possession, with Green Bay controlling the ball for 40:48 to the Patriots' 19:12. "I thought [the Packers] were a very good football team, and they played like it," Patriots quarterback Tom Brady said. "These games are hard to win any way you're looking at them. They played very well. "From the opening kickoff, I knew that, okay, this is going to be one of those games. This is the way it's going to go." Brady passed for just 163 yards and was sacked three times, but connected on two scoring throws and extended his single-season league-record streak to 292 straight attempts without an interception. "I'm sure we lost the field position battle. And we overcame a bunch of penalties," he said. "I don't think we played our best game certainly, but I'm also very proud of the fact that we won the game." Specifically cited for praise by New England head coach Bill Belichick was defensive lineman Vince Wilfork, a seventh-year man from the University of Miami who was on the field for an unusually large number of plays (74) thanks to the Packers' clock domination and some Patriots injuries. Wilfork was credited with six tackles and recovered a Flynn fumble on teammate Tully Banta-Cain's sack on the final play of the game. "I thought Vince did a terrific job for us," Belichick said. "He was out there for a lot of plays -- 74 plays or whatever it was -- but it was a lot. I thought he played hard. He really had an outstanding game. "[The Packers] had a lot of attention directed at him, which is understandable, but he had a bunch of double-teams and slides on the protection coming his way and those types of things. He really played hard, played well, and did a lot of things to help us win. I thought he was outstanding, probably one of the best games he's played. He's played a lot of good ones, but I'd say that's one of the best ones he's played around here."

description.hltext_display: Cash loans online: Open Possibility to Tackle with Any Fiscal Crisis
description.content:
Man's life is not ruled by money or any other fiscal support but sometimes, some unfavorable and unforeseen fiscal problems can take place in your lives that need quick treatment. But as the cash loans online have been intended just to give you a quick cash back up, you have great chances to smile in any adverse condition. So, feel relaxed when an emergency comes to you and you are totally out of funds. Just open the door of money by applying for the cash loans online that will do miracle for you!
Cash loans online are available in both of the secured and unsecured forms and you can get rid of any small or long term need. If there is need of big loan sum and there is no problem of placing collateral, the secured cash loans will be the worth choice to opt for. On the other hand, the unsecured loans will be the perfect tools in your hand to cover any cash crunch with ease. As they are approved in the both forms, the arranged loan amount is arranged according to loan nature. The loan sum arranged by cash loans online ranges from 100 pounds to 25000 pounds with repayment duration of one month to 10 years.
Opt for the hassle-free online mode of getting cash support, as these loans are quickly sanctioned by the online lenders. They don't ask you to wait for fiscal help for more than 24 hours, if the form is filled up with the right information. In case, there is no proper information, the process can take a while, so beware of filling out the application form!

description.hltext_display: Pros, contras
description.content:
J.J. Barea contento por la llegada de Pitino
Tags: basquetbol, nba (generic), dallas mavericks
SAN JUAN, Puerto Rico -- A pesar de que Rick Pitino es catalogado como uno de los mejores tÃ©cnicos colegiales de Estados Unidos, su nombramiento como dirigente de la escuadra nacional de Puerto Rico para los compromisos internacionales en el 2011 fue recibido con opiniones conflictivas.
El compromiso de Pitino comienza con el evento preolÃ­mpico que definirÃ¡ dos plazas para la mÃ¡xima justa mundial a celebrarse en el 2012 en Inglaterra.
En conferencia de prensa celebrada en la sede del ComitÃ© OlÃ­mpico de Puerto Rico (COPUR), varios lÃ­deres deportivos del paÃ­s endosaron la firma del cotizado mentor para sustituir al nativo Manolo CintrÃ³n. Entre los que ocuparon la mesa presidencial estaban el Dr. David E. Bernier, mÃ¡ximo lÃ­der del deporte en el paÃ­s, asÃ­ como los licenciados Henry Neumann, Secretario de RecreaciÃ³n y Deportes; Carlos J. BeltrÃ¡n, presidente y director general de la FederaciÃ³n de Baloncesto y Jenaro 'Tuto' Marchand, secretario emÃ©ritos de FIBA AmÃ©rica, mÃ¡ximo rector del deporte del balÃ³n y el aro en el hemisferio.
Todos avalaron y aprobaron la contrataciÃ³n de Pitino, lo que marcarÃ¡ el regreso de un tÃ©cnico estadounidense a la escuadra boricua, la cual es valorada por miles de fanÃ¡ticos en la llamada Isla del Encanto. SerÃ¡ la primera ocasiÃ³n desde 1987 que un coach definido como extranjero asuma las riendas del quinteto, que por Ãºltima vez lo piloteÃ³ el reconocido Gene Bartow en los Juegos Panamericanos de ese aÃ±o en IndianÃ¡polis.
La justificaciÃ³n para la importante movida se debe, segÃºn explicaron de forma independiente cada lÃ­der, es la no clasificaciÃ³n directa de Puerto Rico en los Ãºltimos torneos clasificatorios de mayor envergadura. Los boricuas han jugado en las pasados Mundiales y Olimpiadas, pero han sido por invitaciÃ³n y no por derecho adquirido. El Ãºltimo evento clasificatorio por mÃ©rito propio fue en el preolÃ­mpico de 2003 jugado en San Juan, que les permitiÃ³ ver acciÃ³n en justa celebrada en Atenas, Grecia, en la que finalizaron en una sexta posiciÃ³n.
"Para la FederaciÃ³n, la posibilidad de tener un equipo del prestigio y nivel de Rick Pitino, nos traen grandes emociones, ya que hacemos una aportaciÃ³n no sÃ³lo al baloncesto sino al pueblo de Puerto Rico, dijo BeltrÃ¡n, sobre el nuevo tÃ©cnico, considerado uno de los mejores a nivel colegial.
El lÃ­der del baloncesto en la Isla aprovechÃ³ la ocasiÃ³n para anunciar a su vez que Pitino recibirÃ¡ en la Universidad de Louisville a seis candidatos del patio, que serÃ¡n evaluados para definir quiÃ©n serÃ¡ la persona escogida para fungir como uno de sus asistentes. Los elegidos, que no fueron identificados, se dividirÃ¡n en dos grupos para ir en dos fines de semana, el primero del 23 al 25 de enero y el segundo del 11 al 13 de febrero, para participar en los entrenamientos de la prestigiosa instituciÃ³n.
"AsÃ­ tendremos un paso de avance para poder trabajar con los jugadores", explicÃ³ sobre la persona seleccionado, que deberÃ¡ seguir un plan para darle seguimiento a los diferentes jugadores en Puerto Rico, mientras el tÃ©cnico en propiedad se integra con todo su grupo de trabajo. Se espera que Pitino llegue al paÃ­s en abril para ver algunos partidos del campeonato local del Baloncesto Superior Nacional, para luego convocar a los 10 canasteros en adiciÃ³n a los enebeÃ­stas Carlos Arroyo y JosÃ© Juan Barea, quienes se acuartelarÃ¡n en los Estados Unidos antes de la primera competencia oficial en agosto del 2011.
Una de las figuras principales en el reclutamiento de Pitino lo fue el empresario Joel Katz, apoderado de los Gigantes de Carolina, quien iniciÃ³ todas las gestiones para contactar al reputado dirigente norteamericano. Al momento de que ESPN Deportes le pidiera su comentario sobre el beneficio de traer a un dirigente extranjero de regreso al Equipo Nacional, no titubeÃ³ al resaltar las cualidades del tÃ©cnico.
"Hay grandes dirigentes puertorriqueÃ±os y de otras nacionalidades, y quiero quitar que la decisiÃ³n se tomÃ³ basado en cualquier nacionalidad. Nosotros como FederaciÃ³n y parte del equipo de trabajo de Carlos BeltrÃ¡n, tratamos de conseguir el mejor dirigente que estaba disponible", explicÃ³ el tambiÃ©n dirigente del quinteto gigante.
"En tÃ©rminos tÃ©cnicos, en los tiempos que estamos viviendo hoy, Rick Pitino es un gran dirigente con un gran pedigree que va a poder aportar mucho al desarrollo, no sÃ³lo a nuestros jugadores de baloncesto, sino a nuestro coaches", abundÃ³ sobre dos de los beneficios del fichaje del ex coach de los Knicks de Nueva York y Celtas de Boston de la NBA. "Los tÃ©cnicos jÃ³venes se van a poder acoplar al sistema organizativo", aÃ±adiÃ³, al tiempo que dejaba claro que esto no necesariamente signifique que los dirigentes de afuera sean mejores que los del patio.
Cuando se le preguntÃ³ sobre la presiÃ³n que podrÃ­a tener Pitino, quien se alega no cobrarÃ¡ por sus servicios, ante las expectativas que tiene la gerencia del conjunto de clasificar a Londres 2012, ciudad que serÃ¡ la sede de las Olimpiadas, Katz fue claro al decir que sÃ­ existe.
"Ãl sabe que hay presiÃ³n y estÃ¡ acostumbrado a la presiÃ³n. Nuestra meta primordial y objetivo en los prÃ³ximos 10 u 12 meses, es el clasificatorio en Argentina y los Panamericanos en Guadalajara, MÃ©xico en octubre", dijo sobre los dos compromisos grandes del 2011, el primero que es el torneo preolÃ­mpico.
Katz tambiÃ©n aceptÃ³ que para los Panamericanos, es casi seguro que un dirigente local asuma nuevamente la direcciÃ³n, ante la cercanÃ­a del comienzo de los entrenamientos de la NCAA. AdemÃ¡s reconociÃ³ lo difÃ­cil que serÃ¡ que tanto Arroyo como Barea puedan estar presentes en el evento, al igual que otros jugadores, los primeros por sus compromisos en la NBA, y los otros por sus contratos en ligas profesionales en diferentes lugares del mundo.
El veterano y mÃ¡s ganador mentor a nivel local, Julio Toro, quien ha trabajado como asistente y dirigente del conjunto boricua, y que tambiÃ©n dirigiÃ³ a los equipos de Venezuela y RepÃºblica Dominicana, reconoce que "en este trabajo nos evalÃºan por los resultados. Hubo una oferta y una aceptaciÃ³n sobre ella, que ambas partes se van a beneficiar del reto que tiene el entrenador y la ilusiÃ³n de mejores resultados de cara al preolÃ­mpico que se va a celebrar en Argentina".
"Es una idea que hay que respetarla de las personas que dirigen el baloncesto en Puerto Rico", dijo sobre el regreso de un coach anglosajÃ³n despuÃ©s de 33 aÃ±os, segÃºn calculÃ³. "Ha sucedido muchÃ­simas veces y ellos fueron los maestros, y estÃ¡n interactuando con nosotros desde los aÃ±os 40. Se ha ganado y perdido, por lo que ahora estamos atentos y confiados en que todo salga bien con resultados positivos para regresar a las Olimpiadas", explicÃ³.
Toro, sin embargo, indicÃ³ que la tarea de Pitino no serÃ¡ fÃ¡cil, ya que sÃ³lo 12 equipos clasifican a las Olimpiadas, la mitad de los que juegan en los Campeonatos Mundiales donde participan 24. Y en el caso de la regiÃ³n de AmÃ©rica sÃ³lo hay dos plazas disponibles, sumado a la de Estados Unidos que por ser el campeÃ³n mundial no tiene que buscar su pasaporte a Londres.
Sobre lo difÃ­cil que pudiera ser para una persona ajena, en este caso Pitino, el poder trabajar con el equipo y los jugadores, el mentor de los Vaqueros de BayamÃ³n en el campeonato local entiende que "no sea difÃ­cil poder trabajar con un equipo" por la capacidad emocional de los componentes.
RecordÃ³ que la mayorÃ­a del grupo ha participado en otros talleres como Europa, la NBA y AmÃ©rica, por lo que estÃ¡n capacitados para trabajar con cualquier entrenador. Pero, sin querer ser pesimista, sabe que por la forma de trabajar en Puerto Rico, se le harÃ¡ difÃ­cil al nuevo dirigente.
"A mÃ­ se me hizo difÃ­cil y a otros entrenadores tambiÃ©n. Las formas que se han hecho otras veces, es muy atropellado", cuestionÃ³ sobre la forma de aglutinar a los jugadores de cara a cualquier compromiso. "Para las Olimpiadas de Australia, lo que tuve fueron nueve dÃ­as de trabajo", dijo sobre la selecciÃ³n de Venezuela. "En otras ocasiones he tenido dos semanas y hay ausencias. La mayor parte del tiempo, incluso para Manolo y Flor, es atÃ­pico ya que no tiene la fortaleza mental ya que estamos trabajando en otros lugares y no es fÃ¡cil".
Pero a pesar de que las experiencias no fueron muy agradables, Toro confÃ­a en el compromiso de los jugadores, aun cuando el dirigente no sea puertorriqueÃ±o. "QuizÃ¡s (ahora) los atletas pongan un poco mÃ¡s de su parte, ya que ellos son los que tienen que dar esa milla extra", puntualizÃ³.
Se tratÃ³ de conseguir una reacciÃ³n del saliente dirigente de la escuadra, Manolo CintrÃ³n, pero fue imposible ya que se encuentra cumpliendo compromisos en la liga profesional de MÃ©xico.

description.hltext_display: Gay Killings Put Back on U.N. Rights Agenda after U.S. Campaign
description.content:
(NewsCore) - The UN General Assembly on Tuesday voted to put gays and lesbians back on a list of vulnerable minorities who should be protected from unjustified killings following a major US-led diplomatic campaign.
A mainly Arab and African-led move had killings over "sexual orientation" taken off a list of people unfairly targeted, when an biannual resolution was discussed by a UN rights committee last month.
The US government said it was "incensed" and launched a major campaign with European and other nations to get "sexual orientation" killings put back on the blacklist when the vote came before the full UN General Assembly.
"Today, the United Nations General Assembly has sent a clear and resounding message that justice and human rights apply to all individuals regardless of their sexual orientation," said US ambassador Susan Rice after the 93-55 vote.
"The voices of civil society and human rights defenders around the world have been heard today, and for that my delegation is especially proud," Rice added.
Since 1999 the resolution has called for thorough investigation of "all killings committed for any discriminatory reason, including sexual orientation."
According to Human Rights Watch, it was the only UN resolution in the field with an explicit reference to sexual orientation.
Benin, supported by Morocco, introduced the amendment which was narrowly passed at the UN General Assembly rights committee on November 16.
Boris Dittrich, director of Human Rights WatchÃ¢s Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual and Transgender program, commented: "Countries that tried to roll back crucial protections for gay and lesbian people have been defeated."
He added: "Hate crimes on the basis of sexual orientation or gender identity must be countered just like hate crimes on the basis of race or religion."

description.hltext_display: Food Bank campaign gets $100,000 from Citizens Bank Foundation
description.content:
Berwick Eliot Kittery North Berwick Lebanon South Berwick York
Go Mobile: http://mobile.fosters.com
MANCHESTER â The New Hampshire Food Bank has announced that the Citizens Bank Foundation has donated a $100,000 grant to the Food Bank's community campaign.
Cathy Schmidt, President of Citizens Bank New Hampshire, is co-chairing the campaign. This leadership grant of $100,000 from the Citizens Foundation will support the Recipe for Success job training kitchen, where students who are unemployed or underemployed gain valuable work skills to earn a living wage. Through the eight-week culinary job training program, adult students learn the ins and outs of working in a busy commercial kitchen as they prepare nearly 2,000 hot meals each week for Food Bank agencies.
These meals go on to feed the hungry in New Hampshire, and students gain classroom knowledge and hands-on experience. Much more than a warehouse, the Food Bank's new location at 700 East Industrial Park Drive in Manchester allows the program to focus on direct service, innovative programs, and solutions to address hunger at its root causes. The campaign will run through 2011.
For further information, contact Lisa Merrill-Burzak, vice president of development at NH Catholic Charities, at (603) 669-3030, Ext. 240.

description.hltext_display: Dangdang to diversify from books, plans expansion
description.content:
Online retailer Dangdang Inc, considered as China's answer to Amazon.com, aims for sales of general merchandise to exceed that of books and other media as it diversifies in the highly competitive e-commerce sector.
Media products, including books and DVDs, make up about 84 percent of Dangdang's sales, with the remainder from other consumer products such as cosmetics, furniture, shoes and toys.
"There is no doubt that sales from general merchandise are going to rise faster than books, and will eventually exceed books," co-founder and Chairwoman Peggy Yu told Reuters via telephone in Beijing on Wednesday.
Yu also said the company had no plans to tap overseas markets, but would focus on China, where its 1.3 billion population is becoming increasingly affluent on the back of strong economic growth.
"It's hard to find another massive market like China where there is one language and a common consumer culture, apart from the United States in the 50s and 60s," she said. "If we can serve mainland customers really well, our business will have many years of development."
Dangdang shares have fallen by almost 30 percent since hitting a closing high of $32.79 days after its trading debut on December 8, as concern over its competitiveness in China's highly fragmented e-commerce sector.
(Reporting by Huang Yuntao and Lee Chyen Yee; Editing by Chris Lewis)

the company had no plans to tap overseas markets, but would focus on China, where its 1.3 billion population is becoming increasingly affluent on the back of strong economic growth.
There is no doubt that sales from general merchandise are going to rise faster than books, and will eventually exceed books

description.hltext_display: Futterneid und Schleckalarm beim "V.I.P. Hundeprofi"!/ VOX zeigt ab 15. Januar die zweite ...
description.content:
KÃ¶ln (ots) - Die erfolgreiche VOX-Coaching-Doku "Der V.I.P. Hundeprofi" meldet sich am Samstag, 15. Januar 2011 um 19:10 Uhr mit der 2. Staffel zurÃ¼ck! Dann widmet sich Tierpsychologe Martin RÃ¼tter in 12 neuen Folgen wieder den kleinen und groÃen Problemen von Promi und Tier. Denn wenn der VOX-"Hundeprofi" den VIPs mit Rat und Tat unter die Arme greift, werden die Hunde ihre Star-AllÃ¼ren los - oder umgekehrt. Martin lÃ¤sst sich vom Glanz der Stars nicht blenden: Er erkennt schnell, auf welcher Seite der Leine das eigentliche Problem ist und sorgt fÃ¼r Zufriedenheit und Harmonie bei Vier- und Zweibeinern. In der 2. Staffel mit dabei: Moderatorin Nina Ruge, die Schauspieler Peer Kusmagk und Milos Vukovic, die Moderatorinnen Dunja Hayali, Sonja Zietlow und Miriam Pede, SÃ¤nger Oli P., FuÃballspieler Toni Polster, Model Jana Ina Zarrella, Moderator Uwe HÃ¼bner, "No Angels"-SÃ¤ngerin Sandy MÃ¶lling und Ex-EiskunstlÃ¤uferin Tanja Szewczenko.
In der ersten Folge hat es Martin RÃ¼tter gleich mit zwei ganz unterschiedlichen FÃ¤llen zu tun: SÃ¤nger Oli Petszokat kÃ¤mpft bei seinen zwei Hunden mit Futterneid und stundenlangem Schlecken, Nina Ruge sucht UnterstÃ¼tzung bei einem groÃen Schritt: Sie will sich einen zweiten Hund anschaffen.
Chaotische ZustÃ¤nde und Ãrger im Doppelpack erwarten den "V.I.P. Hundeprofi" bei SÃ¤nger Oliver Petszokat. Die franzÃ¶sische Bulldogge "Pontus" und Labrador-Mix "Phoebe" haben ihre ganz eigenen Macken: "Pontus" bettelt bei jeder Gelegenheit und gÃ¶nnt "Phoebe" nicht das kleinste Leckerchen. Wenn "Phoebe" hingegen mit dem Schlecken angefangen hat, hÃ¶rt sie von alleine nicht mehr auf. "Sie denkt, ihre Aufgabe auf dieser Welt ist es, mich abzuschlecken", erklÃ¤rt der SÃ¤nger. Tierpsychologe Martin RÃ¼tter hat das Spiel jedoch schnell durchschaut: "Das nennt sich soziales Komfortverhalten. Das ist nicht weiter schlimm, in maximal zehn Tagen haben wir das im Griff", so RÃ¼tter. Problematischer wird es bei der bettelnden "Pontus", die einfach alles haben will, sobald es jemand anderes bekommt. Hier sieht der "V.I.P. Hundeprofi" die Schwierigkeit mehr bei Herrchen Oliver: "Du bist ein absoluter Hunde-verrÃ¼ckt-Macher. Das, was du mit den Hunden machst, fÃ¼hrt bei sensiblen Tieren zu einem Worst-Case-Szenario." Harte Worte fÃ¼r den SÃ¤nger. Zu allem Ãberfluss muss Oli P. nicht nur mit Martins RatschlÃ¤gen und Kritik klarkommen: GenÃ¼sslich, amÃ¼siert und gerne auch mit einem Schuss HÃ¤me kommentieren sich die teilnehmenden Promis gegenseitig auf dem Weg zur perfekten Harmonie. Ob Martin RÃ¼tter aus Oliver Petszokat ein richtiges Herrchen machen kann?
Szenenwechsel: Nina Ruge hat sich entschieden: Ein neuer Hund soll neben Entlebucher Sennenhund "Lupo" an ihre Seite. Martin RÃ¼tter: "Nina und ich hatten schon in der 1. Staffel richtig Arbeit mit 'Lupo'. Ich hoffe, sie weiÃ, dass es mit einem zweiten Hund natÃ¼rlich noch anstrengender wird!" Gemeinsam geht es fÃ¼r die beiden nach Italien, um bei einer ortsansÃ¤ssigen Schweizer-Sennenhund-ZÃ¼chterin den passenden Welpen und SpielgefÃ¤hrten fÃ¼r "Lupo" auszusuchen. Eine HÃ¼ndin soll es sein, so viel steht fest. Doch welchen Charakter hat das Tier? Und welcher Hund passt zu "Lupo" und Nina? Hier weiÃ Martin RÃ¼tter Rat: Bevor die Moderatorin einen Welpen mitnehmen kann, muss ein Vertrauenstest her: Nina soll einfach nur einen Welpen auf den RÃ¼cken drehen und trotz Gegenwehr festhalten. Doch da wird gestrampelt, gefiept und gemotzt, was das Zeug hÃ¤lt. Der "Hundeprofi" ist begeistert: "Das Hundetrainerherz schlÃ¤gt hÃ¶her bei der Welpenauswahl, das ist sehr sehr niedlich." Die kleine "Simba" soll es am Ende des Tages werden: "Das ist sie! Guck' mal, Martin, die ist doch total nett!", freut sich Nina. Wird sich "Simba" in ihrem neuen Zuhause wohl fÃ¼hlen? Wie wird EnergiebÃ¼ndel "Lupo" auf den neuen SpielgefÃ¤hrten reagieren und ist Nina Ruge fÃ¼r die neue Herausforderung gewappnet?
"Der V.I.P. Hundeprofi" mit Nina Ruge, Peer Kusmagk, Milos Vukovic, Dunja Hayali, Sonja Zietlow, Miriam Pede, Oli P., Toni Polster, Jana Ina Zarrella, Uwe HÃ¼bner, Sandy MÃ¶lling und Tanja Szewczenko ab Samstag, 15. Januar 2011 um 19:10 Uhr bei VOX.
Weitere Informationen finden Sie in der Pressemappe zur Sendung "Der V.I.P. Hundeprofi" im VOX-Pressezentrum unter http://kommunikation.vox.de.
Originaltext: VOX Television GmbH Digitale Pressemappe: http://www.presseportal.de/pm/6952 Pressemappe via RSS : http://www.presseportal.de/rss/pm_6952.rss2
Pressekontakt: Bei RÃ¼ckfragen: VOX Kommunikation und Presse, Katrin Kraft, Tel.: 0221/456-81506 Bei FotowÃ¼nschen: VOX Bildredaktion, Lotte Lilholt, Tel.: 0221/456-81512

Ekonomi GÃ¶teborg
Volvo Personvagnar ser ut att fÃ¥ klart med sitt eftertraktade lÃ¥n frÃ¥n Europeiska investeringsbanken (EIB) fÃ¶re nyÃ¥r. Regeringen vÃ¤ntas fatta beslut om de nÃ¶dvÃ¤ndiga statliga garantierna pÃ¥ dagens sammantrÃ¤de, erfar TT. NÃ¤ringsminister Maud Olofsson (C) hÃ¥ller presstrÃ¤ff pÃ¥ fÃ¶rmiddagen med anledning av beslutet. EIB har beviljat Volvo 600 miljoner euro, cirka 5,5 miljarder kronor, i lÃ¥n och EU-kommissionen har godkÃ¤nt upplÃ¤gget med statsgaranti. TTPublicerad2010-12-22 08:59

description.hltext_display: De kan bli Ã¥rets idrottare
description.content:
I dag kom beskedet. Viking Line har tecknat skeppsbyggnadskontrakt med STX.
HÃ¤r Ã¤r pressmeddelandet ord fÃ¶r ord:
Skeppsbyggnadskontraktet mellan Viking Line Abp och STX Finland Oy har i dag trÃ¤tt i kraft. IkrafttrÃ¤dandet skedde sedan bÃ¥da parter kommit Ã¶verens om de avtalade kontraktsfÃ¶rbehÃ¥llen. Ett av fÃ¶rbehÃ¥llen gÃ¤llde det miljÃ¶investeringsstÃ¶d om vilket kommunikationsministeriet beslutat igÃ¥r. Utbetalningen av stÃ¶det fÃ¶rutsÃ¤tter att EU-kommissionen godkÃ¤nner stÃ¶dprogrammet samt Viking Lines stÃ¶dansÃ¶kan. Parterna fullfÃ¶ljer dÃ¤rmed det intentionsavtal som undertecknades den 25 oktober 2010. Investeringen uppgÃ¥r till ca 240 MEUR. Avtalet innehÃ¥ller en option pÃ¥ ytterligare ett fartyg.
Fartyget kommer att byggas pÃ¥ Ã bovarvet fÃ¶r trafik pÃ¥ linjen Ã bo - Ã land - Stockholm med berÃ¤knad leverans i bÃ¶rjan av 2013. Fartygets lÃ¤ngd Ã¤r ca 214 meter och har en bruttodrÃ¤ktighet pÃ¥ ca 57.000 ton. Isklassen Ã¤r 1 A Super. Fartyget Ã¤r planerat fÃ¶r 2800 resenÃ¤rer och kommer att ha en besÃ¤ttning pÃ¥ 200 personer. Passagerarhytternas antal i detta innovativa och moderna fartyg Ã¤r 880. Fraktfilernas lÃ¤ngd Ã¤r 1275 meter och fÃ¶r personbilarna finns det reserverat 500 meter pÃ¥ ett separat bildÃ¤ck. Dessutom finns det tillÃ¤ggsutrymme fÃ¶r personbilar pÃ¥ bilhyllor som kan sÃ¤nkas ner.
Fartyget representerar en helt ny fartygsgeneration och i planeringsarbetet har stor vikt lagts vid miljÃ¶vÃ¤nliga lÃ¶sningar, hÃ¶g passagerarkomfort samt nya upplevelser fÃ¶r passagerarna. Viking Line hoppas att med denna nya satsning Ã¤ven i fortsÃ¤ttningen kunna erbjuda sina kunder trevliga reseupplevelser.
"Vi Ã¤r mycket tacksamma fÃ¶r det stÃ¶d projektet fÃ¥tt frÃ¥n mÃ¥nga olika hÃ¥ll och Ã¤r speciellt glada Ã¶ver att vi sÃ¥ hÃ¤r infÃ¶r julen kan bidra till flera tusen arbetstillfÃ¤llen i Ã boregionen", sÃ¤ger Viking Lines vd Mikael Backman. Det nya fartygsbygget innebÃ¤r fÃ¶r varvet ca 2.600 Ã¥rsarbetsplatser. Mikael Backman VerkstÃ¤llande direktÃ¶r

description.hltext_display: Morales con reservas de Pitino
description.content:
SAN JUAN, PR -- Puerto Rico tiene un nuevo entrenador de su selecciÃ³n de baloncesto para el 2011, pero las razones para ello no tienen nada que ver nada con la nacionalidad del tÃ©cnico.
Eso se dejÃ³ claro en la Isla del Encanto cuando los directivos de esta disciplina en el paÃ­s dieron sus explicaciones para justificar la contrataciÃ³n del cotizado mentor universitario Rick Pitino para las prÃ³ximas competencias internacionales.
Pero algunos no estÃ¡n completamente de acuerdo con que el entrenador de la Universidad de Louisville en la NCAA, quien ha trabajado con otras instituciones de esta organizaciÃ³n, asÃ­ como en la NBA con las franquicias de los New York Knicks y los Boston Celtics, sea el candidato idÃ³neo para tomar las riendas del quinteto nacional boricua. La razÃ³n que aducen es que el tÃ©cnico de raÃ­ces italianas no tiene experiencia con el baloncesto internacional.
Uno de esos es el analista Carlos A. Morales, quien despuÃ©s de pilotar la escuadra puertorriqueÃ±a en varios torneos internacionales en la dÃ©cada de los noventa, y quien ahora labora para ESPN Deportes como comentarista, tiene sus reservas de la forma en que se produjo la selecciÃ³n del nuevo mentor de PR de cara al torneo preolÃ­mpico en agosto del 2011 en Argentina, en el cual se definirÃ¡n solo dos espacios para las Olimpiadas del 2012 en Londres. La otra plaza del continente americano la ocupa Estados Unidos por ser el campeÃ³n de la pasada competencia en PekÃ­n 2008,
"Aparentemente lo que habÃ­a era una tendencia previa y una inclinaciÃ³n de traer un 'coach' extranjero", destacÃ³ Morales, quien guiÃ³ a los boricuas a una medalla de Oro en los Juegos de la Buena Voluntad de 1994 celebrados en Rusia. "Lo que sÃ­ me sorprende, no porque Pitino no tenga los meritos, es que eso no era lo que se habÃ­a hablado".
A lo que Morales se referÃ­a es que antes del nombramiento de Pitino a la posiciÃ³n, en todo momento la FederaciÃ³n de Baloncesto de Puerto Rico que preside el Lcdo. Carlos J. BeltrÃ¡n hablaba de la posibilidad de buscar una persona con experiencia en el sistema internacional.
"Se hablÃ³ de un extranjero para amoldarnos al sistema de juego FIBA y que nos habÃ­amos quedado atrÃ¡s en el juego europeo. Que jugamos el juego de la NBA y a lo americano, cosa que coincido, y que ya estaba probado que los jugadores tenÃ­an el mismo talento de los de Estados Unidos", explicÃ³.
"Sin embargo, los vientos apuntaban a que fuera un coach que dominara el juego FIBA. Rick Pitino, que es un gran coach, no domina el juego FIBA", dijo Morales sobre el estilo de juego con marcadas diferencias al de Estados Unidos que se juega con las llamadas 'reglas americanas'. "Va a tener problemas, pero como todo buen coach tendrÃ¡ que realizar unos periodos de ajustes, el cual va a depender grandemente de sus asistentes y sus escuchas que lo pongan al dÃ­a como se juega el baloncesto internacional", planteÃ³, al tiempo que dijo lo interesante que serÃ¡ para los jugadores, y cÃ³mo se sentirÃ¡n nuevamente, el jugar bajo el mandato de un tÃ©cnico anglosajÃ³n.
Morales hizo una comparaciÃ³n de los otros candidatos mencionados, el argentino Sergio HernÃ¡ndez y el espaÃ±ol Moncho Monsalve, que fuera el piloto de Brasil en las recientes competencias. Y el boricua entiende que Pitino es superior a Monsalve, no asÃ­ sobre el gaucho que tuvo gran Ã©xito al frente del combinado suramericano, pero que fue dejado fuera de la direcciÃ³n de su paÃ­s para el nuevo ciclo olÃ­mpico.
â
Entiendo la moda, de que quieren un extranjero. Pero lo importante no es que sea criollo o extranjero, es que el coach sea bueno de verdad. No me parece que Pitino sea un mal coach, ya que es excelente, pero pudimos haber aspirado a mÃ¡s, ya que podÃ­an haber reclutado a uno con buen nombre, pero que tambiÃ©n tuviera experiencia internacional.
â -- Carlos Morales
"Con Sergio HernÃ¡ndez es diferente, ya que Pitino ha tenido los mismos Ã©xitos en los Estados Unidos. Pero HernÃ¡ndez tiene una leve ventaja por su experiencia en la FIBA. Aun asÃ­ yo pensaba que se iban a decidir por un coach extranjero, que fuera bueno de verdad y que no vendrÃ­an con inventos", apuntÃ³ Morales, a la misma vez que dejÃ³ claro que no tiene problemas que un dirigente del exterior asuma la direcciÃ³n del combinado boricua.
El comentarista televisivo considera que en Puerto Rico hay tÃ©cnicos tan buenos como en el extranjero, y puso como ejemplo el nombre de Flor MelÃ©ndez, quien ha dirigido por mÃ¡s de dos dÃ©cadas en el baloncesto profesional de Argentina, Venezuela y algunas ligas de Europa. AdemÃ¡s el tambiÃ©n ex piloto nacional, que ganÃ³ medalla de Plata en los Panamericanos de 1979 celebrados en San Juan, es el segundo dirigente con mÃ¡s victorias en el torneo superior de Puerto Rico, superado por Julio Toro, otro ex dirigente del seleccionado nacional de este paÃ­s.
"Entiendo la moda, de que quieren un extranjero. Pero lo importante no es que sea criollo o extranjero, es que el coach sea bueno de verdad. No me parece que Pitino sea un mal coach, ya que es excelente, pero pudimos haber aspirado a mÃ¡s, ya que podÃ­an haber reclutado a uno con buen nombre, pero que tambiÃ©n tuviera experiencia internacional", enfatizÃ³ Morales, quien de paso aclarÃ³ que nunca fue contactado para ver su disponibilidad para regresar al puesto por segunda ocasiÃ³n en su carrera.
"Lo importante es que Puerto Rico tenga un buen coach. Y que haga un buen trabajo, independiente de que sea extranjero o local. Que sea lo suficientemente bueno que toda esta algarabÃ­a del nuevo coach se justifique", finiquitÃ³.

description.hltext_display: Small Business Loans â Cash Help For Small Enterprises
description.content:
Cash is a very important part of the operating cycle of any business. It is required in every aspect of business. From the purchase of raw materials to the final sale of finished goods, it is required everywhere. So, the time when we face cash deficiency, we need an immediate way out. This may be in the form of small business loans.Small business loans are small cash advances which are offered without any hassle. The loan amount is generally dependent upon the business you are running. Some businesses are seasonal so require more cash in comparison to others. These businesses are more dependent upon the credit help from outside. The loan period also varies from 1000 pounds to 25000 pounds. It may go beyond this level too. These loans have certain conditions that every person has to meet if he or she wants to have loan. Presently these loans are offered only to the people living in UK. They should have attained an age of 18 years before applying. They should also have a valid bank account in the name of business. It is this bank account which will be used to credit the loan amount once it is approved. These loans are mostly offered in unsecured way. It means that the borrower need not worry about keeping any of his or her assets with the lender to get the loan approved. But this type of loan also has a demerit. These are offered at slightly higher rate of interest. To avoid such situations you can go for secured loans. These loans are very helpful for any business that is facing some cash insufficiency. These may also be obtained online and this feature makes them very easy to approve loans.
Â
Â
Â Â

description.hltext_display: AFC West: Big wins leave Chargers wanting, needing more
description.content: (Sports Network) - They might have had the most impressive victory of Week 15, but as it turned out, the San Diego Chargers' 34-7 Thursday-night throttling of the San Francisco 49ers did the team precious little good by the time Sunday rolled around. Each of the teams that San Diego, now 8-6, is chasing to secure a spot in the upcoming AFC playoffs won in Week 15, leaving the Chargers in need of outside assistance if they're to continue a run of four consecutive AFC West division titles. San Diego trails the first-place Kansas City Chiefs by a game in the West and will head to Cincinnati (Dec. 26) and Denver (Jan. 2) for road tests to end the season. The Chiefs, meanwhile, are home to Tennessee and Oakland and can guarantee a divisional crown with two victories. If both teams end at 10-6, the Chargers win the tiebreaker based on would-be advantages in both divisional and conference records. If the teams wind up in a two-way tie at 9-7, San Diego also wins the tiebreaker with the same criteria. However, if there's a three-way tie with Oakland at 9-7, the Raiders win the division. In terms of a Wild Card berth, San Diego trails both the current placeholders -- the New York Jets and Baltimore -- by two games. One win apiece for the Jets and Ravens in their final two games would mathematically eliminate the Chargers from consideration. The Jets finish at Chicago and home with Buffalo, while the Ravens are at Cleveland and home with Cincinnati. At this point, New York looks likely to win a tiebreaker with San Diego based on strength of schedule, but the Chargers would beat Baltimore based on conference record if the Ravens end the season with consecutive losses. Pittsburgh is also 10-4 and could factor into the Wild Card if Baltimore wins the AFC North, but San Diego cannot pass the Steelers due to Pittsburgh's edge against common opponents. "No help [Sunday], obviously," San Diego quarterback Philip Rivers said. "We can only worry about ourselves. We must get to 10-6 and see if it is enough." The Chargers will not face colorful wide receiver Terrell Owens in the Week 16 matchup with the Bengals after he sustained a season-ending torn meniscus in his left knee during Cincinnati's 19-17 win over Cleveland last weekend. The 37-year-old Owens ends the year with 72 receptions for 983 yards and nine touchdowns. He fell 17 yards short of becoming the third receiver in league history to have 10 or more 1,000-yard seasons. Only two receivers aged 36 or over, Jerry Rice and Jimmy Smith, have reached the 1,000-yard mark in a season. Owens reached two of six incentives on a one-year contract, giving him $2.67 million for the season. BRONCOS: Welcome to the Tim Tebow Era, Part II. The former Heisman Trophy winner and two-time national champion at the University of Florida will make his second consecutive NFL start for the Denver Broncos this weekend against the Houston Texans, according to Eric Studesville, the team's interim head coach. The 25th overall selection in last April's draft -- a choice made by since- departed head coach Josh McDaniels -- Tebow completed 8-of-16 passes for 138 yards and a touchdown in his starting debut last Sunday in a 39-23 loss to the Oakland Raiders. He also rushed eight times for 78 yards and scored on a 40- yard run. Start No. 2 comes in front of the home fans at Invesco Field at Mile High, where the Broncos have not played since a Nov. 28 loss to the St. Louis Rams. Three subsequent road games ended in losses to Kansas City, Arizona and Oakland in which the team was outscored, 92-42. Studesville said the decision to start Tebow was compounded by the questionable health of incumbent Kyle Orton, who couldn't throw last week because of sore ribs and hasn't significantly improved since. "We just thought that prolonging this thing into the week was just not the best thing for our preparation in practice," Studesville said of Orton's injury. Denver had 33 total running plays and 16 passes against the Raiders last week, its fewest pass attempts this season. Orton's low was 29 attempts in the first game against Oakland in October, and he threw 40 or more passes five times. Studesville and offensive coordinator Mike McCoy went exclusively with running plays in the final minute of the first half against Oakland, and again when the Broncos were deep in their own territory. Houston enters the game with the league's worst pass defense, allowing 275.1 yards per week through the air. "A lot of things that go into those situations that put caution in the air, not the quarterback," Studesville said. "We're finding more and more out about what [Tebow] does. That game [Sunday] gave us a lot of information and a lot of things that we can work with and go from and build on as coaches to give him. "We've seen it out here [in practice], but it's different when everything is full speed on Sunday afternoon. And the things that he is good at, we're going to continue to do, and the things that he's not good at, just like any other player, we are not going to do those things." CHIEFS: Less than two weeks after surgery, Matt Cassel came to the rescue. The Kansas City Chiefs' quarterback returned to the field after a one-week absence and buoyed the AFC West leaders' playoff prospects in a 27-13 defeat of the St. Louis Rams at the Edward Jones Dome. Cassel had missed the previous week's game, a 31-0 loss to the second-place San Diego Chargers in Southern California, after undergoing an appendectomy four days earlier. "I felt 100 percent," he said. "Otherwise I wouldn't have been out there." The USC product completed 15-of-29 passes for 184 yards, a touchdown and an interception in his return, one week after understudy Brodie Croyle went just 7-for-17 for 40 yards against the Chargers. Croyle is 0-10 as an NFL starter. "{Cassel] was going to be throwing up blood or he was going to be playing football," Chiefs offensive lineman Brian Waters said. "That's the kind of guy he is." The Chiefs lead the Chargers by one game with two left on the 2010 schedule. Kansas City is home with Tennessee and Oakland. San Diego visits Cincinnati and Denver. "You've got to be a pro about it. You've got to take advantage of your situation," linebacker Derrick Johnson said. "We still control our destiny, meaning we should stay in our lane and worry about what we have to worry about and win the game we have to win. "We all know our situation regardless of win or lose by any other division opponent. If we win, we don't have to worry about that. There's not going to be any kind of Wild Card team coming out of our division. We need to win our division." If Kansas City and San Diego wind up dually tied at 10-6 or 9-7, the Chargers win a pair of tiebreakers based on what would be superior division or conference records. However, if there's a three-way tie with Oakland at 9-7, the Raiders win the division. San Diego has won the West four straight times. Kansas City's last division title came in 2003 under then-head coach Dick Vermeil. The Chiefs last made the playoffs in 2006 under Herman Edwards. "We're laying the foundation," Kansas City head coach Todd Haley said. "We're still in that process of trying to become a good team. The Kansas City Chiefs are not there, obviously, but we are going in the right direction and we're seeing some reward, which is some wins and reward for the hard work and sacrifice that the guys are putting in. "But we're making progress. That's the key for us, and that's been our goal, is to just get a little better every day -- every Wednesday, every Thursday, every Friday and then every Sunday -- and we've done that for the most part, and that's why I think we're sitting where we're sitting." RAIDERS: After 15 weeks, it's down to a four-step process for the Oakland Raiders. If each of four scenarios play out over the next two weekends, the Raiders become AFC West champions for the first time since 2002. But if they go anything less than 4-for-4, the playoff drought for the Silver and Black extends to eight seasons for the first time in franchise history. The four mandatory things in question include: Oakland beats visiting Indianapolis this Sunday. Oakland wins at Kansas City on Jan. 2. Kansas City loses to visiting Tennessee this Sunday. San Diego loses either at Cincinnati on Sunday or at Denver on Jan. 2. Completion of the four steps would put the Raiders in a three-way tie with Kansas City and San Diego or a two-way tie with the Chiefs atop the division, giving the Raiders the championship based on what would be a 6-0 record in the West. Oakland is just 2-7 in non-division games through 15 weeks. "It doesn't mean anything if we are at home watching Kansas City in the playoffs," defensive tackle Tommy Kelly said of the Raiders' success within the division. "It's something nice to say, but at the end of the day it doesn't mean anything. You don't even get a T-shirt." Only one other time in franchise history -- from its 1960 debut through the 1966 season -- has Oakland failed to reach the postseason for seven consecutive years. That drought ended with a 1967 AFL Championship and an appearance in Super Bowl II in January 1968. The current skid began after the Raiders were beaten, 48-21, by the Tampa Bay Buccaneers in Super Bowl XXXVII in January of 2003. In the seven subsequent seasons under five head coaches, Oakland went a combined 29-83, losing 11 or more games each year and bottoming out at 2-14 in 2006. The Raiders were 4-12 in Bill Callahan's final season in 2003 and just 9-23 in two seasons under current San Diego head coach Norv Turner from 2004-05. The aforementioned 2-14 came with Art Shell in 2006, and Oakland was 5-15 with upstart Lane Kiffin before he exited four games into 2008. The Raiders are 16-26 overall since Tom Cable succeeded Kiffin. "It's a lot more fun," Cable said of the team's improvement. "Football is football. I love football. I love coaching. That part of it is never an issue for me. It's just more exciting. You get up and come to work and you're excited about getting into a new plan."

description.hltext_display: Alpha Delta celebrates with Christmas social
description.content:
The Alpha Delta chapter of Epsilon Sigma Alpha gathered for their Christmas social, âLet Your Heart Give,â at the home of Linda Morris Dec. 16.
The members enjoyed a social time before the meal of taco soup, potato soup, relishes, cheese and crackers and numerous Christmas cookies and desserts.
Sharon Stevenson led the group in several games identifying Christmas songs. The members decided to donate to a charity rather than exchange gifts with each member talking about the charity of her choice. The rest of the evening was spent visiting.
Hostesses for the evening were Linda Morris and Sharon Stevenson. Members present were Ruth Archambeau, Joan Bair, Becky Bumgarner, Beth Glantz, Sue Gosselin, Georgia Larson, Diana Moore, Linda Morris, Sharon Stevenson and Charlotte Thiel.

description.hltext_display: Major east China SM suppliers to double as big buyers in 2011
description.content:
SHANGHAI (ICIS)--East China-based styrene monomer (SM) producers will be competing for cargoes in the spot and contract markets more significantly next year, industry sources said on Wednesday.
Shanghai SECCO Petrochemical, Jiangsu Leasty Chemical, Dohow Chemical and Sinopec East China were planning to procure supply from the market, for varied reasons ranging from fulfilling the requirement of downstream plants, to the quest for better margins, company sources said.
Without a clear delineation of roles in the SM market, players were expecting confusion to ensue and would make it difficult for some to strategise their trading positions, industry sources said.
With these producers taking on the role of buyers as well, they would have a much stronger influence on prices, market sources said.
Among the four, Shanghai SECCO was facing SM shortage and would need to tap the market for cargoes to continue supplying to contract clients, a company source said.
Equipment problems at its 650,000 tonne/year SM unit in Shanghai would prevent the plant from optimising running rates for the most of next year. The unit was also due for a 40-day turnaround from September-October 2011, with production loss estimated at around 50,000 tonnes, the source added.
Shanghai SECCO would be procuring 3,000 tonnes of SM each month next year, said the source.
SM is a raw material used in manufacturing plastic resins like PS and ABS; and also synthetic rubbers like styrene butadiene rubber (SBR) and styrene butadiene latex (SBL).
In the case of Jiangsu Leasty Chemical, its own SM production could not cover the requirements of its downstream 240,000 tonne/year expanded polystyrene (EPS) plant, without cancelling term supply to clients, said a company source.
Its EPS plant started producing on-spec products in April 2010.
Jiangsu Leasty has two SM lines with a combined capacity of 400,000 tonnes/year in Jiangyin, Jiangsu province.
Next year, the company would be buying monthly volumes of 5,000-8,000 tonnes of SM, depending on the companyâs EPS operations, said the company source.
Providing for downstream facilities was also the reason that Dohowâs intention to buy more spot cargoes - estimated at 3,000 tonnes/month - from the market next year, said one of its contract clients.
The company needed to supply feedstock to its 70,000 tonne/year acrylonitrile-butadiene-styrene (ABS) unit and its 315,000 tonne/year unsaturated polyester resins (UPR) unit, he said.
Dohow, a part of Yabang Group, has a 200,000 tonne/year SM unit at Changzhou in Jiangsu province.
For Sinopec East China â a big seller of cargoes from Ningbo Zhenhai Lyondell Chemical â meanwhile, buying term cargoes from major distributors in the east China market would be purely for trading purposes.
Sinopec East China had signed a term contract with a trading house for a monthly supply 3,000 tonnes of SM for a period of one year, said a company source.
Demand for SM in east China next year was estimated to increase by 9.3% to 8.18m tonnes, according to Chemease CBI China, a China energy market intelligence service.
ICIS is in the process of raising its stake in CBI China.
Read John Richardson and Malini Hariharanâs blog â Asian Chemical Connections
To discuss issues facing the chemical industry go to ICIS connect
By: Keny Jin
For the latest chemical news, data and analysis that directly impacts your business sign up for a free trial to ICIS news - the breaking online news service for the global chemical industry.
Get the facts and analysis behind the headlines from our market leading weekly magazine: sign up to a free trial to ICIS Chemical Business.

description.content:
LONDON, Dec. 22, 2010 /PRNewswire/ -- Market Publishers Ltd informs that new in-demand are available in its catalogue. . The report makes a prediction on development tendency of the tire industry in the Asia-Pacific region in 2011 to 2015. The research analyses consumption and production of the tire industry in the Asia-Pacific region and provides prediction on development of the tire industry... . The report analyses major European tire enterprises and their operations, provides information on production and consumption on Europe tire industry. The study gives prediction on development tendency of European tire industry â¦ . The report dwells on the production of the tire industry in the Americas, analyses operations of the tire industry in major countries in the Americas. The study provides Forecast on the tire industry development in the Americas and profiles major companies engaged in the tire business... . The study provides data on operations of the top 50 enterprises of global tire industry, presents information on production capability and development trend of the top 50 enterprises of global tire industry. The report informs of the investment of major global tire enterprises in China... . The report provides information on development environment, productivity changes, competition and development of China's caustic soda industry. The study presents major enterprises and their operations, offers information on import and export and influence of the international financial crisis on the industry... . The report provides forecast on investment opportunities and development in China's blood products industry. The research presents an analysis on market demand, major enterprises, policies of China's blood products industry... . The research analyses current situation of China's animal vaccine market and technology. The study presents major enterprises of the industry and their operations, prospects for the development, informs of China's import and export situation...
More new market research reports by CRI can be found at http://marketpublishers.com/members/shcri/info.html
