description.hltext_display: Reception planned for Adamsâ 80th birthday
description.content:
All family and friends are invited to join Barbara Adams, Udall, and her family at a birthday reception in her honor. The event celebrating her 80th birthday will be from 2 to 4 p.m. Jan. 1 at the Udall Community Building.
Cards and birthday wishes may be sent to Barbara at 1868 E. 60th Ave. N., Udall, KS 67146.

description.hltext_display: PatrÃ­cia Amorim defende mudanÃ§as no Flamengo apÃ³s 'ano ruim'
description.content:
ApÃ³s conquistar o tÃ­tulo do Campeonato Brasileiro em 2009, o Flamengo amargou uma sÃ©rie de problemas, principalmente fora dos gramados. Com isso, o rubro-negro passou esta temporada sem levar nenhum tÃ­tulo. Por conta disso, a presidente PatrÃ­cia Amorim afirmou que o ano foi longe de ter sido bom, mas argumentou que em outros aspectos, o clube melhorou.
"NÃ£o foi um bom ano para o futebol, mas em relaÃ§Ã£o a outras coisas foi muito diferente do que muitos dizem. Eu cuido do patrimÃ´nio fÃ­sico do clube, cuidando das reformas da sede e preocupada com o Centro de Treinamento. Foi um ano que comeÃ§amos a nos organizar, principalmente as finanÃ§as", comentou.
Sobre o mau desempenho do atual campeÃ£o no Campeonato Brasileiro, a mandatÃ¡ria defendeu a nova polÃ­tica do time. "Se a parte tÃ©cnica do futebol nÃ£o foi bem, passei a olhar mais para as categorias de base, como sempre falei que iria ser importante. Espero que no prÃ³ximo ano possamos melhorar no futebol e seguir nos organizando fora dele", completou.
Para a prÃ³xima temporada, o Flamengo acertou com somente um reforÃ§o: o goleiro Felipe, ex-Corinthians, que estava no Braga-POR.

description.hltext_display: AFC North: Finally, Bengals have reason to celebrate
description.content: (Sports Network) - For one week at least, the Cincinnati Bengals looked an awful lot like the team that muscled its way to 10 victories and an AFC North title a season ago. That successful 2009 operation was built on a punishing rushing attack centered around powerful running back Cedric Benson and a physical defense that consistently stood its ground against the opposition, two elements that have been for the most part non-existent during Cincinnati's precipitous free-fall into the division cellar this year. But the Bengals got back to basics in Sunday's matchup with the Cleveland Browns, and that renewed commitment to last season's strengths resulted in the end of a painfully-long winless drought that had gone on for nearly three months. Cincinnati placed its sagging fortunes squarely on the broad shoulders of Benson against the Browns, and the sixth-year standout rewarded that approach with a dominating 31-carry, 150-yard effort that propelled the Bengals to a sorely-needed 19-17 triumph over their fellow Ohio tenants. The verdict halted a dreadful string of 10 straight losses that had matched a franchise worst for consecutive defeats in a single season. The superb showing also marked only the third time in 2010 that Benson eclipsed the century mark in a game, one season after the former first-round pick compiled a club-record seven such performances en route to a career-best total of 1,251 yards. The Bengals churned out a season-best 188 yards as a group in Sunday's win, an output more in line with the accomplishments of last year's playoff entry. Cincinnati finished the 2009 campaign ninth in the NFL with an average of 128.5 rushing yards per game, but ranked a troubling 30th in that category (87.8 ypg) heading into the Cleveland tilt. "That's how we want every game to go," said Bengals quarterback Carson Palmer, who aided his team's cause with an efficient 14-of-23, 209-yard turnover-free output under center. "We set out to be a running football team. But for a number of reasons, it hasn't been that way throughout the year. [Sunday] it was. [Sunday] it worked. A defense that's also experienced a dramatic drop-off in comparison to its 2009 standards also chipped in on Sunday, holding Cleveland factor back Peyton Hillis to a non-threatening 59 yards on 14 attempts and the Browns to a mere 278 total yards on the afternoon. "We had a great game plan coming into [Sunday]," said linebacker Rey Maualuga, who tied for the Bengals' lead with eight tackles. "We didn't allow any big plays and were the more physical team. We let a few plays get away, and we'll come in and watch film and correct that. I think overall we did a good job on both sides of the field." Cincinnati has surrendered a total of 34 points and 278 yards or less in all three of its 2010 wins. In the club's 11 losses, the defense has given up an average of 29.8 points and 363.3 total yards. With the playoffs long out of reach, the Bengals hope Sunday's positive display can serve as a springboard to a strong finish against a challenging remaining stretch. Cincinnati will host AFC West contender San Diego this coming weekend before closing out the season with a trip to North division co-leader Baltimore on Jan. 2. RAVENS: The Bengals aren't the only AFC North member that will be entering Christmas week with feelings of joy. The Baltimore Ravens lifted up their spirits, not to mention the team's chances of capturing a division title, with Sunday's rousing 30-24 victory over a surging New Orleans squad that entered M&T Bank Stadium riding a six-game winning streak. The Ravens were able to keep the high-powered Saints, who had put up 30 points or more in five straight outings coming into the pivotal Week 15 matchup, at bay by combining a stout and redemptive presentation on defense with a resurgent running game that had failed to get untracked in recent games. Baltimore bullied its way to 208 rushing yards on the day, an amount that exceeded the team's composite total over the previous three weeks, and got remarkably big production out of short-statured catalyst Ray Rice. The 5-foot-8 running back both darted and bulldozed his way to a career-high 230 yards from scrimmage, racking up a season-best 153 yards and a touchdown on 31 carries along with a team-leading 80 yards with a score on five receptions. "I saw the game plan. I knew we were going to run the ball today," said Rice afterward. Late in the year, it's a mentality thing. It just felt good to know that we were going to do something and went out and did it." While Rice and the offense were having their way with the Saints at the line of scrimmage, the Baltimore defense atoned for a shaky Week 14 showing with a stifling all-around execution. The Ravens limited New Orleans to 267 yards, the defending Super Bowl champions' lowest sum of the season, and a mere 27 on the ground. The Ravens had been lit up for 489 yards and 21 second-half points in a hard- fought overtime win at Houston just six days earlier, allowing the Texans to overcome a 28-7 third-quarter deficit to send the game into extra time. Baltimore did permit an 11-play, 75-yard drive culminating in a Drew Brees touchdown pass that tied the contest at 24-24 early in the fourth quarter, but clamped down to force a punt on New Orleans' next possession before intercepting the All-Pro quarterback on its opponents' subsequent series. "That's something that we've struggled with at times, obviously, and we've been disappointed with the consistency at the end of games," said Ravens head coach John Harbaugh on the defense's occasional lapses. "We gave up one [touchdown] at the end of the half, but they got it done at the end of the game when they had to [Sunday], and that was big." With Pittsburgh falling to the New York Jets on Sunday, Baltimore moved into a first-place tie with the Steelers in the AFC North race with just two games left to play. And while they'd lose a tiebreaker if both teams win out, the Ravens would assure themselves no worse than a Wild Card berth by prevailing in only one of their final two tests. Baltimore will visit 5-8 Cleveland this coming Sunday before hosting AFC North basement-dweller Cincinnati in Week 17. STEELERS: The Pittsburgh Steelers were able to punch their ticket into next month's AFC Playoffs, though it certainly wasn't in the fashion the division's co-front-runners would have preferred. Pittsburgh came into Sunday's marquee matchup with a desperate New York Jets outfit needing only a win or tie to earn a return to the postseason following a one-year absence. While that scenario didn't materialize due to a tough 22-17 loss, the Black and Gold still secured a spot in the six-team tournament by clinching complicated strength of victory tiebreakers over their remaining competition, namely the 8-6 grouping of Indianapolis, Jacksonville and San Diego. The achievement of one of their goals still rang a bit hollow for the Steelers after coming up just short in a tightly-played contest that wasn't decided until the final seconds. Pittsburgh outgained the previously-reeling Jets by a 378-276 margin in total yards and converted an effective 11-of-17 chances on third downs, but had their chances compromised by a pair of plays that would up playing a huge role in the ultimate outcome. The Steelers found themselves in a quick 7-0 hole when New York's Brad Smith brought back the game's opening kickoff 97 yards for a touchdown. The Jets also came up with a pivotal play on defense late in the contest, when outside linebacker Jason Taylor tripped up running back Mewelde Moore for a safety that gave the team a five-point edge with 2:38 to go and required Pittsburgh to try for a touchdown on its last drive. The Steelers nearly pulled off the feat, with quarterback Ben Roethlisberger marching the offense down from its own eight-yard line to the Jets' 10 in under two minutes, but couldn't connect on three shots at the end zone before the clock ran out. "In games like that you can go back to a number of plays, but the reality is that [the Jets] made the significant plays, particularly in the second half, third-down conversions and we didn't," Steelers head coach Mike Tomlin stated afterward. While the loss wasn't crippling for Pittsburgh, which can still obtain an AFC North title and valuable first-round bye for the conference playoffs by winning its last two games, it's margin for error has been sizably reduced. The Steelers dropped back into a tie with rival Baltimore for the division's top spot after the Ravens came up with a 30-24 decision over visiting New Orleans on Sunday. "How we respond to this will be important," said Tomlin. "We are in the thick of things here." The schedule does appear to work in the Steelers' favor, however. Next on the docket is a home game against 2-12 Carolina on Thursday night, followed by a road date at non-contending Cleveland in the finale. Pittsburgh handed the Browns a 28-10 loss at Heinz Field in mid-October, though Cleveland did finish with a 378-327 advantage in total yards that day. BROWNS: The Cleveland Browns may have found their quarterback of the future, but his return to action wasn't enough to improve the team's present situation. The sagging Browns were dealt a loss by a last-place team for a second consecutive week with this past weekend's 19-17 setback to a Cincinnati Bengals club that had dropped 10 consecutive games prior to Sunday's breakthrough. The disappointing result came on the heels of a 13-6 Week 14 defeat at AFC East cellar-dweller Buffalo in which Cleveland produced an anemic 187 total yards and nine first downs. While the offense operated slightly better this time around with rookie Colt McCoy back at the controls after sitting out three straight weeks with an ankle sprain, the Browns were ultimately done in by an inability to run the ball with any consistency and the defense's futile attempts to prevent the Bengals from doing so with authority. Cleveland gave up 188 rushing yards to Cincinnati, more than double the Bengals' season average, while getting a pedestrian 59 yards on 14 carries out of workhorse running back Peyton Hillis. That subpar exhibit on both sides drew the disdain of head coach Eric Mangini, who now finds himself back on the hot seat in the aftermath of his team's recent downturn. "In my mind, we should be able to stop the run and run the ball effectively, regardless of who we play," said Mangini after the game. "That's something that has to be a big part of playing in this division. Playing at this time of year, you have to be able to do those two things. That's my expectation, and that should be all of our expectations, because it's the nature of the division that we play in and weather that we play in." McCoy didn't show much rust from his near month-long layoff, hitting on a sharp 19-of-25 attempts for 243 yards and tossing two touchdown passes without an interception. But in spite of those good numbers, the Cleveland offense had its struggles in generating any sustained momentum over the course of the contest. The 24-year-old took responsibility for his unit's troubles, noting that the defense was placed in difficult situations on several occasions and was on the field for too long a time because of the offense's repeated stumbles. "We just have to do a better job just staying on the field," said McCoy. "We can talk about our defense and talk how they gave up a lot of yards rushing, but really a huge part of it is on us. You look at the time of possession and they were on the field almost twice as much as we were. That goes back to us. We've got to convert third downs. We've got to stay on the field longer. We've got to sustain drives." Cincinnati held the football for slightly over 38 of the game's 60 minutes, while the Browns were successful on only 2-of-8 tries on third downs. Cleveland has now averaged a meager 12 points over its last three games, which includes a 13-10 road win over Miami on Dec. 5, and may have a hard time improving upon those numbers over the final portion of the schedule. The Browns host Baltimore, which ranks fourth in the league in scoring defense (18.7 ppg), before closing out the season at home against a Pittsburgh team that's tied for first in the NFL in that category.

Kuczynski ha tenido gran aceptaciÃ³n en inicio de la campaÃ±a, afirmaron San RomÃ¡n y PÃ©rez Tello
description.content:
Los integrantes de la plancha presidencial de Pedro Pablo Kuczynski (Alianza para el Progreso) destacaron que este ha encontrado gran receptividad en los lugares que ha visitado como parte del inicio de su campaÃ±a proselitista, por haber transmitido confianza.
PPK ha sido el diÃ¡logo con los pobladores de las zonas del norte (Trujillo) y sur del paÃ­s (Arequipa y Cusco) que ha recorrido.
"Hemos recibido llamadas de esperanza de todos lados. Pedro Pablo ofrece capacitaciÃ³n, conocimiento, tecnologÃ­a, para que el pueblo pase de espectador a protagonista. Ahora tiene un reconocimiento pleno en todos los sectores", indicÃ³ San RomÃ¡n.
A su turno, PÃ©rez Tello resaltÃ³: "Kuczynski tiene ideas distintas, el PerÃº necesita revitalizar la polÃ­tica, entenderla de manera diferente, y tenerle fe. Ãl es un tÃ©cnico dispuesto a servir".
De otro lado, San RomÃ¡n considerÃ³ que cuenta con una experiencia inconclusa al haber asumido en su momento la Presidencia de la RepÃºblica (en respuesta al autogolpe de Estado dado por Alberto Fujimori en 1992) asÃ­ como la primera vicepresidencia.
"Yo ya tuve una funciÃ³n real, en esos cortos 18 meses de democracia logrÃ© comunicar a los ministros lo importante que era eliminar los obstÃ¡culos que impedÃ­an nuestro desarrollo. Fui escuchado, y contra viento y marea, como no podÃ­amos aprobar las leyes al no ser mayorÃ­a en el Congreso. Eso fue un trabajo delicado de concertaciÃ³n", expresÃ³.

description.hltext_display: Browns place two on IR
description.content: Berea, OH (Sports Network) - The Cleveland Browns placed linebacker Scott Fujita and cornerback Eric Wright on injured reserve Tuesday. Fujita has been out since November 14 when he strained a left knee ligament against the New York Jets. Signed as a free agent in March, he finished his ninth season in the NFL with 51 tackles, 3 1/2 sacks and an interception. Wright hurt his left knee this past Sunday in the 19-17 loss at Cincinnati. He began the season as a starter, but lost that job to rookie Joe Haden after getting beat for several touchdowns. He totaled 42 tackles and an interception along with nine passes defensed in his fourth season. To fill the roster spots, the Browns signed nose tackle Travis Ivey off the practice squad and free agent linebacker Steve Octavien. Also, the team signed fullback Tyler Clutts to the practice squad.

description.hltext_display: Obama signing 'don't ask, don't tell' repeal
description.author: MARK S. SMITH
description.content:
WASHINGTON
So many gay rights and Democratic activists were expected at the signing ceremony that the White House booked a large auditorium at the Interior Department.
"This day has come!" said an elated Mike Almy, an Air Force major discharged four years ago when his sexual orientation became known. "'Don't ask, don't tell' is over, and you no longer have to sacrifice your integrity."
While the elation is real, Pentagon officials caution it could be premature, since the bill requires service chiefs to complete implementation plans before lifting the old policy - and certify to lawmakers that it won't damage combat readiness, as critics charge.
Also, guidelines must be finalized that cover a host of practical questions, from how to educate troops to how sexual orientation should be handled in making barracks assignments.
While officials have avoided timetables, the process will probably take months.
Still, for gay and lesbian Americans, Wednesday is a watershed. And for Obama, it is a day to revel in the achievement of a goal he's long championed.
It is also the second of three expected victories in what's turned out to be - for Obama - a surprisingly productive lame-duck Congress. Weeks after his self-described "shellacking" in the midterm vote, he's won lopsided approval of a tax cut compromise, and the Senate is poised to deliver his top foreign policy goal: ratification of a new nuclear arms treaty with Russia.
Many Democratic liberals were furious over the tax package, believing Obama blithely yielded to Republican demands to retain the same tax cuts for the rich he had loudly denounced on the campaign trail. That's not the case with the repeal of don't ask, don't tell. Lifting of the ban on gays serving openly was something Obama not only campaigned on in 2008 but reiterated in this year's State of the Union speech.
"I will work with Congress and our military to finally repeal the law that denies gay Americans the right to serve the country they love because of who they are," he said in January to cheers in the House chamber, adding, "It's the right thing to do."
Born 17 years ago as a compromise between President Bill Clinton and a resistant Pentagon, the "don't ask, don't tell" policy became for gay rights campaigners a notorious roadblock on the way to full acceptance.
Speaking in June at a Gay Pride Month observance at the White House, Obama likened the fight to end it to the struggle of American blacks for civil rights.
"We have never been closer to ending this discriminatory policy," he declared.
Yet he has also faced rising discontent among gay activists who believed he hadn't moved forcefully enough. He's been heckled at campaign appearances over AIDS funding and the failure to end the military service ban.
Obama countered that as commander-in-chief, he had to ensure the ban's end is carefully prepared for.
That's just what the bill from Congress mandates.
"The implementation and certification process will not happen immediately; it will take time," Air Force Chief of Staff Gen. Norton Schwartz warned in an e-mail that went out right after Saturday's Senate vote. "Meanwhile, the current law remains in effect. All Air Force members should conduct themselves accordingly."
Military and administration officials are wrestling with numerous legal questions raised by the end of the ban - knowing that courts are waiting in the wings. They include what to do about pending expulsion proceedings, and when those ousted under don't-ask-don't-tell might apply to rejoin the armed forces.
For Almy, who appeared at a Capitol Hill ceremony Monday, the important thing is that gay and lesbian service members are no longer singled out because of who they love.

description.hltext_display: Ilala Mayor says inefficiency by council`s legal wing costly
description.content:
Jerry Slaa, the newly elected Mayor of Ilala in Dar es Salaam.
Jerry Slaa, the newly elected Mayor of Ilala in Dar es Salaam, said yesterday long-running wrangles over land in the municipality were due to failure by the local councilâs legal department to execute its duties appropriately.
He made the remarks at a meeting in the city with ward councillors, directors and several other officials, noting that the departmentâs âfailure to deliver as expectedâ had made the government lose a number of land and other cases in court.
Presenting a report on the challenges facing his office and ways to overcome them, the mayor said experience has shown that urban councils have been losing the cases mainly because their legal departments had failed to fight for public welfare.
He added that newly appointed Lands, Housing and Human Settlements Development minister Prof Anna Tibaijuka was having an especially hard time dealing with the problem âowing to lack of patriotism among some council officialsâ.
âOur own municipal council is wrestling with a number of land ownership and use cases simply because some people are invading open spaces for their own selfish interests, sometimes supported by council officials,â said Slaa.
âSome members of law-enforcement agencies have been fomenting or fuelling chaos instead of forestalling it and therefore, not only ensure that justice is done to all but also the council registers sound development,â he added.
He gave other problems resulting from poor enforcement of the laws as wrong parking of vehicles and the conducting of small business on street pavements and others in restricted areas, which inconvenience pedestrians and other road uses.
Ilala District Council legal officer John Mwanga responded by saying he had heard the mayorâs cry over the inefficiency of the legal department and would work on the challenges.
âI have heard the mayorâs concern that the department has made the council run into unnecessary financial and other problems by easily losing cases in the court. I will make sure that we work harder together from now on for the public interests,â he noted.
âThe problems facing the council, especially with regard to legal issues, call for focused strategic planning and supports from councillors, other district officials and the citizenry if we are to speed up social and economic development,â he added.
Some councillors meanwhile underlined the need for the council to set its priorities rights in order to know where to start and where to end.
Prof Tibaijuka declared that the government is determined to recover all open spaces acquired or developed illegally because it was important that people respect city plans and the countryâs laws.
She vowed to continue ensuring compliance with urban development plans, saying her responsibilities include helping the government to recover all illegally occupied open spaces.
Her crusade has however been met with resistance from some of the people who have âlegallyâ acquired and developed open spaces.

Bengals place Owens on IR
description.content: Cincinnati, OH (Sports Network) - The Cincinnati Bengals made it official on Tuesday and placed wide receiver Terrell Owens on injured reserve. Owens suffered a torn meniscus in his left knee during this past Sunday's game against Cincinnati. He had originally hurt the knee during a December 5 contest against New Orleans. The 37-year-old veteran, in his first season in Cincinnati, was leading the Bengals with 72 receptions, 983 yards and nine touchdowns.

De los 130 candidatos al Congreso de la RepÃºblica que presentarÃ¡ el Partido Aprista, 28 serÃ¡n independientes y el resto serÃ¡ elegido en elecciones internas, afirmÃ³ la candidata de dicho partido a la presidencia de la RepÃºblica, Mercedes ArÃ¡oz.
Un sector de polÃ­ticos independientes tambiÃ©n apoya en la elaboraciÃ³n del plan de gobierno aprista, que ya tiene fecha de presentaciÃ³n, segÃºn aÃ±adiÃ³ ArÃ¡oz FernÃ¡ndez. "El plan de gobierno lo debemos tener listo el 9 de enero, es la fecha que vamos a entregarlo, el equipo ya estÃ¡ trabajando, se trata de un grupo mixto, apristas e independientes", indicÃ³ ArÃ¡oz.
Al respecto, la candidata a la segunda vicepresidencia, Nidia VÃ­lchez, sostuvo que el plan plantearÃ¡ reformar los programas sociales con el fin de que lleguen a la poblaciÃ³n mÃ¡s necesitada.

description.hltext_display: Frankfurter Flughafen nach Schneechaos auf Weg zur NormalitÃ¤t
description.content:
vor 4 Min.
Nach dem Schneechaos der vergangenen Tage will Deutschlands grÃ¶Ãter Flughafen in Frankfurt am Main am Mittwoch weitgehend zum normalen Flugbetrieb zurÃ¼ckkehren. Angesichts des Tauwetters in der Rhein-Main-Region seien am Morgen bislang nur 70 FlÃ¼ge gestrichen worden, sagte ein Sprecher der Flughafenbetreibergesellschaft Fraport. Die Start- und Landebahnen seien frei von Eis und Schnee. Am Dienstag seien bedingt durch die winterlichen WetterverhÃ¤ltnisse noch 550 FlÃ¼ge ausgefallen. Die Nacht auf Mittwoch hÃ¤tten rund 300 FluggÃ¤ste in den Terminals des Frankfurter Flughafens auf Feldbetten verbracht.

description.hltext_display: HARD MONEY LOANS: AN INTRODUCTION
description.content:
A hard money loan is a specific type of asset-based loan financing through which a borrower receives funds that is secured by the value of a parcel of real estate. They are typically issued at much higher interest rates than conventional commercial or residential property loans and never issued by a commercial bank or other deposit institution.
Â
Hard money loans are more expensive than traditional loans because they are not based upon traditional credit guidelines that protect investors and banks from high default rates as money lenders may not require the income verification that typical lenders require. Also, they experience higher default rates and, thus, charge a higher rate of interest. Individuals and companies may opt to take this kind of loan when they cannot obtain typical mortgage financing because they do not have acceptable credit or other documentation typically required by a conforming loan.
Â
There are many advantages of utilizing hard money loans as these loans are readily available, when money is often tight with conventional loans. These loans are to close much faster and with less paperwork. This allows real estate investors to take quick advantage of good deals before other investors can.
Â
If you decide that hard money loans are a good option for you, then the next step is applying for one. You must fill out a loan application much like a regular conventional loan and provide all relevant data on your financial situation as well as on the property. Include all relevant details on the deal in your loan package that will speed up the process. Hard money or private loans are more relational than regular loans, so take the time to build long-term relationships with private loan brokers and investors that will make the process smoother in the future if you have an existing relationship. This kind of loans varies greatly in fees and interest rates, so shop your loan around to get the best deal. As this kind of loan is always a risky venture, and it is always preferable to obtain the debt relief that can be negotiated by a qualified consultant. Seeking a hard money business loan is to try to settle existing financial problems just digs a deeper hole for your enterprise and it is better to get the advice of a skilled financial counselor who will advise you regarding the real options available to reorganize your financial obligations.
Lenders online offer equity funding do not all use investors for funding which means that investors do not have to approve the funding while some have other sources such as their own capital and major banks. These types of hard loans are easier to get an approval on and usually have a fast turnaround time on getting the fund. Getting pre approved through an online application makes the process faster. Online applications are usually easy to fill out but for assistance most sites have instant chat with an account representative or they may have a toll free contact number. Online applications through lenders online usually require the business name, phone number; start up date, type of business and email address.

Cowboys place Romo on IR
description.content: Irving, TX (Sports Network) - The Dallas Cowboys officially ended the season of quarterback Tony Romo, placing the starter on injured reserve. Romo hasn't taken a snap since October 25, when he suffered a fractured left collarbone in a 41-35 loss to the New York Giants. In six games this season, the Eastern Illinois product threw for 1,605 yards, 11 touchdowns and seven interceptions on 148-of-213 completions. Jon Kitna is expected to take the reins for the remainder of the schedule, a pair of road games at Arizona and Philadelphia. The Cowboys are 5-9, good enough for last place in the NFC East. To fill the roster spot, the Cowboys signed wide receiver Teddy Williams from the practice squad to the active roster.

description.content:
LONDON, Dec. 22, 2010 /PRNewswire/ -- Market Publishers Ltd informs that new in-demand market research reports by Ovum have been added to its catalogue. . The report describes data services targeted at specific market segments, provides the key to faster returns on network investments. The research provides the information on the operators that are now planning their network rollout and service strategies and discusses 3G launch strategies in India â¦ . The report provides a detailed analysis of the global service providers...
America Movil. The research dwells on the company focus on bundled offerings and multi-play services as well as expanding 3G network capacity to drive the next phase of growth. The research discusses strategic objectives and the process of integration of newly acquired operations and stiff competition from regional and local players as key challenges â¦ . The report provides a detailed analysis of how current MTRs were determined across the EU15 and look at how NRAs are taking the Recommendation into consideration as they undertake new market analyses. The research discusses EC recommendations aimed at harmonizing the charges across Europe â¦ . This report describes the main HSPA+ enhancements brought by 3GPP R8, R9, and R10. It also offers early trends for these future HSPA+ options. The report provides technical overview of HSPA evolutionary options and mobile broadband connection forecasts for 2009-2015 â¦

description.hltext_display: Carlos Bruce pidiÃ³ a Mercedes ArÃ¡oz que espere hasta febrero para un debate en Bagua
description.content:
El legislador Carlos Bruce y el ex ministro del Interior Javier ReÃ¡tegui, miembros de la fÃ³rmula presidencial de PerÃº Posible que encabeza Alejandro Toledo, consideraron que varios candidatos al sillÃ³n de Pizarro han "hecho mÃ¡rketing polÃ­tico" al adornar sus planchas con la presencia de mujeres, por ejemplo.
En una entrevista ofrecida al programa de TV ?Prensa Libre?, Bruce fue el primero en salir al frente ante las crÃ­ticas que Toledo recibiÃ³ por incluir solo a dos representantes de su partido, limeÃ±os y ex ministros de su gobierno, sin tomar en cuenta a ningÃºn representante de provincias o a alguno de las agrupaciones polÃ­ticas que la chacana tiene como alianza ( Somos PerÃº y AcciÃ³n Popular).
"Toledo ha priorizado tener a su lado gente de su confianza, con la que ha trabajado, gente que tiene experiencia de Estado y que se podrÃ­a hacer cargo del gobierno ante alguna enfermedad o lo que fuere del presidente", arguyÃ³.
DEBATE CON ARÃOZ En relaciÃ³n con el debate que demanda a Toledo, la candidata del Apra, Mercedes ArÃ¡oz, asÃ­ como los integrantes de su plancha, Bruce indicÃ³ que esto responde a una estrategia debido a la baja aceptaciÃ³n que la representante del partido de gobierno ha obtenido hasta ahora en los sondeos.
SegÃºn indicÃ³, se trata de un "interÃ©s lÃ³gico, pues ArÃ¡oz no ha repuntado lo que el Apra querÃ­a".
Sobre el particular, Bruce acotÃ³ con ironÃ­a: "Si quiere un debate, lo va a tener, asÃ­ como va a tenerlo con los demÃ¡s candidatos en el mes de febrero, incluso le vamos a dar libertad de que ella elija el dÃ­a y la hora pero que nos deje escoger el lugar. Yo creo que puede ser un sitio fuera de Lima, le propongo Bagua, vamos a discutir a Bagua .
En tanto, el parlamentario hizo un mea culpa a nombre del gobierno toledista (2001-2006) y reconociÃ³ que fue un error polÃ­tico el aumento de los sueldos del entonces presidente de la RepÃºblica asÃ­ como de sus ministros.
No obstante, Bruce seÃ±alÃ³ que hubo aÃºn un peor yerro de parte del gobierno aprista al reducir los salarios del personal tÃ©cnico "que ha optado por "dejar al Estado sin gerencia".
"Cuando nos tocÃ³ ser gobierno duplicamos el sueldo de los maestros y no hubo un descalabro econÃ³mico porque sabemos hacerlo. Otros no saben cÃ³mo hacerlo. Vamos a volver a hacerlo pero condicionado a su rendimiento", manifestÃ³.
Finalmente, el actual secretario general de PerÃº Posible, Javier ReÃ¡tegui, revelÃ³ que el candidato presidencial de Alianza para el Gran Cambio, Pedro Pablo Kuczynski, quiso aspirar a una de las vicepresidencias de la RepÃºblica representando a PerÃº Posible, pero "ya no habÃ­a espacio".

description.hltext_display: Billy Ray Cyrus reportedly moving back to Nashville
description.content:
The singer is selling his marital home with now-ex Tish in LA.
DAILY ENTERTAINMENT PHOTOS: Get the Latest Celeb Gossip!
Billy Rayand Tish Cyrus are putting their family home on the market just three months after their split, according to reports.
The "Achy Breaky Heart" hitmaker and his wife filed for divorce in October, with both citing irreconcilable differences as they seek to bring their 17-year marriage to an end.
They have now decided to offload their marital home in Toluca Lake, Los Angeles - putting it up for sale for over $7 million, according to GossipCop.com.
The former couple married in 1992 and has three children together as well as three kids from previous relationships.
Billy Ray is allegedly eyeing a permanent move back to Nashville, where he's been since announcing his divorce form Tish.

description.hltext_display: Pink and fun and giving all over
description.content:
Share
One great thing that makes Durango such a giving community isnât just that weâre loaded with nonprofits that make sure we donât forget our neighbors. Itâs that even as individuals, we find so many ways to make a difference.
Thatâs the case with Durango High School senior Chelsea McSparren, who took something that meant a lot to her personally â the quest for a cure for breast cancer, which has struck her grandmother, two aunts, three great-aunts and four cousins â and came up with a way for our community to help her work for the cause.
She had been thinking about doing something for a while, and when she learned that her motherâs college sorority, Zeta Tau Alpha, and its foundation also were involved in the cause, an idea was born: Collect Yoplait yogurt pink lids.
Itâs a campaign thatâs been going on for more than a decade, and Iâm sure many a local individual has participated over those years. But Chelsea wanted to get us all on board. So she set up collection points at 16 locations around town, from both City Markets and Albertsons to the American Cancer Society and Walgreens. She even convinced the DoubleTree Hotel to switch the brand of yogurt it serves at breakfast to Yoplait during the campaign.
Yoplait increased its donation to the Susan G. Komen for the Cure to 10 cents a lid this year. And since 2004, it has donated 5 cents for every lid collected by a sorority member to the Zeta Tau Alpha Foundation, which supports breast-cancer causes and has for 18 years. Throw in the fact that Zeta Tau Alpha said its foundation would donate another 5 cents for every lid donated by a sorority member, and Chelsea could raise 20 cents for every one of those pink lids donated.
Then she added that old marketing tool, a competition, amped up to include school pride, pitting Miller and Escalante middle schools against each other. You might think middle school students wouldnât be all that interested in collecting pink yogurt lids, but they went all out, bringing in more than 1,200 lids between the two schools.
Escalante won the bragging rights and the reward Chelsea had promised â an ice cream party for the whole school. Weâre talking more than 500 people and a ton of ice cream and toppings. The students celebrated their victory Friday, a great send-off for the winter break.
Chelseaâs goal â which she considered a pretty aggressive one â was to collect 5,000 lids, which would raise $1,000. As of Monday, her total was 9,130 lids, or $1,826.
The project is also part of something Chelsea just became interested in this year, working toward her Gold Award from the Girl Scouts, the equivalent of an Eagle Scout designation from the Boy Scouts. She had been a Girl Scout when she was young, but came back to the organization as she learned about the Girl Scoutsâ mission for girls to work with and be a part of their communities, a value she picked up from her parents, Lyle and Laura McSparren.
Chelsea doesnât know where sheâll be attending college next year, but she does know sheâs planning to study finance or some kind of business before going on to medical school to become a surgeon.
Oh â and sheâs going to continue to organize collections of those pink lids wherever she ends up.
Drinking eggnog with their birthday cake are Eric Speck, Reg Graham, Jean Smith, Jennifer Houle, Claire Choate, Dianne Skinner, Jan Newlin, Sean McCardell, KeganMcCardell, Joseph Burns, Wendy Krull, Bob Kunkel and Ginna Harbison.
When I write the name âEvan Shinners,â music lovers will recall the gawky young man who drove us all to our feet in his performances here in 2003 and 2005.
He first came across our radar as the silver medalist in the Senior Division and the bronze medalist in the Concerto Division at the first Four Corners Piano Competition in the spring of 2003. Shinners returned twice â first to make his conducting debut with the Durango Choral Society (after only two lessons) and second to wow us out of our seats again when he returned after beginning his studies at The Juilliard School.
So it was only a bit of a surprise when Judith Reynolds showed me the front page of The New York Times Weekend Arts section dated Dec. 10. There was Shinners, in a photo that almost took up the entire page above the fold.
Heâs part of a performance piece âStop, Repair, Prepare: Variations on âOde to Joyâ for a Prepared Piano,â which will be performed at the Museum of Modern Art in New York City through Jan. 10.
Shinners is playing the fourth and fifth movements of Beethovenâs Fifth Symphony from a circle cut out from inside the piano (in other words, backwards) while moving the piano in a choreographed routine around the second-floor atrium of the museum. Reviewer Roberta Smith wrote, âEvan Shinners attacked the score with a bravura that might have pleased Liszt (who originally transcribed it for two pianos, not two-thirds of one), while moving in a crab-walking spiral.â
To check out the photo and review, visit http://nytimes/2010/12/10/arts/design.
Celebrating their anniversaries with candlelight and sleigh rides are Martin and Charlotte Pirnat, Dorman and DottieMcShan, Jim and Janet Coloff, Delmar and Patricia Beard, Allen and Suzanne Washburn, Chris and Cheryl Bauer, Jim and Donna Aubrey, Brian and Shana Zink, Derek and Pam Snyder and Ray and Sue Walker.
SARAH FRIEDMAN/Herald
Durango High School senior Chelsea McSparren, who spearheaded a community-wide campaign to collect pink Yoplait yogurt lids to raise money for breast cancer research, said, âIâm pretty stoked about this. This is a lot bigger than I thought it would be.â She promised an ice cream social to the middle school that collected the most lids, and more than 500 students and staff at Escalante Middle School enjoyed their reward Friday.

description.hltext_display: IPP Media, donors award best ARU students in Dar
description.content:
IPP Media is among donors who joined hands in supporting Ardhi University (ARU) through different prizes to best students in the previous academic year.
ARU Deputy Vice-Chancellor (Academic Affairs) Prof Mengiseny Kaseva said recently that a total of 122 students who demonstrated outstanding performance in various courses received different awards from various firms.
Apart from IPP Media, other donors included Kahama Mining Corporation, Ministry of Communication, Science and Technology, Knight Frank, Tanzania Institution of Valuers and Estate Agents, Africa Property Ltd. and Proper Consult Ltd.
Others were Allan Mugisha, T.C Rwechungura, Professor Ebenezer Acquaye Memorial, Mrs Siwale, Horsens Polytechnic and Majengo Estates Developers Ltd.
According to the Don, the awarding ceremony was held at ARU campus in Dar es Salaam recently.
He said the prizes, over 187 of them, were designed to encourage students to build on their strengths and to achieve all-round excellence in the courses and nurturing of talents.
Prof Kaseva said the prizes were presented by ARU Vice-Chancellor Prof Idrisa Mshoro on behalf of the donors.
Among recipients of the prizes was Franella Halla from the School of Environmental Science and Technology, whose prize was provided by IPP media, Kahama Mining Corporation, Vice-Chancellorâs office and the Ministry of Communication, Science and Technology.
Commenting on the award, Franella said, âIâm very glad to receive this award, and express my sincere thanks to Mr. Reginald Abraham Mengi and other donors who have continued supporting me and other students by providing prizes to best students in various courses.â

description.hltext_display: Tiket Pesawat ke Malaysia Nyaris Penuh
description.content:
Liputan6.com, Tangerang: Animo masyarakat Indonesia menyaksikan laga final pertama Piala AFF 2010 di Stadion Nasional, Bukit Jalil, Malaysia tampaknya cukup besar. Sejumlah maskapai penerbangan yang memiliki rute penerbangan Jakarta-Malaysia menyatakan tiket tujuan Negeri Jiran sudah hampir penuh hingga 26 Desember mendatang atau ketika digelarnya pertandingan antara Indonesia melawan Malaysia.
Khusus Garuda Indonesia, maskapai pelat merah itu bahkan menyiapkan empat penerbangan tambahan berkapasitas 1.000 tempat duduk. Empat ratus kursi di antaranya pesawat Boeing 747-400 yang akan berangkat dari Bandar Udara Soekarno-Hatta, Tangerang, Banten, 26 Desember mendatang pukul 10.00 WIB dan kembali dari malaysia pukul 11.00 waktu setempat. Tiga penerbangan lainnya pesawat jenis Boeing 737-300 yang akan berangkat dari Jakarta dan Surabaya, Jawa Timur.
Humas Garuda Tri Poetra I Sakti menambahkan, harga tiket penerbangan juga didiskon dari biasanya US$ 266 menjadi US$ 156 pulang pergi. Selain itu, para suporter akan langsung diangkut kendaraan dari Bandara Kuala Lumpur menuju Stadion Nasional, Bukit Jalil. Mereka juga bakal diberi kemudahan mendapatkan tiket menonton lantaran telah berkoordinasi dengan pihak Kedutaan Besar Indonesia di Kuala Lumpur.(BOG)

description.hltext_display: UK: Heathrow Airport reopens southern runway
description.content: The southern runway at Heathrow Airport has been reopened after four days. Thousands of passengers have been stranded at the airport since heavy snowfall on Saturday grounded planes, with 700 flights cancelled on Tuesday.Eurostar said it hopes to run a near normal service on Wednesday. Hundreds of people queued at St Pancras station overnight as services remain disrupted. There are also delays on several train routes serving London.A limited service is now operating on the East Coast route between Peterborough and London King's Cross, after it was suspended following severe damage to overhead power lines at Huntingdon. Heathrow Airport has seen cancellations with backlogs piling up as the weather conditions forced thousands of passengers to camp at the west London airport. A third of flights took off from the airport on Tuesday, and passengers have been advised only to travel to the airport if their flight has been confirmed to reduce congestion. Although the airport has been able to clear snow from the docking bays for aircrafts, BAA's chief executive Colin Matthews warned it could be some time before normal operations resume.

event_or_fact.property: Although the airport has been able to clear snow from the docking bays for aircrafts

description.content: Dhriti Ranjana Ray & Manoj RammohanNew Delhi, Dec 22 (PTI) Riding high on its insatiable appetite for foreign assets, India Inc announced merger and acquisition deals worth a record USD 55 billion this year, including a record number of billion-dollar transactions.As the year 2010 comes to a close, a look back at India Inc''s deal activity shows a splendid year, with the total deal value surpassing the previous record set in 2007 and big-ticket deals making a comeback as corporate India regained its deal-making appetite with nine billion-dollar-plus deals -- the highest-ever in a single year. ...

description.content:
The Glee star proves she was born to take on the entertainment biz.
Before Lea Michele was Rachel Berry on Glee, she was a precocious little girl shining on Broadway. Back in 1998, when Lea was 12, an MTV video crew interviewed Lea and her mom about what it was like to be a kid in show business. Needless to say, Lea's mom didn't say much as Lea stole the show. description.hltext_display: Mattel Rises 0.86% on Heavy Volume: Watch For Potential Pullback (MAT)
description.content:
Mattel (NYSE:MAT) traded in a range yesterday that spanned from a low of $25.62 to a high of $26.01. Yesterday, the shares gained 0.86%, which took the trading range above the 3-day high of $25.80 on volume of 2.7 million shares. Often times after large one-day gains, short term traders will seek to take profits and, as such, investors should be cautious.
Shares of Mattel are currently trading above their 50-day moving average (MA) of $24.43 and above their 200-day MA of $22.86. Look for the MA to provide support for a short-term pullback in the shares.
SmarTrend currently has shares of Mattel in an Uptrend and issued the Uptrend alert on June 16, 2010 at $22.46. The stock has risen 14.2% since the Uptrend alert was issued.
SmarTrend expects the share price to pullback toward the $25.80 support level. Afterwards, we expect it to move upward with its peers in the SmarTrend Toys & Games industry.
Keywords: mattel trading range stock news

description.hltext_display: Awas, Ada Tiket Palsu!
description.content:
Liputan6.com, Jakarta: PSSI menduga ada banyak tiket masuk palsu yang dijual oleh calo saat pertandingan semifinal Leg Kedua Piala Asean Football Federation atau AFF Suzuki Cup 2010. Demikian diungkapkan Bendahara PSSI Achsanul Qosasi di kantor PSSI Senayan, Jakarta, Rabu (22/12).
Achsanul yang juga Wakil Ketua Komisi Sembilan Dewan Perwakilan Rakyat mengatakan tiket palsu itu sangat mirip dengan tiket yang dijual PSSI. Ia mengaku belum bisa mengatasi hal itu dengan menerapkan penjualan tiket melalui online secara keseluruhan karena terbatasnya kapasitas jaringan internet yang dimilikinya. PSSI baru bisa menjual tiket VVIP dan VIP melalui internet.
"Solusi mengatasi melalui penjualan online, namun baru tiket VVIP, VIP timur dan VIP Barat saja yang bisa," imbuh Achsanul.
Achsanul juga mengimbau agar penonton membeli tiket di loket resmi yang telah disediakan dan menghindari membeli tiket melalui calo. (Vin)

description.hltext_display: Population surge gives Texas 4 new US House seats
description.author: JAY ROOT
description.content:
AUSTIN, Texas
Texas is gaining four seats in the U.S. House, twice as many as Florida, the only other state to pick up multiple ones, according to new population figures announced Tuesday by the U.S. Census Bureau. All told, Republican-leaning states will pick up at least a half dozen House seats thanks to the 2010 census, which found the nation's population growing more slowly than in past decades but still shifting to the South and West.
With Texas Republicans using recent elections to fortify their already solid control of the state Legislature, the political process of redrawing the state's congressional map would seem to benefit the GOP, too.
But Democrats say not so fast.
Boyd Richie, chairman of the Texas Democratic Party, said Hispanic and black population growth account for the additional seats, and he vowed to fight for a redistricting plan that takes their numbers into account.
"A legal and fair redistricting process must produce new congressional districts that reflect the Hispanic and African American population growth," Richie said. "Our Democratic numbers may be down, but we are not out. Democrats cannot and will not allow our voices to be silenced in this critical process."
The Census Bureau said the nation's population on April 1 was 308,745,538, up from 281.4 million a decade ago. The growth rate for the past decade was 9.7 percent, the lowest since the Great Depression. The U.S. population grew by 13.2 percent from 1990 to 2000. Michigan was the only state to lose population during the past decade. Nevada, with a 35 percent increase, was the fastest-growing state.
The new numbers are a boon for Republicans, with Texas leading the way among GOP-leaning states that will gain House seats, mostly at the Rust Belt's expense. Following each once-a-decade census, the nation must reapportion the House's 435 districts to make them roughly equal in population, with each state getting at least one seat.
In all, the census figures show a shift affecting 18 states taking effect when the 113th Congress takes office in 2013. The political power follows the high population growth, shifting toward the south and west and away from the industrial Midwest and northeast.
With reapportionment settled, the far more politically divisive process of redistricting is set to begin. In Texas, both major parties were bracing for a showdown over the state's new residents, beginning a fight that is sure to spark court action. But with Republican supermajorities in the Legislature, the temptation to run the table will be strong.
Rep. Pete Gallego, D-Alpine, said if the federal courts don't intervene to compel fairness, Republicans will likely produce a map that gives their party the advantage in three or perhaps even all four of the new seats.
"It is very easy to overreach when you're holding the map and have the pen in your hand," he said.
Despite the party's recent gains in the November legislative elections, Republicans won't have unchecked authority to draw the state's congressional map to benefit themselves.
Civil rights laws require that the interests of minority voters be protected as district boundaries are redrawn, and Texas is one of the states whose redistricting plans require "pre-clearance" by federal authorities under the Voting Rights Act.
Democrats are also counting on an assist from the Obama administration, which could have a significant voice in the pre-clearance process. It is the first time since the Voting Rights Act passed that the Justice Department will be in Democratic hands during the redistricting process.
Hispanic growth doesn't automatically translate into Democratic growth, though. Two heavily Hispanic congressional seats in South Texas flipped to Republicans this year. There also are several new Latino GOP members about to be sworn into legislative seats.
South Texas Rep. Aaron Pena, who recently left the Democrat Party and became a Republican, said Texas Latinos are more conservative than their counterparts in western states such as California and Nevada.
Pena, who sits on the House Redistricting Committee, said his "educated guess" was that Republicans would get three of the four seats.
"The Hispanic community is increasingly up for grabs," Pena said. "It's truly a swing population."
Texas already had the largest Republican delegation in Congress, holding 20 of the state's 32 seats. In the 2010 elections, the party picked up another three seats, two of them in heavily Latino districts in South Texas. With all the new growth, Texas will now have 36 seats and 38 presidential electoral votes.
Federal lawsuits are essentially guaranteed as part of the process, and if the past is any guide, the courts will have a major say in how the lines are finally drawn. In 2001, the Texas Legislature deadlocked on Congressional redistricting, leaving the federal courts to redraw all the districts. In 2006, the U.S. Supreme Court ordered that new lines be drawn in several districts to protect the rights of Hispanic voters in South Texas.
Starting early next year, most state governments will use detailed, computer-generated data on voting patterns to carve neighborhoods in or out of newly drawn House districts, tilting them more to the left or right. Sometimes politicians play it safe, quietly agreeing to protect Republican and Democratic incumbents alike. But sometimes the party in control will gamble and aggressively try to reconfigure the map to dump as many opponents as possible.
The U.S. is still growing quickly relative to other developed nations. The population in France and England each increased roughly 5 percent over the past decade, while in Japan the number is largely unchanged, and Germany's population is declining. China grew at about 6 percent; Canada's growth rate is roughly 10 percent.
The 2010 census results also are used to distribute more than $400 billion in annual federal aid and will change each state's Electoral College votes beginning in the 2012 presidential election.
Apart from the respective four- and two-seat gains in Texas and Florida, Arizona, Georgia, Nevada, South Carolina, Utah and Washington are all picking up one new U.S. House seat. Ohio and New York will lose two House seats each. Losing one House seat are Illinois, Iowa, Louisiana, Massachusetts, Michigan, Missouri, New Jersey and Pennsylvania.

description.hltext_display: Give to the organizations you trust
description.content:
Share
As we near the end of another year, many people look to make charitable contributions. Here are a few things to consider when making your charitable contribution.
Most people report that the top reason they give to a particular charity is that they trust the organization. Nonprofit organizations can inspire trust by being transparent with financial information, by having a good board of directors overseeing the work and by measuring success.
Transparency with financial information can be achieved fairly easily in todayâs electronic world. Most nonprofits have websites. The best organizations will post financial information there or, even better, will post its IRS reporting form and/or its annual audit. If the organization has a fairly small budget, it might not be able to afford an annual audit. In that case, an annual report that sums up the previous yearâs financial information is a good substitute.

description.hltext_display: US Poised To Approve Nuclear Arms Pact With Russia
description.content:
9 Republicans Say They'll Back Treaty
DESMOND BUTLER, Associate Press
UPDATED: 1:06 am MST December 22, 2010
Images: Senate Votes To Close Debate On Nuke Pact
WASHINGTON -- The Senate is poised to approve a nuclear arms pact with Russia, handing President Barack Obama a huge victory on his top foreign policy priority.
Passage of the New START treaty appeared assured after 11 Republicans joined Democrats in a vote Tuesday to end debate on the pact. That signaled that Obama should have the two-thirds majority he needs when the Senate votes on final approval Wednesday.
The approval would mark a big comeback for Obama's arm controls efforts after the treaty appeared all but dead just weeks ago. It also would allow Obama to continue efforts to improve relations with Russia.
Ratification would mark a third recent major political victory for Obama, even though his Democratic party was trounced in last month's congressional elections. In recent days he won passage of a bipartisan tax deal and a vote ending the ban on gays openly serving in the military.
"We are on the brink of writing the next chapter in the 40-year history of wrestling with the threat of nuclear weapons," Foreign Relations Committee Chairman John Kerry, a Democrat, said after the vote.
The treaty would limit each country's strategic nuclear warheads to 1,550, down from the current ceiling of 2,200. It also would establish a system for monitoring and verification. U.S. weapons inspections ended last year with the expiration of a 1991 treaty.
The administration was adamant that it be ratified this year because the Democrats' majority in the Senate is set to shrink by five in January and waiting could have meant months of delay or defeat.
Republicans accused Democrats of rushing approval of the treaty for political reasons. They have asserted it would limit U.S. missile defense options and argued it has insufficient procedures to verify Russia's adherence.
When Jon Kyl, the leading Republican on negotiations over the treaty, suggested a delay last month, Obama appeared unlikely to find the nine Republican votes needed for passage.
But he and top members of his administration lobbied intensely, with Obama postponing his Christmas vacation in Hawaii. They enlisted support from top military officials and big-name Republicans from past administrations who argued the treaty was essential for U.S. national security.
In the end, they persuaded enough Republicans to defy the party's top two leaders in the Senate and support the pact.
"We know when we've been beaten," Republican Sen. Orrin Hatch told reporters hours before Tuesday's vote.
Even the Senate's No. 3 Republican, Lamar Alexander, endorsed the accord, saying he was assured U.S. defenses would not be weakened.
The treaty will leave the United States "with enough nuclear warheads to blow any attacker to kingdom come," Alexander said on the Senate floor.
Republicans had tried to kill the treaty by forcing changes in its language that would have sent it back for negotiations with Moscow. Democrats were working to appease some Republican senators by letting them raise these issues in legislation accompanying the treaty that would not directly affect the treaty.
Most Republicans remained opposed.
"The administration did not negotiate a good treaty," Kyl said. "They went into the negotiations it seems to me with the attitude with the Russians just like the guy who goes into the car dealership and says, 'I'm not leaving here until I buy a car.'"
Though Kyl looks likely to vote on the losing side of the debate over the treaty, in his negotiations with the administration he did win Obama's commitment to modernize the remaining nuclear arsenal with projected spending of $85 billion over 10 years.
Some of that money is now in the pipeline, contained in a stopgap government funding bill that cleared Congress on Tuesday. The measure would finance the government, mostly at current levels, through March 4.
It makes an exception for nuclear security programs, allowing the government to spend money to modernize the United States' nuclear arsenal at a rate equal to Obama's $624 million request.

description.hltext_display: Ambitious `high-yield` seed project in the offing
description.content:
Prof Jumanne Maghembe
The government plans to embark on a major project geared to producing enough high-yield seeds in a fresh bid to meet the countryâs growing demand for quality seeds.
Agriculture, Food Security and Cooperatives minister Prof Jumanne Maghembe made the plan public yesterday during his official visit to Selian Agricultural Research Institute (Sari) based here.
The minister explained that the government would involve all stakeholders, including seeds research centres and companies producing the input, in designing a new system that would ensure quality high-yield seeds are available for all farmers in need of them.
According to Maghembe, currently the country needs about 120,000 tonnes of high-yield seeds. However he said, only 30,000 tonnes were being produced and about 5,000 tonnes were used by farmers.
âKilimo Kwanza initiative will not be achieved if our farmers will continue using traditional seeds,â he said, informing that implementation of the plan would begin next year.
âWe have tried to sensitize farmers to use fertilizers, but weâve not promoted the use of improved seeds for higher outputs. It is clear that applying fertilizers without quality seeds wonât help the farmers earn much. So, we need to seriously work on this area by ensuring that farmers have access to quality seeds,â the minister explained.
According to him, three quarter of maize farmers in the country rely on traditional maize seeds, which provide poor results.
Meanwhile, Prof Maghembe commended Sari for its role in developing nine improved maize varieties in the market, calling other research centres and seed producing firms to borrow a leaf.
âThe plan will also empower local seed producers to improve the quantity of seeds they produce,â he added. The Minister also expressed optimism that availability of quality and high-yielding seeds would help a great deal in supporting the private sector engage in commercial farming.
He also informed that the government plans to transform Sari into an independent institute in a bid to improve its core duty of offering effective agricultural research services.
Earlier, acting director of Agricultural Research and Training for the Northern Zone, Dr. Mboyi Mugendi said that, Sari has developed nine maize species and four bean species, which most of them are drought and disease resistant.
He however cited shortage of researchers as the main challenge hindering the development of the institute as most of those working with the centre were about to retire.

description.hltext_display: Make sure good nutrition supports your long life
description.content:
Share
The U.S. population is aging. The majority of residents are middle-aged or older (older than 45 years), and the ratio of older people to young is increasing.
The fastest growing age group is the older than 85 sector. Since 1950, their numbers have increased sevenfold.
Life expectancy in the U.S. also has risen â to 81 years for white women, 76 years for black women, 75 years for white men and 69 years for black men. In 1900, life expectancy was a mere 47 years for most people.
Good nutrition has long been associated with longevity, but the questions still being asked are âwhat role does nutrition play in the aging process, and what role can it play in slowing aging?â Aging is an inevitable and natural process, but it can be slowed (within genetic limits; the oldest age it is thought humans could possibly live is 130 years) by healthy lifestyle behaviors and good nutrition throughout life. Good nutrition can also improve our quality of life, especially as we age.
One of the most important outcomes of eating a healthy diet affects us more as we age â weight gain. Keeping a healthy weight throughout your adult life will improve your chances of living longer and lower your risks for most types of chronic disease, such as cancer, heart disease, high blood pressure, diabetes, stroke and arthritis. As we age, most people gain weight slowly, maybe 5 pounds per decade, but this creeping weight gain affects our health and quality of life. Two-thirds of adults in the U.S. are overweight or obese, and the older we get, the more we tend to lose bone and muscle and gain body fat. Hormones that regulate appetite and metabolism decrease and become less active with age, so itâs more important to eat healthy and decrease the amount of calories eaten the older we get.

description.hltext_display: Bret Michaels is engaged
description.content:
After dating on-again/off-again girlfriend Kristi Gibson for sixteen years, the rocker finally put a ring on it.
The Rock of Love bus can officially be retired, . On last night's episode of Michaels' latest VH1 hit, Bret Michaels: Life As I Know It, the Poison star popped the question to his girlfriend of sixteen years, Kristi Gibson.
When Gibson looked on in disbelief, Michaels pleaded with her to give him an answer. "Please say yes or the rejection will kill me right now," he said. After a few seconds, Michaels got the answer he was looking for.
We predict a new VH1 series as the couple makes plans to head to the altar.

event_or_fact.property: Please say yes or the rejection will kill me right now

description.hltext_display: China's State Grid pays nearly $1 billion for Brazilian electricity assets, 30-year concession
description.content:
SHANGHAI - China's biggest electricity company, State Grid, says it is paying $989 million for seven Brazilian power companies and their transmission lines as it seeks to expand overseas.
The investment includes a 30-year concession to operate the Brazilian power grids that can be renewed for 20 years once it expires, according to a notice seen Wednesday on the website of the Chinese government agency that manages state assets.
The deal marks a further expansion of State Grid into overseas markets following a $3.9 billion, 25-year contract with the Philippines to run that country's power grid.
Though not well known abroad, State Grid says it is ranked eighth among the Fortune 500 and operates power lines across 26 of China's 32 provinces and regions. It is among many state-owned businesses that are heeding the government's call to "go out" by investing overseas.
The investment in Brazil will suit the "strategic co-operation" between the two countries and is expected to yield an average annual profit of $110 million, State Grid said.
Brazil relies heavily on power from Itaipu, the world's second-largest hydroelectric dam after China's Three Gorges. It has faced intermittent blackouts in recent years, though the government says it has invested heavily in transmission lines since President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva took office in 2003.
State Grid's own networks are facing troubles over shortages of coal and gaps in demand and supply that oblige many cities to ration or cut power. Wide areas were left without power nearly three years ago due to icy winter weather that downed transmission lines and towers in central China.

description.hltext_display: Lindsay Lohan accused of 'battery' at rehab clinic
description.content:
The troubled star allegedly pushed a care worker, but sources say Lindsay did not start the altercation.
DAILY ENTERTAINMENT PHOTOS: Get the Latest Celeb Gossip!
Lindsay Lohan is reportedly at the center of a police probe amid allegations she assaulted a staff member at California's Betty Ford clinic.
It emerged today that officers in Palm Desert, California are investigating after a female member of the Betty Ford staff was assaulted during an altercation with Lohan and some pals, according to TMZ.com.
Cops received a call at 1:03am on December 10 for "hand-to-hand battery" - but a source tells the website Lohan was not the perpetrator of the incident.
The troubled actress insists she didn't strike the first blow and merely pushed back at the unnamed member of staff after she was "unfairly" lectured about arriving at the home after her curfew and ordered to take a drug or alcohol test, according to TMZ.
The website claims Lohan yelled, "Take your hands off of me" as the drama escalated, and then "pushed back" against the woman.

description.hltext_display: NCKU Center for Teaching and Learning Development Inaugurated
description.content:
TAINAN, Taiwan To elevate teaching quality and student learning efficiency and achieve academic excellence, the Center for Teaching and Learning Development (CTLD) of National Cheng Kung University (NCKU), Tainan, Taiwan, is inaugurated on December 22nd in 3rd floor, Yun-Ping Building, Kuang-Fu Campus.
âThe most important function of a university is education, cultivating talents, and then research and social service. It is a universityâs mission to educate youth of the next generation. Education should include two aspects, teaching and learning. However, we mainly focus on the teaching of professors, neglecting the learning of students, which is allowing students to absorb as much knowledge as they can,â said President Michael Ming-Chiao Lai of National Cheng Kung University in his opening remark.
President Lai also mentioned, âNational Cheng Kung University had established Center for Faculty Development which focused solely on the cultivation of teachers. Thus, I believe the newly inaugurated Center for Teaching and Learning Development must embody both aspects of teaching, developing teaching methods, and learning, discovering questions, raising questions and finding solutions. I believe this is the essence of education and the development direction of the future education of National Cheng Kung University.â
NCKU Senior Executive Vice-President Hwung-Hweng Hwung revealed, âI am pleased to see that Vice-President for Academic Affairs Tang has established the Center for Teaching and Learning Development. As I have often said, outstanding talents cannot be cultivated without excellent education, and universities cannot transform into top universities without outstanding talents.â Vice-President Hwung-Hweng Hwung also explained, âAs graduates return to their alma mater, they do not recall how wonderful a professorâs research is and they only remember how strict the teaching of a professor is. Studentsâ parents also do not consider how renowned a professor is in the research field and they only care about how well their children can learn from the school. Therefore, a university, especially a top university, needs to take both teaching and learning into account.â Vice-President Hwung-Hweng Hwung stated, âIn Taiwan, teachers often teach what they like and students often learn what they want. This is incorrect. As teachers devote themselves into teaching, they must observe the learning efficiency of the students from a different perspective. I hope the Center for Teaching and Development Learning can spread the concept for the teachers to realize the importance of education.â
NCKU Vice-President for Academic Affairs Ming-Jer Tang said, âAfter four years of efforts, Center for Teaching and Learning Development finally inaugurated today. For the past years, under the goal set by President Lai, the Office for Academic Affairs has devoted itself to humanistic and innovative education and cross-disciplinary learning. We are excited that the Center for Teaching and Learning Development, established to truly integrate all the resources at NCKU and to promote NCKU to a top university, is finally inaugurated.â Vice-President for Academic Affairs Tang also said, âWe have visited research and teaching universities in The United States years ago, realizing that their centers for teaching and learning development have abundant resources, and we have also visited National Taiwan University and Chung Yuan Christian University, discovering that the former lacks integration and the latter lacks manpower. With the advantages of integrated resources and unified manpower as our foundation, I believe National Cheng Kung University can become an internationally top university in the future.â
The newly inaugurated NCKU Center for Teaching and Learning Development is located on the 3rd floor of Yun-Ping Building, Kuang-Fu Campus, and NCKU President Michael Ming-Chiao Lai, Senior Executive Vice-President Hwung-Hweng Hwung, Vice-President for Academic Affairs Ming-Jer Tang, Director of Center for Teaching and Learning Development J. J. Wang, Director of Center for General Education Wei-Yung Wang, Secretary General Woei-Shyan Lee, other directors, deans and dozens of personnel have attended the inauguration ceremony.
The NCKU Center for Faculty Development, established in 2006, aims to strengthen the professional teaching ability of teachers and teaching assistants; however, to achieve academic excellence and innovation and elevate teaching quality and student learning efficiency, the Center for Teaching and Learning Development (CTLD) is established.

description.hltext_display: SmarTrend Watching for Potential Pullback in Shares of Whiting Petroleum After 2.91% Gain (WLL)
description.content:
Whiting Petroleum (NYSE:WLL) traded in a range yesterday that spanned from a low of $114.45 to a high of $117.71. Yesterday, the shares gained 2.91%, which took the trading range above the 3-day high of $114.87 on volume of 569,000 shares. Often times after large one-day gains, short term traders will seek to take profits and, as such, investors should be cautious.
Shares of Whiting Petroleum are currently trading above their 50-day moving average (MA) of $107.10 and above their 200-day MA of $91.24. Look for the MA to provide support for a short-term pullback in the shares.
SmarTrend currently has shares of Whiting Petroleum in an Uptrend and issued the Uptrend alert on September 03, 2010 at $91.51. The stock has risen 24.8% since the Uptrend alert was issued.
SmarTrend expects the share price to pullback toward the $114.87 support level. Afterwards, we expect it to move upward with its peers in the SmarTrend Oil & Gas- Drilling and Exploration industry.
Keywords: whiting petroleum trading range stock news

description.hltext_display: NCKU Center for Teaching and Learning Development Inaugurated
description.content:
TAINAN, Taiwan--(BUSINESS WIRE)--To elevate teaching quality and student learning efficiency and achieve academic excellence, the Center for Teaching and Learning Development (CTLD) of National Cheng Kung University (NCKU), Tainan, Taiwan, is inaugurated on December 22nd in 3rd floor, Yun-Ping Building, Kuang-Fu Campus.
"I am pleased to see that Vice-President for Academic Affairs Tang has established the Center for Teaching and Learning Development. As I have often said, outstanding talents cannot be cultivated without excellent education, and universities cannot transform into top universities without outstanding talents.â
"The most important function of a university is education, cultivating talents, and then research and social service. It is a universityâs mission to educate youth of the next generation. Education should include two aspects, teaching and learning. However, we mainly focus on the teaching of professors, neglecting the learning of students, which is allowing students to absorb as much knowledge as they can," said President Michael Ming-Chiao Lai of National Cheng Kung University in his opening remark.
President Lai also mentioned, "National Cheng Kung University had established Center for Faculty Development which focused solely on the cultivation of teachers. Thus, I believe the newly inaugurated Center for Teaching and Learning Development must embody both aspects of teaching, developing teaching methods, and learning, discovering questions, raising questions and finding solutions. I believe this is the essence of education and the development direction of the future education of National Cheng Kung University."
NCKU Senior Executive Vice-President Hwung-Hweng Hwung revealed, "I am pleased to see that Vice-President for Academic Affairs Tang has established the Center for Teaching and Learning Development. As I have often said, outstanding talents cannot be cultivated without excellent education, and universities cannot transform into top universities without outstanding talents." Vice-President Hwung-Hweng Hwung also explained, "As graduates return to their alma mater, they do not recall how wonderful a professorâs research is and they only remember how strict the teaching of a professor is. Studentsâ parents also do not consider how renowned a professor is in the research field and they only care about how well their children can learn from the school. Therefore, a university, especially a top university, needs to take both teaching and learning into account." Vice-President Hwung-Hweng Hwung stated, "In Taiwan, teachers often teach what they like and students often learn what they want. This is incorrect. As teachers devote themselves into teaching, they must observe the learning efficiency of the students from a different perspective. I hope the Center for Teaching and Development Learning can spread the concept for the teachers to realize the importance of education."
NCKU Vice-President for Academic Affairs Ming-Jer Tang said, "After four years of efforts, Center for Teaching and Learning Development finally inaugurated today. For the past years, under the goal set by President Lai, the Office for Academic Affairs has devoted itself to humanistic and innovative education and cross-disciplinary learning. We are excited that the Center for Teaching and Learning Development, established to truly integrate all the resources at NCKU and to promote NCKU to a top university, is finally inaugurated." Vice-President for Academic Affairs Tang also said, "We have visited research and teaching universities in The United States years ago, realizing that their centers for teaching and learning development have abundant resources, and we have also visited National Taiwan University and Chung Yuan Christian University, discovering that the former lacks integration and the latter lacks manpower. With the advantages of integrated resources and unified manpower as our foundation, I believe National Cheng Kung University can become an internationally top university in the future."
The newly inaugurated NCKU Center for Teaching and Learning Development is located on the 3rd floor of Yun-Ping Building, Kuang-Fu Campus, and NCKU President Michael Ming-Chiao Lai, Senior Executive Vice-President Hwung-Hweng Hwung, Vice-President for Academic Affairs Ming-Jer Tang, Director of Center for Teaching and Learning Development J. J. Wang, Director of Center for General Education Wei-Yung Wang, Secretary General Woei-Shyan Lee, other directors, deans and dozens of personnel have attended the inauguration ceremony.
The NCKU Center for Faculty Development, established in 2006, aims to strengthen the professional teaching ability of teachers and teaching assistants; however, to achieve academic excellence and innovation and elevate teaching quality and student learning efficiency, the Center for Teaching and Learning Development (CTLD) is established.
