description.hltext_display: Sudan: Sudanese Opposition Leader Slams Bashir's 'Talibanic' Speech
description.content:
Khartoum The Sudanese president Omer Hassan Al-Bashir has laid the groundwork for a "new Taliban state" through his speech in which he declared that after the secession of the South, the North will adopt a full Islamic constitution which would also make Arabic the official language, an opposition leader said today.
"If god forbids, the South separates [then] the constitution will be amended [and] a lot of things relating to the South will go away," Bashir said last Sunday.
"But the opaque talk [about] the Sudanese people I don't know what...is multi-racial and multi-religious, the [Islamic] Shari'a will be the main source for lawmaking....and Arabic language will the official language of the state as will be stipulated in the upcoming constitution," Bashir added.
The largely Christian and animist south is to vote on January 9 on whether to remain united with the Muslim north or break away to form an independent country.
The referendum is the key plank of the 2005 Comprehensive Peace Agreement (CPA) deal that put an end to two decades of civil war between north and south. Mubarak Al-Fadil who leads the Umma Reform and Renewal Party (URRP) said that Bashir's speech reflects "bankruptcy that brings us back to square one".
"There was never any Sharia'a to start with. Their religious slogans were purely for tactical purposes and not strategic. The National Congress Party is just using religion to support the police state and step up the oppression of the population" Al-Fadil told Sudan Tribune.
The URRP leader said that Bashir wants to deflect accusations from voices in the North that under his rule the country has split into two.
"Al-Bashir is a military man who swore an oath to preserve the territorial integrity of Sudan and now he has to let the South go away. He cannot swallow that" he added.
Al-Fadil, who was one of Bashir's challengers in April presidential elections, said that the NCP is concerned over a possible uprising should the economic situation in the North deteriorate because of losing oilfields in the South after secession.
The separation of Sudan into a two states will deny the North billions of dollars in revenue generating from vast oilfields in the south of the country. Currently the North and the South are splitting the proceeds of crude in accordance with the CPA.
About 75 per cent of Sudan's proven reserves of 6.3bn barrels are in the south but the pipeline that carries the oil to export terminals and refineries runs through the north.
"As it stands now there is lot of injustice, corruption, unemployment. widening gap between rich and poor, soaring food prices, agricultural sector has collapsed. The NCP has devoted most of the money for security and political functions," he said.
"So when the government no longer has the amount of cash it received through oil it will fear social unrest so they will have to resort to force to suppress any dissent. They will use Sharia'a as cover for these measures," Al-Fadil added.
He slammed Bashir's talk on the irrelevance of cultural and ethnic diversity in the post-secession Sudan.
"Sudan will remain diverse even after the South becomes an independent state. There are tribes in the North, East and West that do not speak Arabic and have their own language. There are also Southerners in the North who we expect that they will continue to live with us. This will be the only hope that even after the South's separation we can both come back as one country," Al-Fadil said.
In recent months NCP officials have made remarks saying that Southerners in the North will be immediately stripped of their citizenship rights after the referendum outcome points towards secession.
But Al-Fadil argued that this would be a violation to the constitution.
"The Sudanese constitution since 1998 recognizes dual citizenship. There are many ministers in the cabinet with European and American passports. So why should Southerners be denied this right?" he said.
The opposition figure also warned the NCP against going ahead with seeking to implement Sharia'a law. The current constitution recognizes the "multi-ethnic," "multi-cultural" and "multi-faith" status of the Sudanese state, and is based on both Shari'a, or Islamic law, and the "consensus" of the population.
"We are for a citizenship state that forms the basis for rights rather than religion. We strongly oppose a religious state. There is not even a universal agreement among Muslims on Sharia'a law. There are multiple views on this subject between extremists and the moderates," Al-Fadil said.
He said that one of the messages Bashir wanted to send is to the West warning that North Sudan will move towards extremism if the South breaks away. The Sudanese leader this week accused the West of encouraging secessionist sentiments in the South.
In the 1990's Sudan housed a number of Islamic militant groups and Al-Qaeda leader Osama Bin Laden. In 1993, the U.S. placed Sudan on the list of countries that sponsor terrorism.

description.hltext_display: Bayfield man dies in traffic wreck
description.content:
One man injured in crash Monday on Highway 160
Keywords: Road accident,
Share
A Bayfield man died in an accident Monday night on U.S. Highway 160.
The crash occurred about 5:10 p.m. near The Grocery Store at Bayfield.
Thomas âTommyâ A. Jones, 46, was pronounced dead at Mercy Regional Medical Center shortly after the crash, said Trooper Jonathan Silver with the Colorado State Patrol.
Jones, who lived in Bayfield about 15 years, was heading eastbound and preparing to turn left from Highway 160 onto North Commerce Drive when he was hit broadside by an oncoming vehicle, Silver said.
The second driver was identified as Robert F. Vaughn, 19, of Durango. He was driving a 1996 Ford F-250 with sheetrock scraps in the back. He suffered minor injuries and was treated and released at Mercy.
Jones, who was driving a 2006 Pontiac Grand Am, failed to yield to the westbound traffic, Silver said.
âWe donât understand what caused him (Jones) to not see the pickup truck driven by Mr. Vaughn,â Silver said. âWe determined the headlights were on and it was dusk, so visibility wasnât really a factor.â
Alcohol and drugs arenât suspected as factors in the crash, Silver said. Speed also is not suspected as a factor; the posted speed limit is 45 mph, Silver said. Both drivers were wearing seat belts.

description.hltext_display: Private security firms cautioned against overcharging customers
description.content:
Home Affairs Minister Shamsi Vuai Nahodha has warned private security companies to stop exploiting people by charging them high prices for their services instead of abiding by the rules and regulations governing their business.
Nahodha issued the warning in Dar es Salaam on Monday when he visited the ministry's Fire and Rescue brigade on a familiarisation tour after he was appointed Home Affairs minister.
âWe hear people complaining about private security companies setting exorbitant charges in emergency cases and sometimes they won't do anything until they have been paid," he said.
He noted that this was intolerable, saying the firms should not left to exploit the people while there were state organs which are responsible for monitoring and supervising the activities of the companies.
âI am instructing the Fire and Rescue brigade to look into how it can end this exploitation. You and the Ministry of Home Affairs are the ones who give the companies licences to operate. If they do not abide by the conditions, revoke their licences,â Nahodha said.
He said any company which requires a licence to provide services should be given conditions and if they violated them, the licences should immediately be revoked.
Nahodha instructed the Fire and Rescue brigade to keep on inspecting private security companies with a view to ensuring that they provide good and efficient services.
âWe can not force these companies to provide free services but their charges should be reasonable,â he said.

event_or_fact.property: this was intolerable, saying the firms should not left to exploit the people while there were state organs which are responsible for monitoring and supervising the activities of the companies.

Special Christmas Eve services in La Plata County
description.content:
Share
Following is a list of Christmas services being held in the La Plata County area. All services are on Friday unless otherwise noted.
For more information, call the phone number provided. An asterisk (*) indicates child care is available.
All Saints Anglican Church, Fort Lewis College Chapel, 4:30 p.m. with Holy Communion. 884-6456.
Center of Light, Sophia Peace Center, 19581 Road 31 in Dolores, 11:30 p.m. Mass. RSVP requested to the Rev. Meira Leonard at 882-2123.
Christ the King Lutheran Church, 495 Florida Road, 3 p.m. stable service under the pines at La Plata County Fairgrounds, 5 p.m.* and 7 p.m.* candlelight worship with Holy Communion, 5 p.m. Christmas Day with Holy Communion. 247-5310.
Faith Community Church of the Nazarene, 1400 Colorado Highway 172, about 1 mile south of Elmoreâs Corner, 6 p.m. candlelight service with tribute to troops. 247-4975.
First Baptist Church of Durango, 332 E. 11th St., 3 p.m.* and 5:30 p.m.* (children younger than 2) candlelight services. 247-0624.
First Presbyterian Church of Durango, 1159 East Third Ave., 6 p.m.* (children younger than 2) worship service. 247-3175.
First United Methodist Church of Durango, 2917 Aspen Drive off Florida Road, 6:30 p.m.* today, Christmas Eve Eve service; 3 p.m.* and 5 p.m.* family service; 7 p.m.* candlelight service with Chancel Choir; 9 p.m. candlelight service with Praise Band; 11 p.m. reflective service with candlelight. No service on Christmas Day. 247-4213.

description.hltext_display: Passivhaus compliant dwellings at Ecobuild
description.content:
Two-storey Passivhaus compliant dwellings are to be built at Ecobuild plus Passivhaus experts will be on hand throughout the show at ExCel, London March 1st to 3rd 2011
The Passivhaus dwellings will include room in the roof space and will each provide an internal floor area of 135sqm.
The design of the units, by Miller Hughes Associates, will be taken from a live Passivhaus scheme of 38 units being built for Saxon Weald Housing Association in Horsham in January 2011, and use an advanced SIP system provided by members of the UK SIPS Association.
Passivhaus experts will be on hand throughout the three days of Ecobuild to provide practical advice on achieving a highly insulated air tight building envelope, whilst demonstrating the other complementary technologies such as window systems, MVHR and low energy lighting solutions that are needed to achieve Passivhaus standards.
And continuing the Passivhaus theme at next year's Ecobuild, the Passivhaus pavilion, will give visitors the opportunity to meet some of Ecobuild's 1,300 exhibitors and learn about the detailing and performance requirements involved in delivering Passivhaus dwellings in the UK.
In a series of dedicated seminars - two of over 130 free seminars at Ecobuild - Passivhaus principles in refurbishment and Aligning Passivhaus principles with codes and regulations , visitors can learn from a series of case studies what applying Passivhaus standards to refurbishment projects really involves, and how Passivhaus principles connect with existing regulations, codes and standards.
All free when you register for Ecobuild.
Register now for your free ticket.

description.hltext_display: DGAP-Media: PEH Wertpapier AG beteiligt sich an Ã¶sterreichischem Finanzdienstleister
description.content:
{"s" : "399320.SZ,DASX.PK,E1S.DE,GC8.DE,MCU,PEH.DE,^SIEY","k" : "a00,a50,b00,b60,c10,g00,h00,l10,p20,t10,v00","o" : "","j" : ""}
DGAP-Media (Xetra: 725292 - Nachrichten) : PEH Wertpapier AG / Schlagwort(e): Unternehmen/ PEH Wertpapier AG beteiligt sich an Ã¶sterreichischem Finanzdienstleister
22.12.2010 / 08:59
---------------------------------------------------------------------
- PEH Wertpapier AG beabsichtigt Erwerb der Kapitalmehrheit am Ã¶sterreichischen Finanzdienstleister MODERATUM
- Planvoller Ausbau des Finanzvertriebs in Ãsterreich und in Osteuropa
- LangjÃ¤hrige Branchenerfahrung und beste Kontakte
- Erhebliches Wachstumspotential
Oberursel, 22. Dezember 2010 - Die PEH Wertpapier AG (ISIN DE0006201403), einer der fÃ¼hrenden bankenunabhÃ¤ngigen Finanzdienstleister in Deutschland, beabsichtigt, mittels ihrer Tochtergesellschaft PEH Wertpapier AG Ãsterreich die Kapitalmehrheit am Ã¶sterreichischen Finanzdienstleister und Versicherungsvermittler MODERATUM Financial Services GmbH zu Ã¼bernehmen. Nach intensiven Verhandlungen haben beide Unternehmen einen Letter of Intent unterzeichnet. Dieser strategische Schritt ermÃ¶glicht der PEH, ihren Vertrieb zunÃ¤chst in Ãsterreich und kÃ¼nftig auch in Osteuropa auszubauen.
'Wir freuen uns, dass wir mit den EigentÃ¼mern der MODERATUM einig geworden sind', sagt Martin StÃ¼rner, Vorstandsvorsitzender der PEH Wertpapier AG, 'beiden Parteien erÃ¶ffnet das sehr interessante zusÃ¤tzliche WachstumsmÃ¶glichkeiten.'
Kontinuierlich positive Ergebnisse - planvolles Wachstum
Die PEH ist einer der wenigen Finanzdienstleister, die auch Ã¼ber die Krisen des letzten Jahrzehnts hinweg immer positive operative ErtrÃ¤ge erwirtschaftet haben. StÃ¼rner macht deutlich, worauf dieser Erfolg beruht: 'Uns geht es jederzeit um die ErgebnisqualitÃ¤t, nicht um simples Mengenwachstum.'
In den letzten Monaten hatte die PEH alle Alternativen zur Weiterentwicklung des Segments PEH Private Kunden sorgfÃ¤ltig geprÃ¼ft und dabei festgestellt, dass der beste strategische Weg fÃ¼r die PEH darin besteht, das Segment operativ mit voller Kraft weiter auszubauen und dabei die Vertriebsseite zu stÃ¤rken. Martin StÃ¼rner ist Ã¼berzeugt, mit MODERATUM nun einen sehr guten Partner fÃ¼r die planvolle Expansion der PEH gefunden zu haben: 'Wir haben immer die Augen offen gehalten und viele GesprÃ¤che gefÃ¼hrt. Unsere Haltung war klar: Wir haben Geduld. Wir engagieren uns nur dort, wo wir ein positives Chance-Risiko-VerhÃ¤ltnis feststellen und einen echten Mehrwert erzielen.' FÃ¼r die neue Beteiligung hat sich die PEH nach intensiver PrÃ¼fung und Analyse entschieden. MODERATUM plant hohe Wachstumsraten als banken- und versicherungsunabhÃ¤ngiger Finanzvertrieb. Die Manager, Markus Miko und Wolf-Dieter Turek, verfÃ¼gen Ã¼ber langjÃ¤hrige Erfahrung im Investmentfonds-, Versicherungs- und Finanzierungsbereich.
Expansion in Ãsterreich und in Osteuropa
Bei der Vermittlung von Anlage- und Versicherungsprodukten setzt MODERATUM wie die PEH ganz klar auf fundierte Beratung und hohe ServicequalitÃ¤t. Das (DASX.PK - Nachrichten) Unternehmen plant zudem - sobald die rechtlichen Grundlagen gelegt sind und die Genehmigungen durch die FMA (Finanzmarktaufsicht) vorliegen - im Jahr 2011 eigene Finanzprodukte zu begeben.
Die PEH erwartet sich von der Beteiligung eine erhebliche Ausweitung der eigenen GeschÃ¤ftstÃ¤tigkeit. ZunÃ¤chst gilt das fÃ¼r Ãsterreich - MODERATUM bietet aber darÃ¼ber hinaus Kompetenz fÃ¼r die osteuropÃ¤ischen LÃ¤nder. Das Unternehmen hat dort groÃen Bedarf an hochwertigen Versicherungs- und Finanzprodukten und einer damit verbundenen qualifizierten Betreuung festgestellt. So werden beispielsweise in LÃ¤ndern wie der Ukraine in einigen Jahren Pensionsreformen erwartet, die eine groÃe Nachfrage nach entsprechenden Versicherungsprodukten auslÃ¶sen dÃ¼rften. Dies zeigen aktuelle Entwicklungen, etwa in RumÃ¤nien, ganz deutlich auf. In anderen LÃ¤ndern kann dagegen mit der Entwicklung des InvestmentfondsgeschÃ¤fts begonnen werden - zum Beispiel in Slowenien, das Ã¼ber weiterentwickelte FinanzmÃ¤rkte und entsprechende gesetzliche Rahmenbedingungen verfÃ¼gt.
Die PEH Wertpapier AG Ãsterreich bietet dafÃ¼r hervorragende Expertise auf der Service (399320.SZ - Nachrichten) - und Back-Office-Seite. Im Rahmen der PEH-Konzernstruktur lassen sich weitere Synergien realisieren.
Die geplante Transaktion entspricht genau den Vorgaben der PEH fÃ¼r eine fokussierte, sinnvolle Expansionspolitik. Martin StÃ¼rner sieht in der MehrheitsÃ¼bernahme ein auÃerordentlich hohes Potenzial: 'Es gibt groÃe Parallelen zum Erwerb unserer Beteiligung an der Axxion vor rund zehn Jahren. Sie (Nachrichten) hat sich seither zu einer unserer ertragsstÃ¤rksten Tochtergesellschaften entwickelt.'
Ãber den Kaufpreis wurde von beiden Seiten Stillschweigen vereinbart.
2010 auf Rekordkurs - erneut hohe AusschÃ¼ttung an die AktionÃ¤re avisiert
MODERATUM erhÃ¤lt in der PEH einen starken Partner, der auch aktuell ausgezeichnete Zahlen melden kann: 'Wir haben in 2010 das beste Neun-Monats-Resultat seit Bestehen der PEH Wertpapier AG erreicht. Das reine operative Ergebnis wuchs in diese Zeitraum gegenÃ¼ber dem Vorjahr um mehr als 50 %. Die Netto-ProvisionsertrÃ¤ge sind gestiegen, die Verwaltungsaufwendungen konnten gesenkt werden, der Gewinn wurde stark verbessert. Zudem verfÃ¼gen wir Ã¼ber eine kerngesunde Bilanz. Ihr Wachstum finanziert die PEH aus dem Cashflow', erlÃ¤utert StÃ¼rner.
Die gute Entwicklung im aktuellen und die positiven Aussichten fÃ¼r das kommende Jahr machen den Vorstand der PEH Wertpapier AG zuversichtlich, auch fÃ¼r das GeschÃ¤ftsjahr 2010 erneut eine aktionÃ¤rsfreundliche Dividende auszahlen zu kÃ¶nnen. FÃ¼r 2009 betrug sie 1,70 Euro (MCU - Nachrichten) je Aktie, was bezogen auf den aktuellen Kurs einer deutlich Ã¼berdurchschnittlichen Dividendenrendite von rund 6,3 % entsprach.
'Mit der kurzfristigen Entwicklung des Aktienkurses sind wir natÃ¼rlich nicht zufrieden', rÃ¤umt der Vorstandsvorsitzende Martin StÃ¼rner ein, 'wir werden jedoch alles in unserer Macht stehende dafÃ¼r tun, um die bisherige, langfristig signifikante Outperformance fortzusetzen.' Er betont: 'Mit den in den letzten Monaten eingeleiteten MaÃnahmen haben wir die Voraussetzungen fÃ¼r eine nachhaltige HÃ¶herbewertung unseres Unternehmens geschaffen.'
Einer der fÃ¼hrenden bankenunabhÃ¤ngigen Finanzdienstleister in Deutschland
Die PEH Wertpapier AG mit Hauptsitz in Oberursel, Taunus, gehÃ¶rt zu den fÃ¼hrenden bankenunabhÃ¤ngigen Finanzdienstleistern in Deutschland. Die PEH-Konzerngesellschaften befassen sich mit VermÃ¶gensanlage sowie VermÃ¶gensverwaltung und bieten klassische AktivitÃ¤ten fÃ¼r institutionelle Kunden an: Asset Management, Fondsadministration sowie innovative Produktentwicklung. Das Unternehmen ist in die drei Segmente PEH Private Kunden, PEH Institutionelle Kunden und PEH Beteiligungen unterteilt.
Sollten Sie weitergehende Fragen haben, kÃ¶nnen Sie uns auch unter der folgenden Kontaktadresse direkt erreichen:
PEH Wertpapier AG Pressekontakt: Gabriele Lange
Nymphenburger Strasse 3c 80335 MÃ¼nchen fon 0172 - 296 11 23 06171 - 63 31 33 fax 06171 - 63 31 10 E-Mail: Gabriele.Lange@peh.de www.peh.de
Wichtig: Diese Presse-Information enthÃ¤lt zukunftsgerichtete Aussagen. Zukunftsgerichtete Aussagen sind Aussagen, die nicht Tatsachen der Vergangenheit beschreiben. Sie umfassen auch Aussagen Ã¼ber unsere Annahmen und Erwartungen. Diese Aussagen beruhen auf Planungen, SchÃ¤tzungen und Prognosen, die der GeschÃ¤ftsleitung der PEH derzeit zur VerfÃ¼gung stehen. Zukunftsgerichtete Aussagen gelten deshalb nur an dem Tag, an dem sie gemacht werden. Wir Ã¼bernehmen keine Verpflichtung, solche Aussagen angesichts neuer Informationen oder kÃ¼nftiger Ereignisse anzupassen.
Zukunftsgerichtete Aussagen beinhalten naturgemÃ¤Ã Risiken und Unsicherheitsfaktoren. Eine Vielzahl wichtiger Faktoren kann dazu beitragen, dass die tatsÃ¤chlichen Ergebnisse erheblich von zukunftsgerichteten Aussagen abweichen. Solche Faktoren sind etwa die Verfassung der FinanzmÃ¤rkte in Deutschland, Europa, den USA und andernorts, die Umsetzung unserer strategischen Initiativen, die VerlÃ¤sslichkeit unserer GrundsÃ¤tze, Verfahren und Methoden zum Risikomanagement sowie andere Risiken.
Diese Pressemitteilung dient ausschlieÃlich zur Information. Sie stellt kein Angebot dar, Fondsanteile zu erwerben.
der Pressemitteilung
22.12.2010 VerÃ¶ffentlichung einer Pressemitteilung, Ã¼bermittelt durch die DGAP - ein Unternehmen der EquityStory AG (Xetra: 549416 - Nachrichten) . FÃ¼r den Inhalt der Mitteilung ist der Emittent / Herausgeber verantwortlich.
Die DGAP Distributionsservices umfassen gesetzliche Meldepflichten, Corporate News/Finanznachrichten und Pressemitteilungen. Medienarchiv unter http://www.dgap-medientreff.de und http://www.dgap.de
---------------------------------------------------------------------

description.hltext_display: Schengen: RumÃ¤nien erzÃ¼rnt Ã¼ber dt.-frz. Blockade
description.content:
Romaniaand Bulgaria, which joined the EU in 2007, remain outside the agreement due to shortcomings in their police and judicial systems. Both countries were placed under a special monitoring system, called a Cooperation and Verification Mechanism.
In September, EU ministers for European Affairs decided to extend the monitoring for another year.
Speaking in the presidential palace in Bucharest, Basescu said his country would not accept discrimination from anyone, "be it from the most powerful countries of the EU". Hours before, the interior ministers of France and Germany, Brice Hortefeux and Thomas de MaiziÃ¨re, had issued a joint letter saying they would block Romania and Bulgaria's Schengen bid.
According to the two ministers, not all conditions are met for the two countries to join the . The two countries had initially planned to join the passport-free zone in March 2011. "It would not be realistic nor responsible to neglect the deficiencies identified," says the letter, seen by EurActiv Romania. Among the deficiencies, the ministers specify "the absence of a satisfactory juridical and administrative environment in the fields of security and justice, persisting corruption at different levels and worrying levels of organised crime". Consequently, the ministers plead for a postponement of Romania and Bulgariaâs Schengen accession for a later date. "We consider that the decision should be taken when the main causes of worries would be removed and when the two countries would begin irreversible progress in their fight against corruption, of organised crime, as well as of reforming their judicial systems," the letter reads. Moving target?
When Romania and Bulgaria joined the EU in 2007, they were placed under a special monitoring mechanism to assist them in reforming their juridical systems and combat corruption. In the case of Bulgaria, the fight against organised crime was highlighted as a particular problem. Since then regular reports have revealed only limited progress.
However, the European Commission admits that there is no legal link between the Bulgaria and Romania's progress under the mechanism and their accession to the Schengen area.
In his statement, Basescu said that Romania had met all technical requirements for joining Schengen and would not accept the introduction of "additional conditionalities". A Polish diplomat told EurActiv recently that his country was worried by attempts from older EU members to "change the rules" of the game and adopt "moving targets" that are difficult to be achieve for newcomers, citing Romania and Bulgaria's Schengen bid as a case in point.
The diplomat also expressed worried that the permanent safety net for the euro zone could to raise the bar higher for countries that wish to adopt the common currency.
Retribution for the Roma invasion?
The push by Paris can also be seen as an act of reprisal against the massive arrival of Romas to France. The expulsion of those migrants, who were mostly from Romania, has stirred unprecedented controversy and criticism from the European Commission. that "Romania and Bulgaria do not have a closed door," but explained that those countries were simply unable to secure their own borders.
Bulgaria remains silent
As with the Roma controversy, Sofia chose to keep a low profile, after the French-German letter became public. Over the last months, the country's Prime Minister Boyko Borissov for its expulsions of Bulgarian Roma, hoping that in exchange, France would not veto his country's Schengen bid.
The only official reaction so far comes from a spokesperson of the Bulgarian Foreign Ministry, who said Sofia would redouble efforts to reform its judiciary and convince doubters that it has made progress.
Meanwhile, the public uproar in Bulgarian and Romania appears to be massive. Hundreds of readers have commented under the , EurActiv's sister publication in Bulgaria, which carried the news of their countries' rejected Schengen bid. Many comments see it as a setback for Bulgaria's Prime Minister, who had made Schengen accession his biggest EU priority.

è¨ªæ¥å¤å½äººã¯ï¼ï¼ï¼ä¸ï¼åäººãå¹´éï¼åä¸äººã®éæä¸å¯è½ã«
Bahi farmers urged to grow drought-resistant crops
description.content:
Bahi District farmers have been challenged to grow drought-resistant crops like millet to ensure food security in the district.
Kigwe ward councillor Gauitani Muyinga said the growing of drought-resistant crops such as millet would enable the district to have enough food crops throughout the year.
The councillor was speaking at a Bahi full council meeting held yesterday.
âIf we grow crops like millet we will have bumper yields, hence assure the district of enough food stocks,â said Muyinga, adding: âOn top of that, we will get rid of this shameful tendency of begging for food every year, especially during the dry season.â
He said time had come for Bahi farmers to apply modern agricultural methods and increase crop production.
He explained that the farmers should put much emphasis on the planting of drought resistant crops instead of traditional ones, which could hardly resists drought.
âWe have to find alternatives to traditional crops such as maize, otherwise we will not get out of the chronic shortages of food, which keeps on recurring every year,â the councillor explained.
Miyinga also challenged the farmers to look into the possibility of growing commercial crops such as groundnuts, sunflower and so on to generate income and improve their living standards including paying for school fees for their children.
The councillor asked the farmers to use animal-driven methods instead of using hoes in their farming activities, which he described as ineffective and efficient besides having low productivity.
He also called on pastoralists in the district to keep a manageable number of livestock since having too many animals were destructive to the environment in many parts of the country.

description.hltext_display: Therese Rein stuck in snowy London
description.content:
Foreign Minister Kevin Rudd's wife Therese Rein is one of thousands of stranded commuters held up by icy conditions in London and at risk of missing Christmas at home.
Mr Rudd said his wife was expected home on Thursday but with flights cancelled after big snowfalls in England's capital forcing flight cancellations, she is trying to find an alternative way home.
Asked by reporters in Sydney why she was stuck in London, the foreign minister replied: "Snow, it's the white stuff, comes out of the sky, goes phoom like that".
But, Mr Rudd said, her presents would be under the tree when she did return.
"So, I've told her we're just going to defer Christmas in case she doesn't make it," he said.
"We'll make sure that her Santa stocking is preserved.
"But for all those Australians who are stuck at the moment, either trying to get there or trying to get out, it's a tough and rough time at the moment.
"And so, hopefully, the weather will clear and, hopefully, we can get people home soon, including Therese."
Cancellations have stranded thousands of travellers, affecting flights internationally - and the big freeze is tipped to continue.

description.hltext_display: Confusion Over Benitez's Future
description.content:
Tweet
Comment Now Email Print
RELATED COVERAGE
Dec 22 2010 16:12
Get more on: inter | rafa | benitez
Confusion continued to surround Rafael Benitez's future as coach of Inter Milan last night.
Nerazzurri president Massimo Moratti insisted the Spaniard was still in charge as further reports emerged that he has been sacked.
Speculation regarding Benitez has only intensified since he called on the club to back him or sack him following their FIFA Club World Cup triumph, comments Moratti did not take well.
The club president attended a meeting last night at the club's offices in Milan, and said Benitez was still the coach when he emerged.
Asked if Benitez was still in charge, Moratti said: "Yes, yes. There are no other thoughts. I have heard of and read about contacts being made with other coaches, but the club has not made contact with any other coach and will not until the situation is clarified."
Former AC Milan manager Leonardo has been strongly linked with a move to Inter, but Moratti would not be drawn further on the Brazilian.
Benitez, 50, is currently on holiday in Liverpool as Inter have begun their winter break.
Inter have been decimated by injuries and are 13 points adrift of city rivals AC Milan in the Serie A title hunt, albeit having played two games fewer than the Rossoneri.
They next take to the field against Napoli on January 6, after the league's winter break.

description.hltext_display: After Yesterday's Rally of 5.39%, Terex Shares Could Potentially Pullback (TEX)
description.content:
Terex (NYSE:TEX) traded in a range yesterday that spanned from a low of $28.89 to a high of $30.52. Yesterday, the shares gained 5.39%, which took the trading range above the 3-day high of $29.00 on volume of 2.1 million shares. Often times after large one-day gains, short term traders will seek to take profits and, as such, investors should be cautious.
Shares of Terex are currently trading above their 50-day moving average (MA) of $24.96 and above their 200-day MA of $22.65. Look for the MA to provide support for a short-term pullback in the shares.
SmarTrend currently has shares of Terex in an Uptrend and issued the Uptrend alert on September 13, 2010 at $21.20. The stock has risen 36.6% since the Uptrend alert was issued.
SmarTrend expects the share price to pullback toward the $29.00 support level. Afterwards, we expect it to move upward with its peers in the SmarTrend Farm & Construction Machinery industry.
Keywords: Terex trading range stock news

description.hltext_display: DGAP-Media: PEH Wertpapier AG beteiligt sich an Ã¶sterreichischem Finanzdienstleister
Magufuli: Over 4bn/- set aside for Namanga border post compensation
description.content:
Minister Dr John Magufuli
About 120 houses are lined up for demolition at Namanga border post to pave the way for the construction of a proposed one-stop border post in the area.
Works minister Dr John Magufuli revealed this on Monday on an impromptu tour of Namanga, on the Tanzania-Kenya border.
He said compensation for the houses to be demolished would cost the government about 4bn/-. According to the minister, the money was within the capacity of Tanroads and the government and so the evictees would be compensated as soon as it would be practicable.
Magufuli also directed Arusha regional Tanroads manager Deusdedit Kakoko and the local authorities to ensure that they verified the houses to be demolished so that, only the eligible evictees should be compensated.
âGo and verify those houses because if you are not careful, you will end up paying even rocks and stones,â he cautioned them.
He stressed that the people to be compensated would be those whose houses are not in the road reserve.
âWe want to settle this matter as soon as possible so that construction starts in good time,â he explained.
So far, a detailed design of the proposed one-stop border post had been completed.
Recently, East African Cooperation minister Samuel Sitta disclosed that resource mobilisation for the construction of the first-ever one-stop border post in Africa on the Tanzania-Kenya border at Namanga had already started.
"In this regard, the EAC has finalised a legal framework for the one-stop border post, which has already been approved by the council of ministers, and this is a very important instrument that will enable partner states to harmonise their systems and facilitate trade more effectively and efficiently," he said.
Through the one-stop border post arrangement, all immigration activities, customs clearances and other formalities would be accomplished under one administration instead of the current situation where travellers, traders and tourists crossing from either country are forced to undergo the same formalities in each country.

EP / MADRID El nou salÃ³ de sorteigs de Loteries i Apostes de l'Estat (LAE) al Palau de Congressos s'ha obert aquest dimecres al voltant de les 08:00 hores del matÃ­ per permetre l'entrada als espectadors i aproximadament una hora mÃ©s tard comenÃ§arÃ el sorteig amb l'extracciÃ³ de les boles dels nombre i els premis per part dels nens del ColÂ·legi de Sant Ildefons.
PrÃ¨viament, ahir a la nit es va fer pÃºblic l'examen i recompte de les boles dels nÃºmeros i premis, que van poder ser comprovades pels assistents que ho van desitjar, prÃ¨via peticiÃ³ i autoritzaciÃ³ del president. Finalitzada l'operaciÃ³ de recompte, es va desallotjar la sala i es van assegurar amb forrellats interiors tots els seus accessos, a excepciÃ³ de la porta de lÂ´estrada, les claus queden en poder de tres clauers diferents.
A les vuit del matÃ­, s'ha format la primera taula que supervisarÃ l'ompliment dels bombos amb les boles ja penjades de les lires i el protocol durant el qual el pÃºblic en general ha pogut, des d'aquest moment i abans que comenci el sorteig, comprovar que la boleta del nÃºmero que juga estÃ entre les 85.000 que entraran al bombo dels nombres.
ComenÃ§a el sorteig
Aquesta operaciÃ³ s'efectua tant amb les boles de nÃºmeros com amb les de premis. Finalment, els bombos sÃ³n tancats i a una senyal del president es voltegen simultÃ niament. Un nen o nena de l'escola de Sant Ildefons extreu una bola del bombo i un altre nen, alhora, una altra del de premis, de manera que comenÃ§a el sorteig, al voltant de les nou del matÃ­.
En finalitzar el sorteig de Nadal, quan en el bombo de premis no queda cap bola, un equip de mÃ©s de quaranta persones s'encarrega de realitzar la llista de premis del sorteig i de les poblacions agraciades amb els premis mitjanÃ§ant un procÃ©s informÃ tic controlat en tots els seus extrems.
D'aquesta manera, aproximadament als 45 minuts d'acabat el sorteig, i desprÃ©s d'haver passat per diverses comprovacions i puntejos, estÃ preparada la cinta i llista de premis per al seu lliurament a la FÃ brica Nacional de Moneda i Timbre, encarregada d'imprimir la llista oficial de premis. Aquesta llista s'edita i distribueix la mateixa tarda del dia del sorteig a les administracions de loteries i als mitjans de comunicaciÃ³.
Les taules dels nÃºmeros premiats, queden exposades set dies al pÃºblic. Transcorregut aquest temps sÃ³n obertes i les boles comptades i examinades novament, per a qualsevol altre sorteig posterior que es farÃ davant aquest sistema.

description.hltext_display: Analysis: Will Google follow Microsoft footsteps in EU probe?
description.content:
SAN FRANCISCO/BRUSSELS (Reuters) - Google Inc's GOOG.O Internet search algorithm is the technology world's equivalent of the Coca-Cola formula: a top-secret corporate crown jewel.
But pressure is growing on Google to lift the veil on some of its inner workings, as European regulators investigate complaints that Google's search engine unfairly discriminates against certain websites.
The case underscores the increased scrutiny over Google's influence in the Internet industry and could set the stage for the kind of long-running regulatory battle fought in the past by technology giants like Microsoft Corp MSFT.O. Odds are that the world's No. 1 search engine will seek to keep prying eyes, even those of the European Commission -- known in many circles globally as the toughest watchdog -- away from the ranking algorithms that are the core of its business.
"It is difficult to see how this won't come to an impasse in terms of how far can Google go, in terms of opening up access to their secret sauce as it were, which is the basis for their existence," said Martin Olausson at research firm Strategy Analytics.
If the EU determines that Google abused its position in the search market, the Commission could order Google to alter its search practices, such as providing more transparency into its algorithm, or face a fine of up to 10 percent of annual global revenue.
Google has faced criticism in the past that its technology for determining which websites get top billing in search results is too much of a black box. As Google has grown in clout, and as it begins providing its own Web content such as video within results, calls for greater transparency into its search algorithm have swelled.
The Commission ratcheted up pressure on Google this month when it opened a formal probe into allegations the company had abused its dominant position in the search market.
In addition to the charge that Google rigged its algorithms to lower rivals' rankings, complainants said it unfairly promoted its own services, forced advertisers to accept exclusivity deals, and blocked companies from transferring advertising data to other online ad platforms.
"The complaint is often that there's too much at stake. The claim is Google is now too powerful and it's really tantamount to a utility that everybody uses," said Greg Sterling, an Internet consultant and a contributing editor for the online blog Search Engine Land.
BIG IN EUROPE
The situation is particularly acute in Europe, where Google controls roughly 77 percent of the market share of search queries, according to industry analytics firm ComScore.
This month, the EU confirmed that it had also taken over two complaints about Google's search practices from German competition authorities.
Google has said it intends to cooperate with the EU's investigation. But the company has a history of keeping its search algorithm close to the vest.
While Google provides certain guidelines about its algorithms to help Web publishers ensure that their sites are accurately ranked, the hundreds of specific "ranking factors" that it uses to rank websites, and the weight it attaches to each of those factors, remain a much-speculated-upon mystery.
"We provide more guidance for websites than any other search engine, and we're constantly exploring new ways to be even more transparent with webmasters about our ranking principles," Google spokesman Adam Kovacevich said in an email. "But disclosing the exact details would only help spammers, make search engines less useful, and hurt our users."
Foundem, one of the complainants in the EU case, has said it is not seeking to get Google to publish details of its algorithm. Instead, it said on the website searchneutrality.org, the company wants Google to be more transparent about the rationale for the various "exclusionary penalties" that can keep certain sites out of search results, and for Google to provide an appeals process for websites that feel such penalties have been mistakenly applied to them.
EASY FIX?
Google joins other technology giants, including Apple Inc AAPL.O, Intel Corp INTC.O and Microsoft, whose business practices have triggered scrutiny from European regulators.
Microsoft, which was fined 1.68 billion euros over the course of its decade-plus battle with the Commission, agreed to give European consumers better access to rival Internet browsers in Windows, and to improve interoperability with its products last December.
The key challenge for the Commission now is to show that Google conscientiously abused its power in the search market to harm certain websites, said Brett Gordon, a professor at Columbia Business School.
"The Commission would have to show that Google unfairly tampered with their algorithm to disadvantage other search services," he said. Last week, France's antitrust watchdog warned the company not to abuse its dominant position in online advertising, citing a list of possible anticompetitive practices.
Google had settled with the French regulator two months earlier when it pledged to make its AdWords advertising policy in that country more clear and transparent following a complaint it had unfairly scrapped a company's contract. A similar tactic could work with the European Commission, said Christopher Thomas, a partner at law firm Hogan Lovells.
"The issue is not the algorithms, the issue is whether they can be changed in a way to sufficiently reassure the Commission without undermining what Google feels is the core of its business. If easy changes can be made, Google may be inclined to do that," he said. One thing's for sure: The pressure on Google can only grow, said Thomas Vinje, a partner at Clifford Chance, who had led a coalition that took on Microsoft, which then led to the European Commission imposing a total fine of 1.68 billion euros for antitrust infringements.
"The launch of formal probes tends to generate more voices, to cause more people to jump into the fray, and make it more likely that other complainants will come forward with other allegations of abusive conduct," he said.
"So this case might well go on for quite some time."
(Editing by Edwin Chan)

description.content:
Martinsried (aktiencheck.de AG) - Das Biotech-Unternehmen 4SC AG (ISIN DE0005753818/ WKN 575381) erhÃ¤lt als Teil eines Konsortiums EU-FÃ¶rdermittel zur Identifizierung neuer Wirkstoffe fÃ¼r die Behandlung von Rheumatoider Arthritis.
Unternehmensangaben vom Mittwoch zufolge unterstÃ¼tzt die EuropÃ¤ische Union das Konsortium (4847.KL - Nachrichten) zur Erforschung des Zusammenhangs zwischen periodontalenErkrankungen und Rheumatoider Arthritis (RA) mit 5,8 Mio. Euro (MCU - Nachrichten) . Ziel sei die Entwicklung selektiver niedermolekulare Hemmer von Proteinen, die fÃ¼r die AuslÃ¶sung der zu RA fÃ¼hrenden Autoimmunreaktionen verantwortlich sind. Die erfolgreiche Identifizierung neuer Inhibitoren ermÃ¶gliche die Entwicklung einer neuenGeneration von Medikamenten, mit denen sich RA vermeiden und in frÃ¼henStadien nach Ausbruch der Krankheit behandeln lÃ¤sst.
RA ist eine chronisch entzÃ¼ndliche Gelenkerkrankung. Bei den Ursachen von RA kÃ¶nnen neben genetischen auch autoimmune Faktoren eine Rolle spielen. Es mehren sich die Hinweise, dass eine AutoimmunitÃ¤t durch Infektionserreger, wie sie beispielsweise bei periodontalen Erkrankungen auftreten, ausgelÃ¶st werden kann. Das Projekt soll dem VerstÃ¤ndnis Ã¼ber mechanistische ZusammenhÃ¤nge zwischen diesen beiden Krankheiten dienen, hieÃ es weiter.
Die Aktie von 4SC fiel zuletzt um 2,94 Prozent auf 3,27 Euro. (22.12.2010/ac/n/nw)

description.hltext_display: The Procrastinatorâs Guide to Holiday Shopping
description.content:
Donât go to Wal-Mart or any other store looking for big sales on toys â all the parents who left their toy shopping to the last minute are out in force, and that means little incentive for toy stores to discount. âToy prices are really jacked up this week,â says Dan De Grandpre of DealNews.com. âThere are deals, but much fewer than two weeks ago.â
Still, Wal-Mart (Stock Quote: WMT) is offering at least one big deal that many last-minute shoppers will find attractive. From now until Christmas (or while supplies last), the retailer is pairing the two most recent iPhone models â the 4G and last yearâs 3GS â with a $50 Wal-Mart gift card. The phones will cost you $197 and $97, respectively, and you have to sign a new two-year contract to get that price, but once youâve made your purchase you can use your gift card to finish your holiday shopping or stick it in someoneâs stocking.
Photo Credit: Zol87

KQED Joins American Public Media's Public Insight Network
description.content:
Initiative Facilitates Expanded News Coverage through Active Audience Engagement
(San Francisco, CA & St. Paul, Minn.) - December 21, 2010 - American Public Media's (APM) Public Insight Network (PIN) is pleased to welcome San Francisco's KQED News. The combination of KQED's strong journalism reputation and the country's most powerful platform for journalistic audience engagement will yield significant dividends for both parties.
"KQED's journalistic excellence embodies the promise of the Public Insight Network," says Joaquin Alvarado, APM's Digital Innovation SVP. "We're thrilled to welcome them to the network and look forward to helping them reach new levels of audience engagement."
"Offering KQED News listeners the opportunity to easily contribute their individual expertise to our news reporting efforts is a win-win situation," said Jo Anne Wallace, vice-president and general manager of KQED Public Radio.
Alvarado and Amanda Stupi, KQED's News Public Insight Network Editor will be discussing the partnership on KQED Public Radio's Forum this morning at 10am PT. Audio of the program can be heard streaming at KQEDnews.org. In San Francisco, Forum can be heard on KQED 88.5FM. In Sacramento, it will air on KQEI 89.3FM.
KQED News is the latest in a growing number of leading news organizations that are building and engaging the Public Insight Network to improve the depth and breadth of news coverage ï¿½ from ProPublica, the Center for Investigative Reporting and The Miami Herald to Oregon Public Broadcasting and the St. Louis Beacon.
Founded in 2003, American Public Media's Public Insight Network has nearly 100,000 sources around the country who have signed up through websites, social networking, blogs, surveys, virtual and in-person forums, serious games and face-to-face interactions. Demographic information and insights are stored in a secure, searchable database. Participating journalists search the database for knowledgeable sources, or query the sources in the Network to test hunches, identify trends and support production of major projects. In the last year alone, Public Insight Network sources informed or unearthed more than 700 stories for Minnesota Public Radio News and American Public Media programs such as Marketplace.
KQED Public Media (kqed.org) has served Northern California for more than 50 years and is affiliated with NPR and PBS. KQED owns and operates public television stations KQED 9 (San Francisco/Bay Area), KTEH 54 (San Jose/Bay Area), and KQET 25 (Watsonville/Monterey); KQED Public Radio (88.5FM San Francisco and 89.3FM Sacramento); the interactive platforms kqed.org, kteh.org, and KQEDnews.org; and Education Network. KQED Public Television, one of the nation's most-watched public television stations, is the producer of local and national series such as QUEST; Check, Please! Bay Area; This Week in Northern California; Truly CA; and Essential Pï¿½pin. KQED's digital television channels include 9HD, Life, World, Kids, and V-me, and are available 24/7 on Comcast. KQED Public Radio, home of Forum with Michael Krasny and The California Report, is one of the most-listened-to public radio stations in the nation with an award-winning news and public affairs program service delivering more than eighteen local newscasts daily. KQED Interactive hosts KQEDï¿½s cross-platform news service, KQED News, as well as offers video and audio podcasts and a live radio stream at kqed.org. The Education Network brings the impact of KQED to thousands of teachers, students, parents, and the general public through workshops, community screenings, and multimedia resources.

description.author: Regi
description.content:
ConvergÃ¨ncia, que fa anys que encerta les previsions, adverteix que els nÃºmeros vermells s'enfilen fins a lÃ­mits mai vistos
VOTA LA NOTÃCIA
FRANCESC GALINDOMANRESA El president del grup municipal de CiU, Alexis Serra, va posar a la palestra, en el debat de pressupostos de dilluns a la nit, una dada que no pot passar desapercebuda: el dÃ¨ficit de l'Ajuntament de Manresa segueix el camÃ­ d'enfilar-se als 20 milions d'euros. Si es confirma aquesta quantitat -i ConvergÃ¨ncia ha anat encertant els darrers anys els dÃ¨ficits que contenien els pressupostos municipals-, sumada als efectes del refinanÃ§ament del deute mÃ©s el mateix deute (78 milions d'euros), l'horitzÃ³ econÃ²mic Ã©s negre.
Serra va donar la dada i en la segÃ¼ent intervenciÃ³ va recordar que no se li havia desmentit la xifra de 19,6 milions de dÃ¨ficit acumulat que obtenia sumant els 8,8 milions del pressupost del 2009, els 4 milions que calcula que sortiran del tancament del 2010 i 6,8 que emergiran en el tancament del 2011. Dels 6,8 milions, 4,6 serien el resultat d'inflar partides d'ingressos i 2,2 milions de morositat en el pagament, a causa de les dificultats de ciutadans i empreses derivades de la crisi. El regidor d'Hisenda, Alain JordÃ (PSC), no Ã©s d'aquest parer i va assegurar que la morositat no es troba als nivells que calcula CiU sinÃ³ que Ã©s molt inferior, potser per les facilitats que es donen per fraccionar els pagaments. JordÃ va assegurar que es portava a aprovaciÃ³ un document econÃ²mic "executable, creÃ¯ble i fiable" i el va defensar dient que "no tenim la sensaciÃ³ d'anar a tancar la paradeta, com s'ha dit, sinÃ³ de tancar el mandat d'una forma neta". JordÃ va dir que l'oposiciÃ³ ha de decidir quÃ¨ vol criticar, perquÃ¨ si no hi haguÃ©s hagut una frenada en la inversiÃ³ segur que s'haurien queixat que es posaven en marxa projectes que podien hipotecar l'acciÃ³ del nou govern que sorgeixi de les eleccions del maig del 2011.
El president del grup municipal del PP, Xavier Javaloyes, va qualificar la proposta econÃ²mica que presentava el tripartit de "congeladora, deficitÃ ria, regressiva, plena de pÃ nic i sense respostes per als problemes de la ciutat". Javaloyes va demanar on eren els diners per a la Reforma o per a la modificaciÃ³ del parc Vila Closes i quines solucions plantejava per a problemes que interessen a la ciutadania. El polÃ­tic popular va assegurar que no podien donar suport a uns pressupostos de "qui dia passa any empeny" per anar tirant fins al 22 de maig, quan se celebrin les eleccions municipals.
El regidor de la CUP, Adam MajÃ³, va afirmar que no podia votar a favor d'un pressupost que Ã©s el resultat d'una manca de previsiÃ³ quan hi havia recursos abundants. El resultat, des del seu punt de vista, Ã©s un pressupost "absolutament insuficient per fer front a l'empobriment" sobretot de les classes populars a causa de l'efecte de la crisi. MajÃ³ va demanar autocrÃ­tica, perquÃ¨ "la crisi no Ã©s una mena de fenomen meteorolÃ²gic que ens cau al damunt" sinÃ³ el resultat, en part, d'unes polÃ­tiques equivocades.
El regidor de la PxC, Albert Pericas, va demanar aclariment sobre partides concretes i va argumentar que si el pressupost de l'any vinent disminuÃ¯a 10 milions amb relaciÃ³ a l'actual i aquest ja havia minvat abans una quantitat semblant, "o vostÃ¨s surten del govern o Manresa es desintegra".

description.hltext_display: [ï¿½×·ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½] ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½(FMD) ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Look for Shares of Frontier Communications to Potentially Pullback after Yesterday's 0.75% Rise (FTR)
description.content:
Frontier Communications (NYSE:FTR) traded in a range yesterday that spanned from a low of $9.33 to a high of $9.49. Yesterday, the shares gained 0.75%, which took the trading range above the 3-day high of $9.48 on volume of 6.9 million shares. Often times after large one-day gains, short term traders will seek to take profits and, as such, investors should be cautious.
Shares of Frontier Communications are currently trading above their 50-day moving average (MA) of $9.03 and above their 200-day MA of $8.05. Look for the MA to provide support for a short-term pullback in the shares.
SmarTrend currently has shares of Frontier Communications in an Uptrend and issued the Uptrend alert on September 17, 2010 at $7.97. The stock has risen 17.7% since the Uptrend alert was issued.
SmarTrend expects the share price to pullback toward the $9.45 support level. Afterwards, we expect it to move upward with its peers in the SmarTrend Telecom Services- Domestic industry.
Keywords: Frontier Communications trading range stock news

description.hltext_display: [ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½Î´ï¿½ï¿½ ï¿½Ä¹ï¿½ï¿½îµµ ï¿½Ç³ï¿½]
El CadÃ­ impugna el partit de SÃ³ller per un bÃ squet fora de temps
description.author: Regi
description.content:
El club urgellenc va perdre per 72-70 i ara vol que s'invalidi l'acciÃ³ i es disputi una prÃ²rroga
VOTA LA NOTÃCIA
Paola Ferrari (esquerra), la jugadora del SÃ³ller Bon Dia! que va aconseguir la cistella polÃ¨mica
aitor f. vallespir/diario de mallorca
JORDI AGUTMANRESA El CadÃ­ la Seu ha presentat un recurs per aconseguir que es disputi una prÃ²rroga de cinc minuts en el partit que el va enfrontar dissabte passat al SÃ³ller Bon Dia!, i que va finalitzar amb derrota de l'equip que entrena Andreu Bou per un igualat 72-70. El CadÃ­ diu que la darrera cistella, aconseguida per la local Ferrari, va ser fora de temps i que, per tant, el matx hauria hagut d'acabar en empat.
L'acciÃ³ polÃ¨mica apareix, a mÃ©s, en el vÃ­deo que se sol penjar a la mateixa pÃ gina web de la federaciÃ³ espanyola. S'hi veu que, en la darrera jugada del partit, la jugadora del SÃ³ller Eshaya Murphy llanÃ§a quan falten 1,5 segons per al final del partit, la pilota pica al ferro i surt rebotada, i quan la palmeja Paola Ferrari, el rellotge ja es troba a zero des d'instants abans. Els Ã rbitres, RaÃºl Blanco i Luis Clemente, van anar a la taula d'anotadors i, desprÃ©s d'unes quantes deliberacions, van decidir donar la cistella per vÃ lida, motiu pel qual el SÃ³ller va guanyar el partit per 72-70.
El fet cert Ã©s que el CadÃ­ va firmar l'acta sota protesta i dient que impugnaria el resultat. Dilluns mateix, el club va enviar un recurs a la federaciÃ³ espanyola, acompanyat del vÃ­deo, en el qual reclama que no es doni per bona la cistella. El president del club urgellenc, Antoni Ferraz, explicava ahir que "ens basem en l'article nÃºmero 4 del reglament de la FIBA aprovat en la reuniÃ³ que es va fer aquest any a Puerto Rico, en el qual es diu que, quan sigui evident a travÃ©s del vÃ­deo que la cistella ha estat aconseguida fora de temps, es podrÃ fer la reclamaciÃ³ als Ã rbitres". El CadÃ­ ja va fer la reclamaciÃ³ oportuna desprÃ©s del partit, i ara dins del termini reglamentari per presentar recurs.
Segons Ferraz, "Ã©s cert que en casos anteriors no s'ha tingut en compte la prova del vÃ­deo, perÃ² l'article aquest en el qual ens basem Ã©s nou, d'aquest mateix any, i per aixÃ² volem que es tingui en compte a l'hora de decidir".
La federaciÃ³ ha de donar un dictamen sobre aquest tema avui o demÃ . En cas que els cinc minuts de prÃ²rroga es juguessin, es podrien disputar el cap de setmana del 8 i 9 de gener, quan hi ha Copa de la Reina.

description.hltext_display: Drum Day Giveaway-This Sunday, December 26, 2010
description.author: Cassandra Bautista
description.content:
ï¿½
If you enjoy music, friends, fun, and considered drumming then you should check out the This Sunday, December 26.This is one of . ï¿½ Great news! This event's admission charge is only one non-perishable food item! At that price with a drum lesson and performances you canât afford to not attend! If you celebrate Kwanzaa this will also be a great opportunity to start the first day off. UMOJA the first day of Kwanza is the perfect time to practice unity and reciprocity in our communities. Have fun with a performance by Leon Mobleyï¿½ & Da Lion. Da Lion is: â¢Leon Mobley â¢Jah Amen Mobley â¢Jai Jae Johnson â¢Eugene Blunt â¢Julani Blunt â¢Kharon Harrison â¢Anindo Marshall â¢Nailah Porter â¢CC White ï¿½ Exciting information on Leon Mobley. Mobley was recently a part of the In addition he has been playing African drums since 1967. He also studied for 10 years under the tutelage of seminal Nigerian master drummer Babatunde Olatunji at the Elma Lewis School of Fine Arts in Boston. You will love watching him on the drums. ï¿½ Specialï¿½ guests include: PAULINHO DECOSTA PONCHO SANCHEZ LENNY CASTRO MUNYUNGO JACKSON MARVIN âSMITTYâ SMITH FAUSTO CUEVAS RAMON BANDA FELIX DA CAT POLLARD ROCK DEADRICK KEVIN RICARD MULLATTO JAH BELOVED LONG BEACH DRUM CREW BALANDUGU KAN DRUM CREW and MORE! ï¿½ Located at:
Barbara Morrison Community Arts and Performance Space
COMMUNITY BUILD COMPLEX ï¿½ Time:
2:00PM - 8:00PM ï¿½ If you would like to RSVP to this Public Event go here: ï¿½ If you enjoyed this article you can receive e-mail alerts when new articles are available. Just click on the "subscribe" button above. ï¿½ ï¿½ ï¿½ ï¿½ ï¿½ ï¿½ ï¿½ ï¿½

description.hltext_display: HootSuite Announces Japan Representation plus Keitai app, Mixi Integration and Language Localization
description.content:
HootSuite announces a sales representation agreement with Japanese technology company Digital Garage. Additionally, HootSuite released a beta program for Japanese âkeitaiâ feature phones including Twitter and Mixi, plus added Japanese localization for Blackberry and Android phones.
Vancouver, BC, CANADA (Vocus/PRWEB) December 21, 2010
HootSuite Media, Inc. announced a representation relationship with Digital Garage â a leader in the Japanese web tech industry who also represent Twitter in Japan. Digital Garage will develop sales channels for HootSuiteâs Pro and Enterprise plans and create re-seller relationships with large agencies and organizations.
In addition, HootSuite announced a beta program for social media dashboard for the common keitai mobile phones. HootSuite Keitai integrates Twitter and mixi into a single tool. Tech-savvy users are invited to participate in the beta program and offer feedback to developers.
This version of HootSuite was designed exclusively for the Japanese market and related communications culture which evolved differently than in other world markets with features like streaming TV, pedometers, and video chat commonly available.
Along with the keitai integration, HootSuite added mixi to the web version of the dashboard. Mixi is the most popular social network in Japan with over 30 million users who can now manage their profile updates alongside Twitter, Facebook, Linkedin and other integrated social network services (SNS).
HootSuite also added Japanese language localization to the Blackberry and Android versions of the social media dashboard. These popular handsets join iPhone and iPad for complete cross-platform coverage in the Japanese language.
These announcements come after a year of outreaching to the Japanese market including creating a Japanese-specific help desk, plus active blog and feedback channels, and Twitter accounts. These efforts resulted in HootSuite becoming the top 3rd-party Twitter client and the #1 social networking iPhone app in Japan.
Further, HootSuite CEO Ryan Holmes visited Tokyo to establish relationships, meet customers and learn the unique expectations of the market. He, along with other cross-cultural entrepreneurs, will share lessons learned in a panel at noteworthy SXSW Interactive Conference in Austin, Texas in March 2011.
Etc.
HootSuite Japan desk: http://jp.hootsuite.com
Digital Garage: http://www.garage.co.jp/en/
Japan blog articles: http://blog.hootsuite.com/category/japan/
Additional Reading: http://blog.hootsuite.com/japan-digital-garage-keitai-localization
###
Dave Olson
HootSuite Media Inc.

description.hltext_display: Microsoft Announces Quarterly Earnings Release Date and Upcoming Event for the Financial Community
description.author: Kate Donald
description.content:
Business 0 views No Comment Print This Post Email This Post Kate Donald
REDMOND, Wash. â Microsoft Corp. will publish fiscal year 2011 second-quarter financial results after the close of the market on Thursday, Jan. 27, 2011 on the Microsoft Investor Relations Web site at http://www.microsoft.com/investor. The release will not be distributed via newswire. A live webcast of the earnings conference call will be made available at 2:30 p.m. Pacific Time on the Microsoft Investor Relations Web site at http://www.microsoft.com/investor.
The company will also participate in the following event for the financial community:
J.P. Morgan Tech Forum at CES
8:00 a.m. PT
Steve Guggenheimer, corporate vice president, OEM Division, Microsoft
Interested parties can listen to a webcast of this event on the Microsoft Investor Relations Web site at http://www.microsoft.com/investor.
Founded in 1975, Microsoft (Nasdaq âMSFTâ) is the worldwide leader in software, services and solutions that help people and businesses realize their full potential.
For more information, financial analysts and investors only:
Bill Koefoed, general manager, Investor Relations, Microsoft, (425) 706-3703

description.hltext_display: Seniorenbeirat: "Wohnen im Alter ist eine Herausforderung"
description.content:
Osterholz-Scharmbeck. Die Wahl der SeniorenbegegnungsstÃ¤tte (SBS) als Ort fÃ¼r Sitzungen des Seniorenbeirats (SBR) und andere ZusammenkÃ¼nfte Ã¤lterer Menschen hat sich im vergangenen Jahr als die richtige herausgestellt. "Die Zusammenarbeit mit der SBS und dem Mehrgenerationenhaus ist gut angelaufen", erklÃ¤rte der zweite SBR-Vorsitzende Karl-Heinz Wrieden im Anschluss an die jÃ¼ngste Sitzung in der Kreisstadt. Besonderes Lob erhielt Marlies Blume, die "die SBS mit viel Liebe und Engagement neu gestaltet" habe. SBR-Vorsitzende Jutta Menke ging wÃ¤hrend der Sitzung auf zahlreiche Schwerpunkte fÃ¼r 2011 ein. So soll unter anderem das Thema "Wohnen im Alter" verstÃ¤rkt angegangen werden. "Das ist eine zukÃ¼nftige Herausforderung fÃ¼r die entsprechenden Institutionen und muss von vielen Seiten mitgestaltet werden", rief Menke die Beteiligten zur gemeinsamen Arbeit auf. Vor allem der Landkreis, die Stadtverwaltung sowie der Kreisseniorenbeirat seien hierbei gefordert, konkrete VorschlÃ¤ge zu unterbreiten.
Ein weiterer Schwerpunkt war die Situation am Bahnhof - Menke: "Wir sind in stÃ¤ndigem Kontakt mit der Verwaltung und den Fraktionen" - sowie in der Innenstadt. Dort werden gleich zu Beginn des Jahres zahlreiche GeschÃ¤fte auf eine "seniorengerechte Gestaltung" hin Ã¼berprÃ¼ft. Vor diesem Hintergrund wurden SBR-Mitglieder von Mitarbeitern der LINGA (Landesinitiative Niedersachsen Generationengerechter Alltag) geschult und die Aktion mit dem Wirtschaftstreff abgestimmt.
Im sozialen Bereich wurden Themen fÃ¼r das monatliche SeniorenfrÃ¼hstÃ¼ck an die Verantwortlichen herangetragen. AuÃerdem der Wunsch, gemeinsam nach Referenten fÃ¼r ErnÃ¤hrungs- und Gesundheitsfragen zu suchen. Zudem sollen im kommenden Jahr vermehrt VortrÃ¤ge zur Betreuungsvollmacht gehalten werden.
Zusammenfassend stellten die Sprecher schlieÃlich die Arbeit in den sechs verschiedenen Arbeitskreisen vor. Ob bei den Themen "Jung fÃ¼r Alt", Seniorenfahrt 2011", "Flyer", "Tag der Senioren 2011" oder "LINGA" und "Wohnen im Alter": "Alle Beteiligten haben im vergangenen Jahr gut und erfolgreich zusammengearbeitet und viel fÃ¼r die Ã¤lteren Bewohner getan oder werden es noch tun", zogen Jutta Menke und Karl-Heinz Wrieden eine positive Bilanz.

description.hltext_display: DGAP-News: CFC Industriebeteiligungen AG: CFC Industriebeteiligungen AG erwirbt NewTal Elektronik und Systeme GmbH
description.content:
DGAP-News: CFC Industriebeteiligungen AG / Schlagwort(e): FirmenÃ¼bernahme CFC Industriebeteiligungen AG: CFC Industriebeteiligungen AG erwirbt NewTal Elektronik und Systeme GmbH
22.12.2010 / 09:05
---------------------------------------------------------------------
- CFC Industriebeteiligungen erwirbt NewTal Elektronik und Systeme GmbH
- Erweiterung des GeschÃ¤ftsbereichs 'Electronic Manufacturing Services - EMS (Nachrichten) '
Dortmund, 22. Dezember 2010
CFC Industriebeteiligungen AG (ISIN: DE000A0LBKW6), Dortmund, hat mit notariellen Kaufvertrag 100% der Anteile an der NewTal Elektronik und Systeme GmbH Ã¼bernommen (Signing). VerkÃ¤ufer der Gesellschaft sind die bisherigen geschÃ¤ftsfÃ¼hrenden Gesellschafter, die das Unternehmen 2002 im Zuge eines MBO erworben hatten. Ãber den Kaufpreis wurde Stillschweigen vereinbart. Der Kaufvertrag enthÃ¤lt derzeit noch aufschiebende Bedingungen zugunsten von CFC (6024.TWO - Nachrichten) . Das Closing der Transaktion wird fÃ¼r Januar 2011 erwartet.
Das Unternehmen mit Sitz in Neu (Nachrichten) -Ulm hat sich bei seinen Kunden aus SÃ¼ddeutschland als verlÃ¤sslicher Partner etabliert und wird im laufenden GeschÃ¤ftsjahr mit 65 Mitarbeitern einen Umsatz von rund 10 Mio. Euro (MCU - Nachrichten) erwirtschaften.
Wie die bereits in Besitz der CFC stehende Letron electronic GmbH, entwickelt, produziert und vertreibt die NewTal Elektronik und Systeme GmbH elektronische Baugruppen und Systeme. Aus der HomogenitÃ¤t des Leistungsspektrums bei gleichzeitig ergÃ¤nzenden Vertriebsstrukturen ergeben sich umfassende Synergie (SDG.NX - Nachrichten) - und Wachstumspotentiale, von denen beide Unternehmen gleichermaÃen profitieren werden.
Auf diese Weise baut die CFC Gruppe ihre erfolgreich entwickelten AktivitÃ¤ten im GeschÃ¤ftsfeld Electronic Manufacturing Services konsequent weiter aus.
Kontakt:
CFC Industriebeteiligungen AG Westfalendamm 9 44141 Dortmund
Jan Philipp Gieselberg
Tel: + 49 (0) 231 222 40 500 E-Mail: info@cfc.eu.com
der Corporate News
22.12.2010 VerÃ¶ffentlichung einer Corporate News/Finanznachricht, Ã¼bermittelt durch die DGAP - ein Unternehmen der EquityStory AG (Xetra: 549416 - Nachrichten) . FÃ¼r den Inhalt der Mitteilung ist der Emittent / Herausgeber verantwortlich.
Die DGAP Distributionsservices umfassen gesetzliche Meldepflichten, Corporate News/Finanznachrichten und Pressemitteilungen. Medienarchiv unter http://www.dgap-medientreff.de und http://www.dgap.de

description.hltext_display: Seven NZers make the cut at Melbourne
description.content:
Seven New Zealand golfers have received PGA Tour of Australasia status for 2011 by making the cut after three rounds of the final qualifying tournament at Peninsula Golf Club, Melbourne.
The challenge now is to force their way into the top 10 after tomorrow's final round with OneAsia tour membership up for grabs.
Brad Shilton is the best placed to achieve that; he shares 13th at one-over par after carding a one-under 71 on the North Course today.
Nick Gillespie and David Klein are two shots back in 21st after rounds of 72 and 70, respectively, while Mathew Holton is 29th at five-over and Hamish Roberston lies 36th at seven-over after blowing out with a 77 today.
The other New Zealanders to make the cut were Josh Carmichael (eight-over) and Peter Spearman-Burn (12-over).
Aaron Leech, Jonny Dittmer, Andrew Green, Thomas Spearman-Burn and Gary-John Hill all missed the cut mark as the top 72 players progressed to the final round.

description.hltext_display: Teixits per atenuar les malalties de la pell
description.author: Regi
description.content:
Un projecte igualadÃ­ preveu Introduir vitamines i crema hidratant en microcÃ psules, que s'alliberarien en contacte amb la pell
VOTA LA NOTÃCIA
David Garcia, gerent de Fitex, a l'esquerra, i el cap de recerca, Joan MarinÃ©
acn
REDACCIÃ-ACNIGUALADA Un consorci d'empreses, liderades per la tÃ¨xtil igualadina Punto Blanco i coordinades pel centre tecnolÃ²gic Fitex, estudien la creaciÃ³ de nous materials tÃ¨xtils per tractar malalties cutÃ nies. El projecte, Sanitex, tÃ© com a objectiu elaborar teixits que, en contacte amb la pell, palÂ·liÃ¯n afeccions com la psoriasi, la dermatitis atÃ²pica i el peu diabÃ¨tic.
El gerent de Fitex, un centre amb seu a Igualada, David Garcia, explica que el projecte es basa a incorporar vitamines o cremes hidratants "dins unes microcÃ psules i introduir-les dins un fil tÃ¨xtil per construir el teixit". Fins ara, cap empresa no havia combinat aquests principis actius (vitamines) amb les microcÃ psules.
De fet, Fitex fa temps que treballa amb microencapsulaciÃ³ i aixÃ², segons Garcia, els ha permÃ¨s tenir una "experiÃ¨ncia prÃ¨via" dins d'aquest mÃ³n. Els darrers anys, Fitex ha desenvolupat productes tÃ¨xtils amb microcÃ psules aromatitzades. Aquests productes desprenen olors determinades una vegada el teixit entra en contacte amb una altra superfÃ­cie. Amb la mateixa tecnologia tambÃ© han creat uns guants que regulen la temperatura. Aquests teixits ja sÃ³n comercialitzats per algunes empreses.
Els principis actius que "s'alliberen" amb el fregament de la pell seran "vitamines o cremes hidratants que serveixin per tractar la patologia determinada". El tipus de microcÃ psula que es vol vincular als teixits Ã©s "innovadora", ja que tÃ© un "origen natural i pot servir en si mateixa per tractar malalties".
Mitjons i bodis
Els productes finals que volen obtenir els impulsors del projecte sÃ³n un mitjÃ³ per tractar el peu diabÃ¨tic i un bodi per als malalts de psoriasi i pell atÃ²pica. En el cas del mitjÃ³, els impulsors de Sanitex volen evitar el "contacte amb la pell, la humitat i la pressiÃ³", que resulta lesiva per al peu diabÃ¨tic. El producte incorporarÃ unes microcÃ psules amb un tipus de substÃ ncies que "ajudin a curar les nafres, les ferides, etc.", ha afirmat Garcia.
El segon producte, el bodi, contribueix als processos de "cicatritzaciÃ³ i hidrataciÃ³" de malalties com la psoriasi i la pell atÃ²pica. Aquesta malaltia de la pell atÃ²pica tÃ© una incidÃ¨ncia creixent en la poblaciÃ³ infantil i, segons Garcia, Ã©s "una afecciÃ³ que preocupa molt". Per aixÃ², el gerent de Fitex afirma que volen aconseguir fer un "bodi infantil que ajudi a reduir les irritacions de la pell".
Aplicacions en fil sintÃ¨tic
Sanitex tÃ© l'objectiu elaborar dos productes concrets, Garcia ha explicat que el fil amb microcÃ psules que s'elaborarÃ es podrÃ "aplicar a altres tipus de teixits, com ara llenÃ§ols o coixins". Malgrat que el desenvolupament del fil encara estÃ en estudi, Garcia veu el "fil sintÃ¨tic" com el mÃ©s adient per integrar-hi les microcÃ psules.
El mitjÃ³, que Ã©s un producte preventiu, pot tenir una distribuciÃ³ "mÃ©s massiva", mentre que la distribuciÃ³ del bodi tendirÃ a comercialitzar-se en farmÃ cies. El projecte tindrÃ els primers resultats el 2012. Actualment s'estan triant "els principis actius mÃ©s Ã²ptims".

description.hltext_display: Aldridge helps Portland take down Milwaukee
description.content: Portland, OR (Sports Network) - LaMarucs Aldridge scored 29 points to go along with a career-high 19 rebounds as the Portland Trail Blazers topped the Milwaukee Bucks, 106-80, at the Rose Garden. Wesley Matthews scored 22 and Rudy Fernandez added 17 points and seven assists for Portland, which swept a three-game homestand. Nicolas Batum contributed 10 points for the Blazers, who have won eight of nine in this series. "Right now we're playing together, we're playing with a lot of heart, we're playing with a lot of emotion, we're playing fast," Matthews said. "Everybody's getting involved in the offense, and that's key right now." John Salmons led Milwaukee with 23 points and Keyon Dooling scored 12 and dished out five assists for the Bucks, who also go 10 points off the bench from both Luc Mbah a Moute and Drew Gooden. Milwaukee played without guard Brandon Jennings, who had surgery Monday to repair a fracture of the fifth metatarsal in his left foot. Jennings will be sideline for 4-to-6 weeks with the injury. Portland had injury issues of their own as they were without Joel Przybilla (ankle) and Marcus Camby (shoulder). Portland held a 25-18 lead after the first quarter, behind a 13-point effort from Matthews. The Blazers lead quickly ballooned to 15, 41-26, after Batum converted on a three-point play at 7:42 in the second. Matthews hit two from the line at 6:15 to extend the lead to 17, 47-30, and after both teams went cold for close to two minutes, Batum's reverse layup at 4:24 widened the margin to 19. Rookie Luke Babbitt's layup after a Fernandez missed three put the game at 57-35, and his short hook shot with 34.9 seconds remaining gave Portland a 59-35 halftime lead. "We weren't very competitive early in the game, that's for sure," said Bucks head coach Scott Skiles. "They just moved around freely around the floor." Aldridge's jumper at 6:33 expanded Portland's lead to 26, 67-41, however, two Salmons free throws at 4:10 started a short 6-1 run for the Bucks, that put the game at 72-53. After the teams traded trips to the line and Portland added a Sean Marks and Fernandez free throw, Salmons ended the quarter with a triple and layup with 25.9 seconds left to trim the Blazers lead to 78-60 heading to the final stanza. Two Matthews free throws and an Aldridge alley oop dunk at 8:02 gave Portland a 87-67 advantage, and after remaining around 20, the Portland lead became 25, 103-78, with Matthews' driving layup at 1:19. Game Notes Portland's 24-point halftime lead is its largest first half advantage of the season...Mills and Babbitt finished with eight and six points, respectively, for the Blazers...Portland converted on 4-of-4 fast break opportunities...The Blazers shot 50 percent from the field, 38 percent for Milwaukee.

description.hltext_display: Hawke's Bay score late to draw with Phoenix A
description.content:
Wellington Phoenix A's quest for an elusive $2000 winner's cheque continues after a late goal to hattrick hero Chris McIvor salvaged Hawke's Bay United a 3-3 draw in their challenge series soccer match at Park Island, Napier, tonight. Hawke's Bay led 2-0 at halftime after McIvor had bagged a first half double, but the Phoenix looked set to claim all the spoils after defender James Musa scored an unlikely brace and young striker Sean Lovemore scored the go-ahead goal in the 77th minute.
They had to split the pot, however, after McIvor headed home at the neat post in the 90th minute to score his third goal.
The Phoenix A team, a mixed of fringe A-League players and young New Zealand talent, have lost three and drawn two of their five matches against national league franchises.
Phoenix midfielder Nick Ward, who had been sidelined with a knee injury since the 2-1 A-League win against Adelaide at Christchurch on December 5, played the first half before being substituted, while All Whites defender Tony Lochhead's return from groin surgery stepped up a gear with a 77-minute stint tonight.
Phoenix coach Ricki Herbert is hopeful both players will be back in the first-team by the January 5 home match against Melbourne Victory.

description.hltext_display: Correos bomba
description.content:
BogotÃ¡. Las Fuerzas Militares se encuentran alerta ante la posibilidad de que la guerrilla de las Farc adelante atentados con encomiendas bomba como lo tenÃ­an planeado el pasado sÃ¡bado en Cali. El almirante Edgar Cely, comandante de las Fuerzas Militares, asegurÃ³ que toda la Fuerza PÃºblica trabaja para contrarrestar ese tipo de acciones que harÃ­an parte de una nueva estrategia del grupo guerrillero para atentar en contra de los uniformados.
"Las Farc se equivocan si piensan que nosotros estamos en fiestas", dijo Cely al referirse a los planes de seguridad que se estÃ¡n implementando durante estÃ¡s fechas.

description.hltext_display: Ausflug ins Weserbergland
description.content:
Beckedorf. Im kalten Schneewinter plant die Dorfgemeinschaft Beckedorf schon fÃ¼r den nÃ¤chsten Sommer. Eine Fahrt ins Weserbergland und Lipperland steht vom 12. bis 14. August auf dem Programm fÃ¼r das Jahr 2011. Die Beckedorfer besuchen die "Weserperlen" Porta Westfalica, HÃ¶xter, FÃ¼rstenberg, Bodenwerder und Hameln. Um Beckedorfer Geschichte geht es bei einem Vortrag am 26. Januar um 19 Uhr in der Wiesenschule der Ortschaft. Im Blickpunkt stehen die ehemaligen Lager auf dem Rennplatz und am SchÃ¼tzenplatz.
Am 4. Februar geht?s ins Packhaustheater im Schnoor. Auf dem Spielplan steht das StÃ¼ck "Plaza Suite". Zu einem Kaffeenachmittag lÃ¤dt die Dorfgemeinschaft am 9. Februar die Beckedorfer Senioren ein. Ab 15 Uhr ist der Tisch im Lokal "Waldschmiede" gedeckt. Am gleichen Ort steigt am 19. MÃ¤rz um 19 Uhr das traditionelle Heringsessen des Vereins mit Tombola.
Ins neue Jahr startet die Dorfgemeinschaft am 8. Januar mit der Jahreshauptversammlung. Ab 19 Uhr stehen in der Waldschmiede unter anderem Ehrungen auf dem Plan. Nach dem offiziellen folgt ab 20 Uhr der gemÃ¼tliche Teil mit kalter Platte und Musik.
FÃ¼r den , Theaterfahrt, Senioren-Nachmittag und Hauptversammlung mÃ¼ssen sich Teilnehmer unter Telefon 0421/664454 anmelden.

description.hltext_display: T-Mobile Offers Fastest Wireless Data Performance in Top 100 Markets
description.author: Kate Donald
description.content:
Business 0 views No Comment Print This Post Email This Post Kate Donald
Bellevue, Wash.
T-Mobile now delivers the fastest wireless data performance in the top 100 U.S. markets according to results of a new, independent third-party study.1 In the study, T-Mobileâs overall network outperformed all other nationwide networks tested.
â2010 was a banner year for T-Mobileâs network expansion,â said Neville Ray, Chief Technology Officer for T-Mobile USA. âWe have deployed fiber backhaul to our cell sites to deliver an industry leading mobile data experience on the latest T-Mobile smartphones and broadband devices. Today, we are delivering the fastest data performance in the top 100 U.S. markets on average, and itâs only going to get faster as we upgrade our network to offer 42Mbps capability in 2011.â
The study results are based on national drive testing conducted between June 2010 and November 2010 by a leading third-party research firm, which downloaded and uploaded files to test data transfer speeds on laptop data sticks for each of the major carriers.
T-Mobile also offers a broad range of 4G products, including handsets, laptop sticks and a 4G-enabled netbook, which enables its customers to reap the benefits of the 4G network. T-Mobile will continue to be at the forefront of wireless innovation, delivering 4G products across a variety of categories in 2011.
4G network coverage is not yet available everywhere. For more information about T-Mobileâs 4G services, see http://www.t-mobile.com/coverage.
About T-Mobile USA, Inc.
Based in Bellevue, Wash., T-Mobile USA, Inc. is the U.S. wireless operation of Deutsche Telekom AG. By the end of the third quarter of 2010, approximately 130 million mobile customers were served by the mobile communication segments of the Deutsche Telekom group â 33.6 million by T-Mobile USA â all via a common technology platform based on GSM and UMTS, the worldâs most widely used digital wireless standards. T-Mobile USAâs innovative wireless products and services help empower people to connect to those who matter most. Multiple independent research studies continue to rank T-Mobile among the highest in numerous regions throughout the U.S. in wireless customer care and call quality. For more information, please visit http://www.T-Mobile.com. T-Mobile is a federally registered trademark of Deutsche Telekom AG.
T-Mobile USA Media Relations
