description.hltext_display: EMIRA OFFICE PORTFOLIO SHOWS INCREASE IN VACANCIES - Thabang Mokopanele
description.content:
EMIRA PROPERTY FUND CEO JAMES TEMPLETON yesterday said the group's vacancies had risen in the past few months due to tougher than expected economic conditions. The weakness had been mainly in the office portfolio, specifically in Cape Town and Johannesburg. In the five months to Dec., EMIRA saw an increase of only 0.5% on renewals, but on new leases the increase was flat with no growth. Thus tough conditions, hikes in rates and a competitive market have resulted in growth in income slowing from 3.3% in the year to end-Jun. to 0.4% in the five months year to date of EMIRA's current financial year. But TEMPLETON said the fund was optimistic next year would be a better year for the property sector due to improving retail sales.
INNOVATIVE DEMAND IN BID FOR KWV - Tim Cohen
22 December 2010 - Business Day
PIONEER FOODS' bid for KWV has just become more dense, with fund manager OPPORTUNE resorting to the unusual tactic of submitting a Promotion of Access to Information Act application as part of its effort to draw out a higher bid. The use of the PAIA application, while not unknown in proxy battles, is something of an innovation. PIONEER has formally submitted an offer of R12/share for KWV, and the latter is in the process of evaluating that bid. By some calculations the bid price implies a P:E ratio for KWV of about 40, compared with DISTELL's ratio of 15. CHRIS LOGAN, portfolio manager of OPPORTUNE, argues that while this return on equity might be low, they are historic numbers and the company has set itself the target of much higher returns. If this argument is credible, the R12/share bid must be too low. Hence LOGAN is using PAIA to gain documents to assess the basis on which KWV concluded it could increase its return on equity. The application says that on Oct. 27, KWV shareholders were told at the AGM that the company had a five-yaer strategic goal to achiever ROE of 15%. "The achievement of anything like this stated strategic goal will result in KWV trading at a substantial premium of net asset value," the document argues. "Since the PIONEER approach, KWV shareholders have only received reports from directors arguing why the PIONEER offer is fair." Thus OPPORTUNE is requesting records providing detail on how KWV intends delivering on its strategic goal of achieving 15% ROE by 2014.
PLATMIN COMPLETES US$90M PLACEMENT
22 December 2010 - Business Report
PLATMIN yesterday said it had completed its previously announced placing of 98.9m new shares at US$0.91/common share for total gross proceeds of US$90m. A total of 83.8m shares were indirectly placed with Dutch pension manager ALGEMENE PENSIOEN GROEP N.V. Following the placing, APG will indirectly hold 124.998m shares, representing around 16.7% of the then outstanding common shares. PLATMIN said the proceeds of the placing would be used for general corporate purposes and for future growth opportunities.
RICH MKHONDO TO BE MTNs TOP PR - Sapa
22 December 2010 - Business Report
Former journalist and World Cup spokesman RICH MKHONDO has been appointed head of MTN's corporate affairs division, the company said yesterday. MKHONDO replaces NOZIPHO JANUARY-BARDILL, who has left the company. MKHONDO will be group spokesman and responsible for implementing its stakeholder relations strategies in Africa and the Middle East.
NORTHAMs PROFITS TO FALL
22 December 2010 - Business Report
NORTHAM PLATINUM yesterday advised that its EPS and HEPS for the six months to end-Dec. were estimated to be between 15c and 25c, compared with the 59.9cps recorded y/y. NORTHAM said the decline followed lower sales revenues due to the strike and production interruptions at the beginning of the financial year due to safety related stoppages. Interim results will be released on Feb. 25.
MERCANTILE REVIEWED FOR POSSIBLE DOWNGRADE
22 December 2010 - Business Report
MOODY's has placed MERCANTILE BANK LIMITED on review for possible downgrade. The action followed MOODY's decision to place CAIXA GERAL DE DEPOSITAOS' standalone bank financial strength rating of D+ on review for possible downgrade. CGD is the parent of MERCANTILE BANk with a 92% stake. Under MOODY's methodology, a parent bank's standalone rating serves as a key input in assessing its capacity to support its banking subsidiaries which, in turn, can provide uplift to the deposit and debt ratings of a bank, the ratings agency said. MOODY's previous rating action of A2.za/P-1.za for MERCANTILE was implemented on Feb. 22, 2008, when ratings were first assigned.
TURNAROUND FOR RACEC
22 December 2010 - Fin24.com
RACEC GROUP posted a turnaround in the year to end-Sep. with diluted HEPS of 9.4c after a loss of 12cps y/y. Revenue grew to R394.2m from R344.6m a year ago, while gross profit rose to R84m from R60.3m. Profit for the period rose to R12.9m after a loss of R13.2m y/y. RACEC Electrification was completing two large projects in the Western Cape and RACEC Rail successfully tendered on projects in Sierra Leone and Mozambique. The group reported a 14% increase in revenue, but its performance was dampened by continued pressure on revenue and margins due to tough trading conditions.
PIONEER PENALISES PRICE-FIXING MANAGERS
22 December 2010 - Fin24.com
PIONEER FOOD GROUP yesterday said that "appropriate action" had been taken by the board to discipline the managers responsible for anticompetitive behaviour. Disciplinary action had been taken against 41 employees, one of whom was found not guilty by an external independent presiding officer. Thirty-eight admitted to guild and received written warnings, while action against two other employees is still in progress. Additionally, executive management did not receive any incentive bonuses for the year, executive directors did not receive any increases for 2011 and the majority of the executive management team were not allocated new share appreciation rights for 2011.
UNIONS SEEK WALMART GUARANTEES
22 December 2010 - Fin24.com
COSATU yesterday said it would meet with MASSMART and WALMART early in 2011 to seek "a few guarantees". WALMART is in the process of acquiring a majority stake in MASSMART. COSATU said while it welcomes foreing investment in the country, this should not come at the expense of local jobs. COSATU general secretary ZWELINZIMA VAVI said it was "clear from the history of WALMART that it has a potential of completely undermining the South African manufacturing capacity". VAVI warned that local retailers were under threat from the WALMART-MASSMART union - there were already reports that the two are spending about R67m a day on advertising alone.
FIRM ADMITS TO CHICKEN RECYCLING - Sapa
22 December 2010 - Fin24.com
SUPREME POULTRY yesterday admitted it does "rework" chickens for human consumption, but said it has never supplies such chickens to supermarket chains. The COUNTRY BIRD subsidiary wouldn't say where the reworked birds were sold. SUPREME POULTRY also said it was taking legal action against former employee JOHAN MATTHEE, the source of the story published in Rapport at the weekend. According to the report, the company was allegedly thawing, washing, injecting, rebranding, then reselling the chickens with new expiry dates to outlets such as PICK N PAY HOLDINGS and SHOPRITE CHECKERS. SUPREME said re-working happened on a limited scale and was always conducted in accordance with the protocols as dictated by the department of agriculture. The company said claims of illegal reworking had been the "malicious" work of MATTHEE, whose services had recently been terminated on the grounds of alleged sexual harassment.
HYPROP SECURES R9BN ACQUISITION
21 December 2010 - Fin24.com
HYPROP INVESTMENTS today announced it has concluded formal agreements regulating the terms of its offer to acquire the whole of ATTFUND RETAIL for R8.986bn. The transaction is less the value of ATTFUND's debt as at the effective date of the offer. The deal will increase HYPROP's portfolio to 22 properties with a gross value of about R20bn, almost doubling its size while enabling it to retain its retail focus. HYPROP plans to issue 112m of its combined units at R54, totalling R6.048bn, while the balance will be in cash. On implementation of the offer, ATTFUND RETAIL shareholders will pay a R130m transaction fee to REDEFINE PROPERTIES. The fee will be settled out of the cash portion of the consideration.
NEPI RIGHTS OFFER FULLY SUBSCRIBED
21 December 2010 - Fin24.com
NEW EUROPE PROPERTY INVESTMENTS yesterday said shareholders had applied for a total of 15m new shares the company had issued, resulting in a 100% subscription. Following the issue of the new NEPI shares, the total issued share capital of the company will increase to just under 77m ordinary shares. The new NEPI shares are expected to commence trading on the LSE and the JSE respectively.
CSC WELCOMES ULTIMATUM FOR SIMON
21 December 2010 - Fin24.com
CAPITAL SHOPPING CENTRES GROUP yesterday welcomed the announcement by the Takeover Panel, setting a deadline for SIMON PROPERTY GROUP to either provide a firm offer for CAPITAL of withdraw. The deadline was set for Jan. 12. SIMON, which owns 5% of CSC's shares, made the buyout proposal to CSC's board last week and offered 425pps in cash. CSC rejected the offer, saying it believed this was yet another attempt by SIMON to frustrate the TRAFFORD CENTRE acquisition without putting forward a proper proposal for CSC shareholders to consider as an alternative.
DE BEERS UNAWARE OF ANGLO BUYOUT PLOT
21 December 2010 - Fin24.com
DE BEERS yesterday said it had no knowledge of weekend reports from London that ANGLO AMERICAN was plotting a takeover. ANGLO said it would not comment on speculation. DE BEERS spokesman TOM TWEEDY also called the report "speculation" as the company had no knowledge of a takeover plan. ANGLO AMERICAN owns 45% of DE BEERS, with the OPPENHEIMER family holding 40% and the government of Botswana 15%. Should ANGLO opt to buy out the OPPENHEIMERs, it could pay at least Â£2bn.
RARE HOLDINGS IN SHARE ISSUE
21 December 2010 - Fin24.com
RARE HOLDINGS yesterday said it planned to raise R40m through the issue of 100m ordinary shares with a par value of one cent each at an issue price of 40cps to STAFRIC INVESTMENTS AND MANAGEMENT SERVICES. RARE said it was in need of further working capital which has exerted pressure on its day to day business activities. It has decided to raise equity capital due to the lack of immediate long-term debt funding alternatives. RARE will also enter into a loan agreement with MAYFAIR SPECULATORS as interim relief until the issue has been implemented. STAFRIC will, after the subscription, control 35% or more of the votes attaching to the issued shares of RARE. The subscription will thus trigger a mandatory offer to shareholders to be made by STAFRIC. The mandatory offer would therefore be extended to shareholders at the offer price of 40cps. RARE shareholders holding 75.18% of the shares in issue have undertaken to vote in favour of the shareholders' resolutions. In terms of the MAYFAIR loan, the capital sum of R40m will be advanced in two tranches of R20m each payable no later than end-Dec. 2010 and end-Jan. 2011 respectively. The loan will be repaid on the earlier of Mar. 31 2011 or when the company receives payment from STAFRIC under the subscription.
SASOL WILL START FEASIBILITY EARLY 2011 ON CANADA GTL PLANT - Liezel Hill
21 December 2010 - Mining Weekly
SASOL expects to start work early next year on a gas to liquid fuel plant in Western Canada, senior group executive LEAN STRAUSS said yesterday. SASOL yesterday said it would pay C$1.05bn for a 50% stake in shale assets owned by TALISMAN ENERGY. TALISMAN will keep the other 50% of its Farrell Creek assets, and will continue as the operator. The companies have agreed to study the potential for a GTL facility using SASOL's technology. SASOL expects to build a two-train facility in Canada, STRAUSS said, although he cautioned that it was "early days" to speculate on the specifics of the future plant. The transaction announced yesterday includes 51 000 acres of land, representing an estimated contingent resource of 9.6 trillion cubic feet. SASOL will pay 25% of the purchase price in cash at closing and will carry 75% of TALISMAN's future capital commitments in the Farrell Creek area, to a total of around C$790m. The deal is expected to close in H1 2011.
STANDARD BANK DISAPPOINTED - Sapa
21 December 2010 - Business Report
The demands Solidarity was making on STANDARD BANK over retrenchments were neither reasonable nor in the interest of employees, the bank said yesterday. STANDARD was responding to the union's charge that it had given employees an "arrogant slap in the face" by not considering proposals to mitigate the effect of layoffs. The bank said of the 1 145 employees in SA facing retrenchment, only 18 were Solidarity members, of which three have been redeployed. Redeployment efforts would continue until Jan. 31 2011, despite the fact that the employees would have received a month's notice. STANDARD said it had given the union's suggestions due consideration, but did not believe the demands were reasonable or in the interest of the bank, its employees and stakeholders. Solidarity earlier yesterday said although it and the bank had agreed on the "substance" of the retrenchments, it was not sattisfied with the severance packages offered.
LIBERUM SEES STRATEGIC MERIT IF ANGLO RAISED DE BEERS STAKE - Liezel Hill
21 December 2010 - Mining Weekly
LIBERUM CAPITAL mining analysts yesterday noted that it would be a positive move for ANGLO AMERICAN if it increased its holding in DE BEERS to 90%. The Sunday Times reported that the ANGLO board could buy the OPPENHEIMER family's 45% holding in DE BEERS for Â£2bn. The analysts said such a move would have strategic merit, clarifying the DE BEERS' ownership issue once and for all and whether diamonds are 'core' to ANGLO. DE BEERS has yet to announce a new CEO after GARETH PENNY announced in Jul. he would step down from the position. ANGLO CEO CYNTHIA CARROLL in Aug. said there were no plans to spin out or list DE BEERS.
MWEB TO LIGHT UP SAT-3 CAPACITY
21 December 2010 - Business Report
MWEB yesterday said it had landed SAT-3 cable capacity in its Cape Town node. This formed part of MWEB's ongoing bandwidth capacity upgrades and brought a significant degree of resilience to its network. The SAT-3 undersea fibre optic cable runs up the west coast of Africa to Portugal. Although MWEB will be buying the capacity on SAT-3, the service will be managed by SEACOM which allowed MWEB to have one point of contact through a single service provider. MWEB had a strong working relationship with SEACOM.
SIMMERS CEO RESIGNS
21 December 2010 - Business Report
SIMMER & JACK MINES yesterday announced that interim CEO NICO SCHOEMAN had resigned with effect from Dec. 30 in order to pursue other opportunities. The company's current CFO, MARIUS SAAIMAN, had been appointed interim CEO with effect from Jan. 3.

description.hltext_display: Foundry Education Foundation Announces Annual Scholarships
description.content:
Digital Magazine Table of Contents Subscribe
Released on November 30, 2010
The Foundry Education Foundation (FEF) announced on Nov. 19 that its highest award, the E.J. Walsh Award, was presented to former FEF student and President Lifetime Patron Richard Poirier.
The award was announced during the foundations annual reception, which concluded the 2010 FEF College Industry Conference, held Nov. 18-19 at the Westin Michigan Avenue, Chicago. Nearly 250 industry executives, student delegates, key professors and university administrators attended the conference.
The conference gave 90 student delegates the opportunity to interact with representatives of 36 companies in the metalcasting industry. The information session and social time before and after the event is structured to facilitate the sharing of job opportunities and to connect students to potential employers in the industry.
The FEF/AFS Distinguished Professor Award was given to FEF Key Professor, Pradeep Rohatgi, University of Wisconsin-Milwaukee, in recognition of his demonstrated personal interest in his students, as well as his knowledge of the industry. As part of the luncheon this year, the Student Delegate scholarships were presented (see below for complete list) 21 students were awarded a total of $39,500. Additionally, the Keith Millis and Ron Ruddle scholarship recipients were announced.
CIC Student Delegate Scholarships
Special Scholarships

description.hltext_display: ï¿½ï¿½Ã¢.È­Ãµï¿½ï¿½ ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½..'Ã»ï¿½ï¿½ ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½' ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½(ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½2ï¿½ï¿½)
Desmiente GobernaciÃ³n secuestro de 50 migrantes
description.content:
El tren de carga no fue interceptado ni detuvo su camino hasta el punto en que se efectuÃ³ el operativo, en el que fueron asegurados 92 indocumentados, en Oaxaca. Foto: OEM-Informex
OrganizaciÃ³n Editorial Mexicana
Manrique Gandaria / El Sol de MÃ©xico
Ciudad de MÃ©xico.- La SecretarÃ­a de GobernaciÃ³n sostuvo que son falsas las afirmaciones de la CancillerÃ­a salvadoreÃ±a, la cual denunciÃ³ el secuestro de poco mÃ¡s de 50 centroamericanos el pasado 16 de diciembre en la localidad de Chahuites, Oaxaca, por parte de un grupo armado.
A travÃ©s de un comunicado, la Segob refiriÃ³ que hasta el momento el Instituto Nacional de MigraciÃ³n (INM) no cuenta con evidencia alguna de que un tren haya sido obstaculizado o bloqueado por algÃºn grupo en la localidad de Chahuites, antes de un operativo efectuado el pasado viernes por agentes migratorios.
Ello luego de que la vÃ­spera la representaciÃ³n diplomÃ¡tica emitiÃ³ un comunicado en el que, de acuerdo con entrevistas realizadas por personal consular, migrantes de diversas nacionalidades seÃ±alaron a un supuesto grupo de hombres armados que habrÃ­a obstruido con piedras y troncos la lÃ­nea fÃ©rrea, obligando a detener el tren para golpearlos, robar sus pertenencias y secuestrar a un nÃºmero indeterminado de personas.
Al respecto, el INM reiterÃ³ que el tren de carga no fue interceptado ni detuvo su camino hasta el punto en que se efectuÃ³ el operativo, del cual se informÃ³ el pasado viernes y en el que se asegurÃ³ a 92 indocumentados en la zona del Istmo en el estado de Oaxaca.
La SecretarÃ­a de GobernaciÃ³n insistiÃ³ en que, en cumplimiento de la Ley General de PoblaciÃ³n (LGP) y con el propÃ³sito de evitar que los migrantes sean vÃ­ctimas de la delincuencia organizada, continuarÃ¡ realizando sus operativos para poner a salvo sus vidas y repatriarlos a su paÃ­s de manera segura y ordenada, respetando siempre su dignidad y sus derechos humanos.
En tanto, el INM afirmÃ³ que, en congruencia con lo anterior, el pasado 31 de agosto las secretarÃ­as de GobernaciÃ³n y Seguridad PÃºblica y la ComisiÃ³n Nacional de Derechos Humanos (CNDH) firmaron el Acuerdo sobre la Estrategia Integral para la PrevenciÃ³n y Combate al Secuestro de Migrantes.
Posteriormente se suscribiÃ³ con los gobiernos de los estados de Tabasco, Campeche y Chiapas un convenio de colaboraciÃ³n que establece la Estrategia Integral para la PrevenciÃ³n y Combate al Secuestro de Migrantes en la Frontera Sur, con el propÃ³sito de reforzar la seguridad de quienes se internan de forma indocumentada en territorio mexicano.
Asimismo, el pasado mes de octubre, por iniciativa del secretario de GobernaciÃ³n, JosÃ© Francisco Blake Mora, se llevÃ³ a cabo la ReuniÃ³n ministerial sobre delincuencia organizada, transnacional y seguridad de los migrantes, en la que se establecieron compromisos regionales para prevenir y garantizar la seguridad de los migrantes.
"En lo que respecta al caso del tren en Oaxaca, al consultar con autoridades locales y federales, asÃ­ como a la compaÃ±Ã­a ferroviaria, no se encontraron antecedentes que confirmen las versiones seÃ±aladas por la representaciÃ³n salvadoreÃ±a y tampoco existen denuncias ante autoridades mexicanas presentadas por parte de migrantes extranjeros al dÃ­a de hoy", dijo.

description.hltext_display: Probe paper on bus crash ready in two weeks
description.content:
Kuala Lumpur: The investigation paper on the double-decker express bus crash at Km 15 of the Cameron Highlands-Simpang Pulai Road which killed 27 people, including 25 Thai tourists, is expected to be ready in two weeks.
Managing Director of the Malaysian Institute of Road Safety Research (Miros), Prof. Dr Ahmad Farhan Mohd Sadullah, said a detailed analysis of the crash was being done with the cooperation of other agencies like the police and Public Works Department.
"The probe is still in the early stage and the outcome is only expected in about two weeks' time as usually the case," he said when contacted Tuesday.
He, however, said according to the standards, double-decker buses were not suitable for negotiating roads on hilly terrain.
"On a sloping road, the double-decker which is higher than normal buses, is not in a very stable condition and may pose a danger to the passengers.
This type of bus is more suitable for flat roads."
Ahmad Farhan said bus operators should therefore take the suitability and conditions of buses into consideration before ferrying passengers to their destinations.
Bukit Aman Traffic Chief Datuk Abdul Aziz Yusof said all aspects, including the condition of the bus and road were being covered in the police investigation into yesterday's horrific accident.
"At this moment, we should not be pointing fingers at anyone until the results of the investigation are known," he said.
The Pan Malaysia Bus Operators Association has urged the government to hold short-term courses for bus drivers to improve their driving skills, and also on providing emergency first-aid and in fire-prevention.
Its President, Datuk Mohamad Ashfar Ali, said the Government must also look at how driving schools were teaching those applying for the bus driving licence, to ensure they would become efficient drivers, hence reducing road accidents and fatalities.
In light of Monday's tragic express bus crash, he also urged the Road Transport Department to place warning signs at the "black spots" or accident-prone road stretches.
Road Transport Workers Union Secretary-General Datuk Zainal Rampak said the Government should carry out the proposed construction of a short-cut road to Simpang Pulai which would reduce travelling time and avoid travelling on a sloping road because of the hilly terrain.
Meanwhile, the Land Public Transport Commission (LPTC) is making road safety a high priority area in its list of concerns as it moves towards full operation next year.- Bernama

description.hltext_display: itoiletstand for iPads, Tablets and Other Electronic Devices Coming in 2011
Christchurch International Airport - Australasia?s Largest Video Wall Completes Airport?s Sensory Arrivals Experience
description.content:
Passengers arriving on international flights will, as of this week, be treated to an explosion of sensory experiences as they travel through the terminal from their air bridge to collect their luggage. Christchurch International Airport Ltd has undertaken a major design overhaul in the international airside environment in order to ensure travellersâ first experience of the South Island is particularly memorable, and that it encapsulates the South Islandâs main point of difference, the astounding outdoors landscape.
The long air bridge corridors have been completely revamped to provide individual South Island immersive experiences within these contained spaces. The walls have been covered floor to ceiling in special commissioned photography, says Chief Executive Jim Boult. âWe wanted to virtually drop passengers into the centre of some of the South Islandâs most beautiful landscapesâ, he says.
A sensory experience of each landscape completes the passenger journey, with a soundtrack playing sounds from the environment, as well as smells evocative of each region.
In the immigration queuing area, the largest video wall in Australasia entertains passengers with beautifully shot footage of the South Islandâs natural environment. 54 seamlessly linked screens play looping clips to create a hypnotic and calming effect.
Illustrative wall graphics based on the magnificent braided rivers of Canterbury guide passengers through the airport, creating a sense of flow between the various areas of the airport.
At the base of the arrivals ramp, a flow of pure artesian water offers a place for passengers to regroup and refresh before entering Duty Free and customs. For many overseas visitors, this will be a truly unique element, delivering on the Tourism New Zealand brand promise, 100% Pure.
Photographic imagery once again takes centre stage at the baggage claim area, with seasonal images of agricultural landscapes supporting our vital border protection agencies.
âBy utilising design in a fully immersive manner, Christchurch Airportâs new international arrivals experience touches all the senses, and is set to welcome visitors to an awe-inspiring, world-class airport environment that truly reflects the landscape outside,â says Mr Boult.
Concept and Design: Strategy Design & Advertising, Christchurch.
Christchurch International Airport â New Zealandâs Tourism Gateway
Christchurch International Airport welcomed 6 million passengers in 2009/2010, ranking as New Zealandâs second largest airport. The Airport occupies a unique position economically, as the South Islandâs busiest and most strategic air connection to the worldâs trade and tourism markets. In addition, the airport plays an important role as the South Islands major domestic hub servicing all New Zealanders, enabling passengers to connect to a full spectrum of destinations throughout New Zealand. Christchurch International Airport is a major driver of the regional Canterbury economy, generating airport precinct related jobs for nearly 5000 people.
Christchurch International Airport is owned and operated by Christchurch International Airport Limited (CIAL). CIAL was established as a limited liability company in 1988, and ownership of CIAL is now shared by Christchurch City Holdings Limited with 75% and the New Zealand Government with 25%. The companyâs vision is to be recognised as New Zealandâs leading tourist gateway.
Christchurch International Airport is a carbon neutral company and has received carboNZero certification from Landcare Research following a detailed measurement and analysis process. CIAL is the first airport company in the Southern Hemisphere to attain certified carbon neutral status and is the second carbon neutral certified airport company in the world.
Visit http://www.christchurchairport.co.nz for more information.
###
Chelsea Halliwell
Christchurch International Airport Limited

description.hltext_display: UniÃ³n de Juristas exige investigar a fondo a magistrados reprobados
description.content:
La activista social Marisela Escobedo, asesinada en Chihuahua, cuyo caso sigue generando reacciones de indignaciÃ³n en diversos sectores. Foto: OEM-Informex
OrganizaciÃ³n Editorial Mexicana
Manuel Carvallo / El Sol de MÃ©xico
Ciudad de MÃ©xico.- "Fue irregular, ilegal y sobre todo inmoral, lo que el Supremo Tribunal de Justicia del Estado de Chihuahua hizo al contratar a los magistrados del Tribunal Oral de Ciudad JuÃ¡rez, Rafael Boudid, Catalina Ochoa y NezahualcÃ³yotl ZÃºÃ±iga, pese a haber reprobado sus exÃ¡menes de calidad", asegurÃ³ el presidente de la UniÃ³n de Juristas de MÃ©xico (UJM), Eduardo Miranda Esquivel.
Tras darse a conocer que los tres magistrados del Tribunal Oral de Ciudad JuÃ¡rez que liberÃ³ al homicida Sergio Barraza, habrÃ­an fracasado en su examen para ser jueces del nuevo sistema de justicia en la capital de Chihuahua en el aÃ±o 2006, pero que pese a ello en JuÃ¡rez sÃ­ fueron contratados por el Supremo Tribunal de Justicia, el presidente de la UJM, exigiÃ³:
"Debe investigarse a fondo el proceso de selecciÃ³n y nombramiento de estos magistrados para determinar si se llevÃ³ a cabo conforme a la ley, pero sobre todo con honestidad".
Y continuÃ³: "En su caso, de encontrarse irregularidades, deberÃ¡n fincarle las responsabilidades civiles, administrativas y penales tanto a Rafael Boudid, Catalina Ochoa y NezahualcÃ³yotl ZÃºÃ±iga, como a quien indebidamente los contratÃ³".
ExigiÃ³ tambiÃ©n que a todos se les debe juzgar por los delitos de uso indebido del ejerciÃ³ del cargo y actos contrario a la administraciÃ³n de justicia.
Este caso, considerÃ³, que ademÃ¡s de las sanciones administrativas, civiles y penales a las que se hagan acreedores, tanto magistrados como quienes los contrataron, "deben exhibirse para el escarnio y repudio pÃºblico, ya que su actuaciÃ³n ya costÃ³ otra vida inocente mÃ¡s".
"Este caso de corrupciÃ³n, demuestra una vez mÃ¡s que en MÃ©xico las autoridades estÃ¡n cubiertas de corrupciÃ³n que trae consigo la tan daÃ±ina impunidad en la que mantienen hundido al pueblo", subrayÃ³ molesto.

description.hltext_display: Jeanne Phillips: Husband's sex life appears to involve only his TV remote
description.author: Jeanne Phillips
description.content:
Dear Abby: I'm pretty sure my husband is addicted to adult porn movies. We have several pornographic DVDs in the house, and I can tell when they have been moved. He denies he's watching them, so confronting him again will only make him more angry and possibly push him "underground." Our sex life, which used to be grand, has become almost nonexistent. Do you have any suggestions?
Suspicious in Florida
Dear Suspicious: Yes. Rather than accuse your husband of being a porn addict, start a discussion about what has happened to your sex life. He may need to be examined by his doctor to determine if his problem could be physical. If that isn't the case, then marriage counseling with a licensed therapist might help.
However, it doesn't seem likely to me that a man who views only "several" adult DVDs is a porn addict. Porn addicts are usually glued to their computers at every available spare moment.
Dear Abby: I am married for the second time and have two lovely stepsons in their early 20s. Recently they told me that my sister "Gloria" (age 55) had asked them to remove their shirts during a holiday event several years ago. They were teenagers at the time. She told them she wanted to "at least look since she couldn't touch."
For the record, Gloria has a history of poor impulse control. She takes medication for it and also to control her temper.
My relationship with my sister has always been contentious.
Should I stop having family gatherings? Should I ask other relatives to police her? How do I confront her about the many things she has done?
Vexed in Virginia
Dear Vexed: Because your sister seems unable to distinguish between what is and isn't appropriate behavior, have a talk with her and tell her what you expect from her before the next family gathering. I see little to be gained from a "confrontation."
If Gloria manages not to start trouble at the party, continue to include her. If not, no law says you must. If you don't, be prepared for questions about her absence and answer them directly and honestly.
Dear Abby: I am a woman who is wondering what to say when someone calls me "sir" on the phone. I have heard my voice recorded, and I don't think I sound like a man. Still, it happens. It makes me feel angry and mortified. What do I say?
"Ma'am" in Cinnaminson, N.J.
Dear "Ma'am": You should say, "For your information, I'm a woman." That should clear up any confusion.
Dear Abby: I recently had a dinner party in my condo. One of my guests brought along his new roommate. During the evening, the young man kept placing his foot on my coffee table and rubbing the sole of his shoe over the edge and corner.
After the party ended, I realized my coffee table had been damaged by what he did.
What is a polite way to tell someone to remove his or her foot from my table without causing a scene or embarrassing him?
Mitch in Chicago
Dear Mitch: Offer the person a footstool or something to place under the offending foot that would protect your table. Or, take an even more direct approach: "Please don't put your foot there because the finish on my coffee table is easily damaged."
Write Dear Abby at www.DearAbby.com or P.O. Box 69440, Los Angeles, CA 90069.

event_or_fact.property: she wanted to "at least look since she couldn't touch.
